post.Title: January Capacity Building Kicks off
post.Content:
The second edition of the USSSA Building Training has officially kicked off at Kibuli Secondary School.

The first Edition held in December 2022 had the training held in 5 different venues namely Kibuli SS (Football, Athletics, Volleyball, Netball, Media, Basketball and Handball) while Mbarara High School, Amus College Bukedea and Dr Obote College Lira hosted the football coaching and refereeing participants. The January training had given a chance to those who unable to attend the previous training to be part of this training.

The training has brought together over 300 participants in the disciplines of football, volleyball, netball, athletics, handball, basketball and media. The beginner training is being conducted by certified coaches and instructors.

The instructors include Fred Mugerwa Tabale, Netball Coach, Charles Mukiibi, Kavuma Lawrence are athletics coaches, Peter Fredrick Kirabo a FIBA referee instructor, Ahmed Hussein Head of Communications FUFA, Nicholas Natuhereza a Basketball to mention but a few.

The training that started on 28th January 2023 will go on until the 3rd of February 2023 is looking to equip 10000 participants across the country in the next 4 years.

post.Title: January capacity building successfully concluded at Kibuli SS
Buddo SS Basketball 3x3 teams preparing for Africa Schools Championship
post.Content:
The FEASSSA and Elite Games Basketball 3x3 champions are going on with their preparations at the school, both boys and girls will represent Uganda and East Africa. They will be joined by Cheptil and Kwanthanze Secondary schools who were crowned boys’ and girls’ volleyball champions respectively at the FEASSSA games in 2022.

The boys’ team is led by Captain Elly Mutabingwa who advised his teammates not to be afraid of the task at hand and also promised the Ugandans that a trophy will be brought home.

The boys team is comprised of Herbert Lumansi, Aaron Kuteesa, Elly Mutabingwa and Ethan Siima while the girls Auma Angel, Atukunda Daisy and Nakabugo Elizabeth are captained by Namyalo Christine.

‘It is going to be a tough one because it brings in the best in each country or region so we are going to have a run for our money’ Coach John Omondi.

The competition will be held in the Moroccan city of Casablanca from 26th February to 3rd March 2023.

The Africa School Sports Federation (FASS) organized event was postponed from November last year after the Hosts asked for more time.

Download

post.Title: Royal Giant High School triumphant, Amus College finish Third
post.Content:
CAF Pan Africa Schools Football Championship (CECAFA Zone) 2023:

Finals

Boys:

·      Royal Giants High School (Uganda) 0 (4) – 0 (2) Geda Royal S.S (Ethiopia)

Girls:

·      Fountain Gate (Tanzania) 3-0 Awaro S.S (Ethiopia)

Uganda’s Royal Giants High School and Tanzania’s Fountain Gate won the boys and girls’ respective categories in the 2023 CECAFA Zone CAF Pan Africa schools football competition in Dar-es-salaam city.

Royal Giants High School overcame Ethiopia’s Geda Royal S.S 4-3 in post-match penalties after normal time had ended goal-less during the boy’s final played at the Azam sports complex, Chamazi on Sunday, February 19, 2023.

The Mityana based school revenged the 4-0 defeat against the same opposition during the last group game.

At the semi-final level, they beat South Sudan’s Libya One whilst Geda Royal S.S were 3-1 winners over Ecofo Gasanda from Burundi.

In the girls’ final, Fountain Gate (Tanzania) defeated Ethiopia’s Awaro S.S 3-0 at the same venue.

To make it to final, Fountain Gate had smiled 3-0 past Kirmuzi MS of Rwanda.

Awaro SS eliminated Uganda’s Amus College School, Bukedea 2-0.

The top champions earned the top prize money (USD 100,000), a trophy apiece, gold medals and a treasured slot to the CAF Pan Africa schools’ finals in Morocco come April 2023.

The runners up (Geda Royal S.S and Awaro S.S) settled for silver medals and a cash prize of USD75,000.

Third place:

Amus College School Bukedea finished third in the girls’ category.

Shakira Logose netted the all-important goal in the second stanza of the closely contested duel against Kiramuzi MS (Rwanda).

Besides the bronze medals, the Ugandan school is also assured of a cash prize of USD 50,000 (at least Ug.shs 190,000,000).

Semi-final Results:

Boys:

·      Royal Giants (Uganda) 2-1 Libya One (South Sudan)

·      Geda Royal S.S (Ethiopia) 3-1 Ecofo Gasanda (Burundi)

Girls:

·      Awaro S.S (Ethiopia) 2-0 Amus College School Bukedea (Uganda)

·      Kiramuzi MS (Rwanda) 0-3 Front Gate (Tanzania

post.Title: Buddo SS,Tagy High Wakiso district football champions.
post.Content:
Buddo SS beat National Champions St. Marys Kitende in a slime 2-1 victory to defend Wakiso district football the Wakiso district football trophy in the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) qualifiers at Kabaka Kyabaggu Stadium in Wakiso.

Joseph Kizza and Denis Kisiriko were on target for champions Buddo SS whilst Abdul Nsereko netted for St. Mary’s Kitende.

In the semi-final, St. Mary’s Kitende eliminated Kawempe Royal College by 4-2 in penalties after a normal time 1-1 draw. Ali Wasswa and Abdul Nsereko scored for Kawempe and Kitende in the normal time respectively.

Unstoppable forward Kamiyat Nayigaga scored the only goal of the game to guide Taggy to their second consecutive trophy.

St. Noa Girls-Zana labored past Rines SS in the Semi-final, progressing to the final by a 4-2 penalty shootout win after a goalless normal time draw.

Kamiyat Nayigaga and Zaitun Namaganda scored for Taggy while Patricia netted for Wakiso Hill.

Buddo SS, Kitende, London College, STAHIZA, Kawempe Royal College will represent Wakiso district at the forthcoming USSSA National Schools boys football championship set to be held at Nyakasura School in Fort-Portal City, Kabalore district.

Whilst Taggy, St. Noa, Rines, Wakiso Hill, Fairway High School, Aiden College and God Cares qualified for USSSA Fresh Diary Games to be held in Mbarara.

post.Title: Buddo S.S Basketball girls’ team shines continentally
post.Content:
Buddo Secondary School Girls Basketball team (3x3) won the Africa schools’ basketball championship in Casablanca,Morocco.Uganda’s representatives overcame hosts Morocco 33-29 on aggregate over the two legs.In the first leg, Buddo S.S won 21-16 and narrowly succumbed

12-13 in the final game.

The team of four had several players; Elizabeth Nakabugo,Angella Auma , Christine Namyalo, and Happy Daisy Atukunda, coached by John Jevish Omondi who was assisted by Marion Atwegyeise.

The boys’ team fell short to two host schools from Morocco; 21-08 and 21-04 before further losing to Niger and Gabon opposition.

Morocco won the boys’ cluster as Kenya earned silver in Volleyball boys and a gold for the girls . Uganda’s delegation that was led by the Commissioner of Physical Education.

Team captain Namyalo attributed the victory to good preparations and teamwork ethic.

“We trained well prior to the tournament in Morocco. Special thanks to the players and our coaches, the school administration, USSSA, the government who made it possible for us. We played as a unit and this teamwork propelled us” Namyalo told reporters upon return home at Entebbe International Airport.

USSSA Chief Executive Officer Christopher Mugisha Banage hailed the victors for the brave performance on the continent, highlighting the value of great preparations by Buddo S.S,

USSSA, Ministry of Education and Sports and the National Council of Sports.

“I wish to salute the players of Buddo S.S for the courageous show in Morocco. In a special way, I thank the management of Buddo S.S, USSSA, Ministry of Education and Sports and the National council of sports’

In related news,USSSA Head  Justus Mugisha was voted as the President of the East zone and Christopher Mugisha Banage was elected among the assessors during Federation of Africa School Sports (FASS) General Assembly.

post.Title: BUDDO SS Basketball 3x3 Team in Casablanca,Morocco (VIDEO)
St. Mary's Kitende,Buddo SS lift Basketball trophies
post.Content:
St. Mary’s Kitende beat St. Noa Girls Secondary School-Zana in the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) basketball finals of Wakiso district/region 2023 qualifiers.

The game between the Entebbe road schools that ended 51-41 in favor of St. Mary’s was held at WAKISHA headquarters in Wakiso on 1st April.

St. Mary’s Kitende topped group A comprising of host Kisubi Mapeera, Trinity College Nabbingo and St. Peter’s Naalya to advance to quarter-finals.

In the quarter-final, 2022 champions Kitende eliminated Exodus College, Wakiso before they staged a spirited fight to register a slim 32-28 win against old rivals Buddo SS in the Semi-final to book a final date with St. Noa Girls' School.

The 2019 Wakiso district/region champions St. Noa Girls Secondary School-Zana topped group B.

In the quarter-final, St. Noa beat Watoto by 42-22 to storm regional consecutive final since 2019.

The Zana based side outclassed Trinity College Nabbingo in a landslide 36-6 semi-final to book date with St. Mary’s Secondary Boarding school.

This was the third consecutive Wakiso district/region final between the two sides. Kitende have come out victorious on two occasion coming in 2021 and 2023.

St. Mary’s came from three quarters down to dethrone the 2019 champions St. Noa by 51-41 final clash at WAKISHA headquarters in Wakiso City.

In the boys category, Buddo SS won by 52-41 against Mbogo Mixed to defend the title.

post.Title: JIPRA are Jinja District Football Champions.
post.Content:
Jinja Secondary School 1(2)- 1(4) JIPRA

Jinja Progressive Academy (JIPRA) win by 4-2 after penalty shootouts against Jinja SS to lift the district trophy.

The final between the two sides was held on Monday 4th April 2023 at Kakindu Stadium.

In a final that was played at Kakindu stadium in Jinja, the two sides played  to a 1-all draw during the normal time.

JIPRA through James Jarieko earned his side an early 2nd minute 1-0 lead before Jinja SS Reagan Isabirye leveled matter in the 31st minute. 

Jinja SS skipper Raymond Barasa expressed the game as a disappointing one and promised to bounce back stronger.

  • "I'm very disappointed because we aren’t used to losing. We are to go back to the drawing board and we shall bounce back stronger than before". He said.

In their road to the final, JIPRA topped group H with maximum (18) points scoring 15 times against their opponents to book round of 16 slot.

They beat St. Steven Budondo 4-0 in the round of 16 before another 4-0 win against Lubani in the quarter-final stage.

They won 4-2 against Lakeside SS to book a final date with Old rivals.

On the other hand, Jinja SS who led group A eliminated Jinja College (JICO) by 1-0 in the quarter-final before their 2-0 win against Jinja Comprehensive in the Semi-final.

JIPRA goalkeeper Adrian Isabirye was the hero with two penalty saves from Icon Jordon and Churchill Ochan’s shots.

Only John Owino and Alvin Wanume scored Jinja S.S’ kicks.

JIPRA’s Lookman Lwanga, Sowedi Lwenda, Sudice Ngobi and skipper Jarieko scored past goalkeeper Azizi Saleh.

Both JIPRA and Jinja S.S will represent Jinja district at the forthcoming Eastern region zonal championships due in Iganga district.

post.Title: Olila High, Amus College football teams excel in Teso Zone.
post.Content:
Teso Zone 2023 USSSA football championships:

Finals:

Boys: Amus College School 4-1 Alwa S.S

Girls: Olila High School 2-0 Bishop Maraka

Amus College School from Bukedea and Sorot's Olila High School won the boys and girls football titles respectively in the 2023 Teso Zone Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) championships on Easter Monday, April 10.

Amus College School humbled Alwa S.S from Kaberamaido 4-1 during the boy's final at Maraka S.S playground in Kumi district.

Lethal forward Allan Ayirwoth scored all Amus College's four goals during the well-attended final to take his personal4 tally to 8 as he also finished as the top scorer.

Tepa College from Ngora finished third overall to seal the final slot for the three schools that will represent Teso zone in the 2023 USSSA national boys’ finals that will be hosted in Fort Portal come May 2023.

"It is humbling to win the Teso zone coming after winning Bukedea district. Our focus is now to compete at the nationals" Nimrod Kintu, head coach at Amus College revealed

Girls' football:

Olila High School successfully defended their title as they beat Kumi’s Bishop Maraka S.S 2-0 in the final.

Olila will represent Teso Zone at the forthcoming nationals.

USSSA secretary general Christopher Mugisha led the top brass officials who witnessed the climax of the Teso zone football championships.

post.Title: Kakungulu hockey sides still going strong in Kampala
post.Content:
Kakungulu Memorial School hockey girls and boys were imperious in their meetings with City High School in the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) qualifiers for Kampala district held yesterday at Lugogo Astro-turf Grounds.
The qualifiers played in good sunny weather attracted these two schools with Old Kampala SS and Kololo SS among notable absentees from the sides that have taken part in past qualifiers.
First the Kakungulu girls led early in the fourth minute through captain Jolly Alimo's goal. Then doubled the lead through striker Brenda Achayo at the end of the first quarter.
City High fought back and pulled one back in the 29th minute through captain Janet Nakato only for Irene Nyapendi to go the other end and make it 3-1 at the stroke of halftime.
In the second half, Achayo and Alimo doubled their money in the 42nd and 43rd minute then Winnie Atim made it 6-1 at the start of the fourth quarter.
"I feel very happy that we are winning more games and returning to school with trophies," Alimo said.
"I urge my teammates to continue training and improving their talents. Hopefully, other teams can work harder too because the sport is about togetherness," Alimo added.
Floodgates 

For the boys, it was one way traffic as Kakungulu won 9-0.
City High looked like it would hold but James Larombi opened the scoring in the 10th minute. 
Then the floodgates opened in the second quarter where Larombi scored in the 17th and 29th minutes to complete a hattrick.
In between his goals were penalty corner conversations from Brian Ofoyimungu and Nicholas Lukwago in the 18th and 20th minutes respectively.
In the second half, Kakungulu scored twice in each quarter to complete the 9-0 rout. Hamis Gulume and Shafic Byamukama scored in the 32nd and 45th minutes while Larombi scored his fourth in the 58th minute shortly before Shafic Abdul converted another penalty corner at the death.
"We had a good game but even then you cannot say we did not make individual mistakes as players. We need to style up and take every game seriously," Larombi said.
City High skipper Sula Bwabye was frustrated that they "did not pile more pressure by sending more balls upfront" but still remained happy about their efforts and called on his colleagues "to train harder so that the next games are better."

post.Title: Kibuli SS, Nabisunsa Girls and Uganda Martyrs Lubaga win in Kampala District.
post.Content:
The 2023 Kampala region USSSA competitions came to a successful climax at Mengo Senior School on Thursday, 13th April.

Finals of football (boys and girls), Basketball (boys and girls) as well as Hockey (boys and girls) were held.

In boys’ football, Kibuli Secondary School emerged champions after a 2-0 victory over Uganda Martyrs’ High School, Lubaga.

Two second half goals from lethal forward Kenneth Kimera and Ivan Busuulwa saw Kibuli S.S victorious.

Kibuli S.S head coach Emuron Recoba saluted the hard work character from his players coupled with patience and determination for the victory that witnessed them reclaim the Kampala title after Kawempe Muslim’s win in 2022.

“We played like typical champions. We worked hard throughout, we were determined to succeed but patient as well. Focus now is for the upcoming nationals” Recoba stated moments after the final whistle.

Kampala region will be represented by Kibuli S.S, Uganda Martyrs’ High School – Lubaga, Kawempe Muslim, Old Kampala and debutants Mengo S.S at the USSSA national football championships at Nyakasura School in Fort Portal city.

In girls’ football final, Uganda Martyrs High School Lubaga edged Kawempe Muslim 1-0 with Catherine Naggadya the heroine.

Basketball:

Nabisunsa Girls school emerged top in girls’ basketball with the gold medal ahead of Kibuli S.S.

Kibuli S.S avenged in the boys’ gender, taking gold as Aga Khan settled for silver losing 62-36 and hosts Mengo S.S finished third to claim bronze.

Hockey:

Kakungulu Memorial won both boys’ and girls' hockey trophies ahead of City High school who took silver.

The closing ceremony was graced by Mr. Okanya Patrick ,President Emiritus USSSA and USSSA Executive commiittee members, Ayub Khalifa Kiyingi,Grace Viola Kyolaba, Alice Alwenyi and Eunice Openjuru. ,Mr. Ssebanakitta Nantagya ,the head teacher of Mengo SS and Kampala district zonal secretary alongside the Kampala zone executive committee.

The finals were televised live on FUFA Tv.

post.Content:

post.Title: 2023 Fresh Dairy USSSA Racquet and Bat games wind down.
post.Content:
The 2023 Fresh Dairy USSSA Racquet & Bat games qualifiers came to a climax down at Nabisunsa Girls school on sunday ,16th April,2023.

The games were successfully held over two days at Nabisunsa Girls school in Wakiso district.The included Tennis, Badminton and Table Tennis.

Qualified schools:

Twenty-four schools (12 per gender) in Badminton qualified to the national finals that will be held at Mbarara High school.

In Tennis, eighteen schools (10 boys and 8 girls) will play at the nationals while in Table Tennis, sixteen schools (eight per gender) made the grade for the national finals.

Table Tennis:

Under the boys’ category, Kibuli S.S and Namilyango College qualified from group A.

St Michael International and Mbogo Mixed were successful from group B.

In group C, St Andrew’s College Sanda and Caltec Academy qualified whilst Kawanda Secondary School and Mbogo College wee successful from group D.

Girls T.T:

Mbogo Mixed and Nabisunsa Girls (Group A), Mbogo High and Seeta High Mukono (Group B), Mbogo College and Kibuli S.S (Group C) as well as Kawanda S.S and St Michael International (Group D) all qualified.

Parvin Nangonzi and Jemimah Nakawala who represented Uganda at the 2022 Commonwealth Games in Birmingham were part of team Kibuli S.S.

Playing with Fortune Kimberly Katusiime, the Kibuli S.S trio attributed the success to great preparations.

Badminton:

The qualified boys’ teams are Kibuli S.S, Kinawa High Kawempe, Gombe S.S, St Michael International, Kawanda S.S, Kisaasi College School, Kakungulu Memorial School, Kings College Buddo, Lubiri SS, St Mary’s College Kisubi, St Michael Ssonde and Namilyango College.

The qualified schools for the girls are Mbogo High School, Lubiri S.S, Trinity College Nabbingo, Rubaga Girls, Gayaza High School, Mt St. Mary’s College Namagunga, Nabisunsa Girls, Kings College Buddo, Kawanda S.S, St Michael International, Mariam High School and St Michael Ssonde.

Tennis:

The ten schools (boys) that will play at the finals are Ntare school, Namilyango College, SMACK, Mengo S.S, Kings College Buddo, Kibuli S.S, Busoga College Mwiri, Kololo S.S, Kigezi High School and Bombo Army.

For the girls; the eight successful schools for Tennis at the nationals are; Nabisunsa Girls, Mt St Mary’s Namagunga, Mary Hill College, Mengo S.S, Kibuli S.S, Kings College Buddo, Gayaza High School and Old Kampala S.S.

The closing day was graced by the USSSA president Justus Mugisha and president Emeritus Patrick Okanya.

Mugisha lauded the different schools that have managed to assemble teams, preparing a pool of young talented players who are envisaged as the future for Uganda’s sport.

The Fresh Dairy Racket and Bat games alongside Hockey and Girls’ football will be played in Mbarara city (Ntare School as the host) between May 6th to 16th, 2023.

post.Title: USSSA team inspects facilities in Fort Portal ahead of national football competition.
post.Content:
In a bid to ensure tranquil organization of the national finals for the 2023 Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association football championships, a team of USSSA leaders embarked on the last inspection of facilities in the host city of Fort Portal, Kabarole.

The teams traveled to Fort Portal, Kabarole to ascertain the readiness of Nyakusura school in regards to the facilities for accommodation, playing fields and others.

The inspections commenced on Friday evening through to Saturday.

Being the rainy season in Fort Portal and the surrounding areas, the visit was important to see the grounds to access how much damage, or if they the grounds can still be playable even in the rainy seasons.

During the visits, over 10 grounds were visited to include Buhinga, Bukwali, St Leo’s Kyegobe, St Paul’s Major Seminary, St Mary’s Minor Seminary, St Peter & Paul Primary School field, Kitarasa playground, UTC Kichwamba 2 ground and the PTC Canon Apollo ground.

The recommended ones were Kichwamba A & B, Kitarasa, Nyakasura A &B, Canon Apollo, St Mary’s Minor Seminary and Bukwali.

The ones on standby are; St Leo’s A, St Peter & Paul Primary School, Major Seminary and Buhinga, if need be.

According to the USSSA Second Vice president and chairperson of the organizing committee, Okot P’Bitek, the inspection was a complete success.

Representing the president Justus Mugisha, the second vice president confirmed that Nyakasura is ready to host the different schools.

“We came to Nyakasura for the final inspection of facilities for a follow-up from the earlier visits. Our findings is that the school is ready to host the games almost 90 percent. We visited the play-grounds. We have over 10 playgrounds which are ready. We also checked on the accommodation facilities which are ready and I must say, we are set to receiving schools on the 7th May 2023. The remaining 10 percent is the work that the head teacher is doing on the ground within the remaining one week. I want to inform all Ugandans that we are ready to have the tournament and receive all the teams.

After the inspection process, there was a successful meeting held to brainstorm upon the findings and make key recommendations.

Rev Canon Balinda E. B Richardson, the head teacher Nyakasura School confirmed their readiness to host the championship given the full support of the school management, local community, local leaders and the broader Rwenzori region.

“I want to thank the Ministry of Education and Sports exceedingly for giving us the chance to host the school’s football championship. We are humbled that we have been able to receive a team from USSSA as they conducted the final inspection of facilities (playing venues, secretariat and accommodation, among others). We are ready to host the schools, thanks to the overwhelming support from the school management. We also have the support of the community, local leaders and the broader Rwenzori region. The remaining few areas that need urgent attention will be addressed in the remaining few days.” Rev. Canon Balinda stated.

Rev. Canon Balinda informed that the physical and human infrastructure is all well in place.

The tournament will start on the 7th to 20th May 2023.

A total of 64 schools have been confirmed to take part in this prestigious tournament whose defending champion is St Mary’s Kitende.

The top four schools will earn tickets to the FEASSSA Games that are due in Rwanda later this year where Uganda (Kibuli S.S) is the defending champion.

post.Title: National Draws for 2023 Football Championship held
post.Content:
This draw was presided over by Rev. Canon Duncans Mugumya (commissioner of Physical education and sports), USSSA president Emeritus Patrick Okanya, executive committee member Ayub Khalifan Kiyingi, USSSA staff, some schools’ representatives and the media.

Rev. Canon Mugumya congratulated the successful schools that managed to qualify for the national finals.

He lauded USSSA for the competence and transparency in organizing the qualifiers from the districts through to the zones until the national level.

President Emeritus Okanya notified the schools to stick to the formbook rules in a bid to have a tranquil championship.

There are 8 groups (A to H) with 8 teams each.

Schools start reporting at Nyakasura School, starting 6th May 2023.

The tournament will end on 20th May 2023.

St Mary’s Kitende from Wakiso region is the reigning champion.

post.Title: Fresh Dairy Secondary Games 2023, Day 1 Results.
Opening Ceremony:Fresh Dairy Secondary Games, 2023.
National Football Championship,day 1 results.
National Boys' Football Championship officially opened at Nyakasura,School.
post.Content:
The 2023 Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA)National boys’ football championship was officially opened at Nyakasura school playgrounds in Fort Portal, Kabarole on Wednesday, 10th May.

Hundreds of people braved the afternoon rains as the school students, officials and the general public converged at the Nyaksura school playground.

Hon. Peter Ogwang, the state minister for Education and Sports (Sports) was the chief guest during a ceremony also attended by the Commissioner of physical education and sports Rev. Canon Duncans Mugumya, USSSA officials led by president Justus Mugisha, students and other well-wishers.

A brass band led the procession of excited students before the official opening festivities took effect.

The guests were officially welcomed by the Nyakasura school community led by the head teacher, Rev Canon Balinda E. B Richardson.

“We warmly welcome you to Nyakasura school. This is a big honour to have the schools in Uganda hosted here for the national football championships. The preparations have moved on well and we remain on course to produce the best ever tournament” Rev. Canon Balinda revealed.

Hon. Ogwang lauded the ministry of education and sports, the host school (Nyakasura school), the different school management committees, officials, players for the collective work done.

The minister openly condemned the schools that use non-bonifide students in these games, a killer punch to the development of talents.

“We are openly against schools that use non-students in such games which denies the real students that would be taking part in such games. This is a practice that we are fighting openly and with the new upcoming law, there will be prosecution” he stated.

Mugisha, president of USSSA was full of praise for Nyakasura school for taking upon the onus to host the other schools in such a competition of over 60 schools.

“I am humbled for all the participating schools in this football competition. Let me take this opportunity to thank Nyakasura school, the local community in Kabarole and all agencies who have made this happen” Mugisha noted.

Nyakasura school won the official opening match, overcoming Sironko Progressive Academy 1-0 during a well contested duel played on a slippery surface after the afternoon rains.

Some of the group stage matches had been played in the morning before the official opening ceremony with many more coming up in the days ahead.

St Mary’s Boarding Secondary School – Kitende won the tournament in 2022, staged in West Nile, Arua city, hosted by Mvara Secondary School.

The top three schools will earn tickets to the FEASSSA Games that are due in Rwanda later this year where Uganda (Kibuli S.S) is the defending champion.

post.Title: National Football Championship Opening Ceremony in Pictures
Fresh Dairy Secondary games climax in Mbarara,Western Uganda.
post.Content:
The 2023 Fresh Dairy Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) games one successfully climaxed at Kakyeka stadium, Mbarara city on Monday, May 15.

The official closing ceremony proceeded the exciting girls’ football final between Amus College and St Noa Girls won by the former.

Ismail Mulindwa, the director of standards in the ministry of education and sports was the chief guest flanked by the commissioner ministry of education and sports Rev. Canon Duncans Mugumya.

Mulindwa lauded USSSA for the work well done in the development of sports talents for the different students, a key factor in the education process.

“I appreciate the work of USSSA for the job well done to help the students engage in sports and develop their talents. This is key in the education system as well as development of their talents which could be a way of living in future times” he said.

USSSA Executive committee members led by the president Justus Mugisha graced the well-attended climax at Kakyeka.

“I want to thank the different schools, Uganda head teachers’ association, the hosts (Ntare School and Mbarara High), the sponsors (Fresh Dairy), students, coaches, referees and umpires as well as the local community for the collective responsibility of making these games a success” Mugisha remarked.

The outstanding players (MVP’s) and top three schools were rewarded with medals and trophies for the work well done.

  • MVP: Allan Oyirwoth (Amus College School)
  • Top scorer: Abdulnoor Nsereko (St Mary’s S.S Kitende) – 11 Goals
  • Best Goalkeeper: Shamulan Kamya (Royal Giants High School)

St Mary’s Boarding Secondary School Kitende was crowned as champions for the 2023 Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) boys’ football championship in Fort Portal, Kabarole district.

The Wakiso giants overcame Masaka based St Henry’s Kitovu 1-0 at Nyakasura school playground on Saturday, 20th May 2023.

Habib Oloya connected home captain Justine Opiro’s long throw-in for the lone goal before a capacity crowd.

For the rest of the time, St Mary’s S.S Kitende defended wholesomely in numbers to thwart the attacks from St Henry’s Kitovu forwards Godfrey Ssekibengo and Denish Dramuke.

This was St Mary’s SS Kitende 12th national football title that their head coach Daniel Male attributed to early preparations, good team work and the overwhelming character from the school management.

“We commenced preparations quite early from the last time we won in Arua (2022). The players gave their best in unison and were committed. Also, the will power to support the team from the school management led by Dr Lawrence Mulindwa drove us further” Male who is deputized by Joackim Mukungu stated.

Fred Kasekende, the head coach at St Henry’s College Kitovu congragulated the winners, attributing the loss to inexperience.

“I want to appreciate the champions. We achieved to play in the final, our first ever and qualify for FEASSSA. We were abit naïve but one day, we shall lift the trophy” Kasekende remarked.

The closing ceremony was graced by a number of dignitaries to include the Commissioner Physical Education and sports Rev Canon Duncans Mugumya, the host head teacher Rev. Richardson Balinda, RCC Kabarole district, Association of Secondary Schools Head teachers Union (ASSHU) president Father Augustine Mugabo, USSSA president Justus Mugisha and the executive committee members and other staff, Kachumbali MP Hon. Patrick Isigai as well as other local area leaders.

Meanwhile, the third place play-off match between Amus College School and Royal Giant High School was won by the latter, 4-2.

That said, Royal High School Mityana from Mpigi zone scooped bronze and a slot to the 2023 FEASSSA Games in Huye city, Rwanda.

Individual top performers:

The most valuable player (MVP) of the tournament was Allan Oyirwoth from Amus College School.

The top scorer was Abdulnoor Nsereko (St Mary’s S.S Kitende) with 11 goals.

Royal Giant High School’s Shamulan Kamya was best goalkeeper.

A total of 64 schools took part in this year’s competition played upon an U-20 basis.

Semi-final Results:

  • St Mary’s Boarding SS Kitende 1 (5) – 1 (3) Amus College School
  • St Henry’s College Kitovu 1 (6) – 1 (5) Royal Giant High School Mityana

Quarter final Results:

  • Amus College School 3-1 Kibuli S.S
  • St Mary’s Boarding SS Kitende 2-1 Standard High Zzana
  • St Henry’s College Kitovu 1-0 West Ville High School
  • Buddo S.S 0-1 Royal Giant High School Mityana

 Round of 16 Results:

  • Kibuli S.S 4-1 Nkoma S.S
  • Amus College School 2-1 Mukono Kings
  • St Mary’s Kitende 6-0 Bishop Negri College
  • Standard High School Zzana 0 (5) – 0 (4) Kawempe Muslim S.S
  • Buddo S.S 3-0 Kigumba Royal College
  • Jinja Progressive Academy 1 (2) – 1 (4) Royal Giant High School
  • St Henry’s College Kitovu 4-1 London College Nansana
  • West Ville High School 0 (5) – 0 (4) St Joseph College Layibi

post.Title: Athletics trials held at Makerere Sports ground.
post.Content:
A seventeen day athletics training camp has been held at Old Kampala SS and Makerere University Sports grounds.

The camp held during the first term holiday had 76 participants at both primary and secondary levels. The partcipants at primary level were selected during the recently concluded primary schools championships that were held in Luweero.

Primary

13 Boys 10 Girls

Secondary

17 Boys 36 Girls

The best perfoming athletes will be selected to represent Uganda at the upcoming events both regionally and internationally.

post.Title: Uganda teams know opponents at ISF World School Football Championships.
post.Content:
• 2023 ISF World Schools’ Football Championship
  • 22nd and 31st July  - Rabat city, Morocco

Uganda’s three football teams have known their opponents at the 2023 ISF World Schools Football Championship slated for Morocco.

This was after the successful draws held in Rabat city, Morocco on Thursday, June 1, 2023.

For boy’s football, Amus College (Uganda 2) was drawn in group A alongside France, Chille 2 and Nepal.

The other Ugandan side, Kibuli Secondary School (Uganda 1) was drawn in group E alongside Qatar, China 1 and Cote D’Voire.

Kibuli S.S is the reigning boys’ football champions in FEASSSA Games.

Girls Football:

St Noa Girls Zzana was drawn in group D with opposition from hosts Morocco, Chile and England.

The tournament will be held in Morocco between 22nd and 31st July 2023.

Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) president Justus Mugisha graced these awards.

Mugisha is also the ISF Football Technical Committee president and the president of FEASSSA.

post.Title: Ayub Khalifah Appointed U-20 Women's Coach
post.Content:
📢 Exciting News! 📢

We are thrilled to announce that Ayub Khalifah has been appointed as the new coach of the U-20 Women's National Team by the Federation of Uganda Football Associations (FUFA). Congratulations, Ayub! 🎉

Ayub Khalifah brings a wealth of experience and expertise to this role. Not only is he a member of the USSSA Executive Committee, but he also serves as the Chairman of Technical and the Chairman of the Uganda Schools Football Association. With his deep understanding of the game and his commitment to nurturing young talent, we have no doubt that Ayub will excel in developing our U-20 Women's National Team.

Under Ayub's guidance, we can look forward to seeing our talented young players grow, learn, and showcase their skills on the international stage. This appointment reflects FUFA's dedication to promoting women's football and providing equal opportunities for all aspiring athletes.

Join us in welcoming Ayub Khalifah as the coach of the U-20 Women's National Team! Let's show our support and cheer on our future stars as they embark on this exciting journey. 🌟⚽️

FUFA #U20Women #Football #CoachingExcellence #WomenInSports

post.Title: Delegation To Inspect Venues in Kabale for USSSA Ball Games II Kabale 2023
post.Content:
Introduction: With a vision of fostering sports excellence and providing a platform for diverse athletic pursuits, a dedicated delegation of 18 members has embarked on a journey to Kabale. Their mission? To inspect venues for USSSA Ball Games II Kabale 2023 featuring a wide range of disciplines, including football, basketball, netball, volleyball, rugby, handball, lacrosse, athletics, dance sport, beach soccer, beach volleyball, and wood ball. The prestigious St Mary's College Rushorooza will serve as the host venue for this year's edition, scheduled from 9th to 18th July 2023.

Unveiling the Sports Lineup: The delegation's journey is brimming with excitement as they explore the potential of St Mary's College Rushorooza's venues for the upcoming school sports events. Participants and spectators alike can look forward to an action-packed program, spanning various sports disciplines that cater to different interests and talents.

  1. Football U14 and U16: Young football enthusiasts will showcase their skills in the U14 and U16 categories. These matches promise a display of budding talent and friendly competition, setting the stage for the future stars of the game.
  2. Basketball 3x3: Fast-paced and dynamic, basketball 3x3 will captivate audiences as teams battle it out on the court. The format's intensity and strategy will leave spectators on the edge of their seats, witnessing thrilling displays of athleticism.
  3. Netball: Known for its precision and teamwork, netball offers a compelling display of strategic play. The delegation's focus on finding the perfect venue for this popular sport reflects the commitment to providing a conducive environment for netball enthusiasts.
  4. Volleyball: Kabale's volleyball enthusiasts will have the opportunity to shine as talented players take to the court. The delegation's inspection aims to identify venues that meet the requirements of this fast-paced and highly competitive sport.
  5. Rugby 7s: Rugby enthusiasts can anticipate a showcase of speed, strength, and teamwork as players battle it out in the Rugby 7s category. The delegation's efforts to identify suitable venues highlight their dedication to promoting this thrilling sport.
  6. Handball, Lacrosse, Athletics, and Dance Sport: The delegation's commitment to inclusivity extends to sports such as handball, lacrosse, athletics, and dance sport. By accommodating these disciplines, they create an environment that encourages participation and celebrates diverse talents.
  7. Beach Soccer and Beach Volleyball: Kabale's picturesque setting provides the perfect backdrop for beach soccer and beach volleyball. Spectators can soak up the sun while witnessing exhilarating matches on sandy shores, making for a truly memorable experience.
  8. Wood Ball: Wood Ball, a sport that combines elements of croquet and golf, adds a unique and exciting dimension to the lineup. The delegation's exploration includes venues suitable for this intriguing sport, ensuring a well-rounded event.

Conclusion: As the delegation tirelessly explores St Mary's College Rushorooza's venues, their mission to host USSSA Ball Games II from 9th to 18th July 2023 takes shape. From football and basketball to netball, volleyball, rugby, and more, this grand sports extravaganza promises to captivate athletes and spectators alike. With St Mary's College Rushorooza as the host venue, participants can look forward to showcasing their talents and fostering a spirit of friendly competition. The delegation's meticulous efforts guarantee an event that embraces inclusivity, promotes sporting excellence, and creates lasting memories for all involved.

post.Title: Press Brief: USSSA Confirms St Mary's College is Ready to Host National Ball Games II Championships
post.Content:
For Immediate Release; Kabale, Uganda - The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA), in collaboration with the Association of Secondary Schools Head Teachers in Uganda (ASSHU) and the Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES), is thrilled to announce the upcoming Secondary School National Ball Games II Championship. The championship will take place at St Mary's College Rushorooza in Kabale District, Kigezi Zone, Western Uganda, from 9th to 18th July 2023.

The Secondary School National Ball Games II Championship is a highly anticipated annual event that brings together schools from various parts of the country to compete in a range of sports disciplines. This year's championship promises to be even more exciting as it introduces new sports categories, including Football U14, Beach Soccer, Lacrosse, and Beach Volleyball.

The championship will feature a diverse lineup of sports disciplines, allowing both boys and girls to showcase their skills and sportsmanship. Participants will compete in Football U14/U16, Netball, Athletics and Cross Country, Handball, Basketball 3x3, WoodBall, Volleyball, DanceSport, Rugby 7s, Football U14, Beach Soccer, Lacrosse, and Beach Volleyball.

One notable highlight of the championship is the Football U14 category, where all participating school teams will have the opportunity to qualify for the CAF African School Championship in 2024, amplifying the stakes for this age group.

The USSSA, ASSHU, and MoES have conducted a meticulous final inspection of accommodation and competition venues and facilities from Sunday, June 11th, to Tuesday, June 13th, 2023. The inspection team, consisting of representatives from various education and sports bodies, evaluated St Mary's College Rushorooza and other selected venues, ensuring they meet the required standards for the championship. The Inspection Delegation

Composition of the inspection team

  1. Ministry of Education and Sports
  2. ASSHU and Western Leaders,
  3. USSSA Executive Committee,
  4. USSSA Secretariat
  5. FUFA Representative
  6. Kabale District Local Leadership
  7. District Sports Officer,
  8. USSSA Technical Committee Commission,
  9. Zonal Leadership,
  10. Chairpersons of Local organizing committees 

Accommodation for the participants has been allocated at St Mary's College Rushorooza for girls, while boys will be accommodated at St Maria Gorreti Primary School and St Theresa Primary School.

The competition venues have been carefully selected to ensure optimal playing conditions and spectator experience. The venues include Kigezi College Butobere 1, Bubare Play Ground, Kigezi High School, Ndorwa Primary School, St Paul Seminary Kabale, National Teachers College (NTC) 1 - Kabale, Hombe Primary School, Kabale Municipal Stadium, Kabale University Play Grounds, Kigezi High School Kabale Lower, and St Mary's College Rushorooza.

The USSSA, ASSHU, and MoES express their gratitude to the local leadership in Kabale, including the District Sports Officer, for their support and collaboration in making the championship a success.

For more information and updates on the Secondary School National Ball Games II Championship, please visit the official USSSA website (www.ussaonline.com) and follow their social media handles @SeniorUganda on Twitter and USSSA - Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association on Facebook and YouTube USSSA TV

post.Title: New Online Registration Fee for Ball Games II 2023
post.Content:
Dear Secondary School Sports Stakeholders,

We are pleased to announce that during a recent meeting between the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) Top Executive Committee and the National Association of Secondary Schools Head teachers' in Uganda (ASSHU) Executive Committee on 13th June 2023, a decision was made to revise the charges for online registration for the upcoming Ball Games II 2023.

In order to ensure maximum participation and inclusivity, it has been resolved to reduce the online registration fee from Ush. 5000 to Ush. 3000 per participant. This revision aims to make it more affordable for schools to register their players and enable a larger number of schools to participate in the Games.

We understand the importance of providing equal opportunities for all schools to engage in sports and showcase their talent. By reducing the registration fee, we hope to encourage more schools to actively participate in the Ball Games II 2023 and contribute to the vibrant sporting atmosphere that promotes healthy competition and camaraderie among students.

Refunds for Previously Registered Players:

For schools that have already registered their players for the championship at the previous fee of Ush. 5000, we assure you that refunds will be processed accordingly. Our team will reach out to the respective schools to facilitate the refund process and ensure a seamless transition to the revised fee structure.

We extend our sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused by this change, and we appreciate your understanding and support as we strive to create an inclusive and accessible sporting environment for all schools.

We remain committed to the development of secondary school sports and fostering a spirit of fair play, teamwork, and excellence among our student-athletes. The USSSA and ASSHU are dedicated to organizing high-quality championships that provide a platform for young talents to showcase their skills and represent their schools with pride.

Thank you for your continued support and participation in the secondary school sports programs. We look forward to your active involvement in the Ball Games II 2023 and witnessing the remarkable achievements of our student-athletes.

Yours faithfully,

Mugisha Christopher Banage

Chief Executive Officer

Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA)

post.Title: Federation Representative Inspects Venues for USSSA Ball Games II Championship
post.Content:
Date: 14th June 2023

In preparation for the highly anticipated USSSA Ball Games II Championship, Mutyaba Bashir, the representative of the Federation of Ugandan Football Associations (FUFA), visited the proposed venues to ensure they meet the necessary requirements for hosting the tournament. As part of the USSSA program, the championship will feature various sports disciplines, including football, with four categories catering to different age groups and genders.

Football enthusiasts can expect thrilling matches in the Under 16 boys and girls categories, as well as the Under 14 boys and girls categories. Notably, the Under 14 tournament holds additional significance as it will serve as a qualifying event for the teams that will represent Uganda in the CAF African Schools Championship, organized by the Council for East and Central Africa Football Associations (CECAFA) at the Zonal levels. This presents a golden opportunity for young Ugandan talents to make their mark on the continental stage.

Yesterday, Mutyaba Bashir, accompanied by a team of officials, conducted an inspection of the potential venues where the matches will take place. The team was pleased to identify approximately eight suitable pitches that have the potential to provide an excellent playing experience for the participating teams and fans. However, they also observed some minor areas that require attention to ensure optimal playing conditions.

Expressing optimism, Mutyaba Bashir stated, "I believe that the local organizing committee will be able to address the minor areas that need improvement. Their dedication and commitment to delivering a top-notch tournament are evident, and I have full confidence that the pitches will be ready to host the matches come 9th of July."

Mutyaba noted

The inspection serves as an essential step in guaranteeing that the participating teams will have a fair and safe environment to showcase their skills and compete for glory. The USSSA Ball Games II Championship aims to foster a spirit of fair play, teamwork, and excellence among the student-athletes while providing them with an opportunity to grow and develop their talents.

With the championship drawing near, excitement is building among sports enthusiasts across the nation. The event promises not only thrilling matches but also an atmosphere of camaraderie and healthy competition among the participating schools.

As the local organizing committee works diligently to address the minor areas identified during the inspection, all stakeholders eagerly await the opening day of the championship. Ugandan youth football is poised to take center stage, and the nation is ready to witness the remarkable skills and passion of its young athletes.

Stay tuned for more updates on the USSSA Ball Games II Championship as we countdown to the exhilarating kickoff on the 9th of July.

post.Title: Ministry of Education and Sports Commends Preparations for USSSA Ball Games II
post.Content:
Date: 15th June 2023

Grace Abalo, a senior education officer in the Department of Physical Education and Sports, representing the Commissioner of Physical Education and Sports, expressed her gratitude and honored presence at the upcoming USSSA Ball Games II Championship. As a ministry, they consider the championship a vital sector program firmly embedded in the national sports calendar. The journey began last year with the pre-qualification of the host venue, and today, they stand impressed by the remarkable progress.

Abalo took the opportunity to commend the leadership of Kabale District, both in the municipality and the district, including the political and technical teams present. Acknowledging the importance of the event, which will welcome over six thousand children from all over the country, Abalo highlighted the dedication and responsibility the ministry places on programs involving learners. The involvement of numerous schools, officials, and political leaders demonstrates the significance of the championship.

The Ministry of Education and Sports has been actively engaged in every stage of the program, starting from the pre-qualification to witnessing the final preparations. Abalo assured the participants that the ministry would remain present throughout the championship, ready to face any challenges that may arise. Emphasizing the value of teamwork, she applauded the presence of the National Federation, acknowledging their technical expertise and the crucial role they play in making informed decisions.

The collaboration between the ministry, USSSA, and ASSHU has yielded positive results, evident in the continuous improvement of the games over the years. Abalo extended gratitude to USSSA and ASSHU for their financial support, as the activities are primarily funded through participation fees collected from schools. She commended the teachers for their efforts in making the championship possible and ensuring its success.

While celebrating the upcoming event, Abalo emphasized the importance of security, particularly considering the large number of children involved and the proximity of the venue to the border. The ministry is keen on ensuring the safety and security of all participants, and the presence of security personnel will play a crucial role in maintaining a safe environment.

As the USSSA Ball Games II Championship approaches, excitement fills the air, and the Ministry of Education and Sports stands alongside the organizers, ready to witness the remarkable skills and talents of the young athletes. The dedication and teamwork demonstrated by all stakeholders serve as a testament to the success of this esteemed event.

Grace Abalo, the senior education officer, expressed her enthusiasm for the USSSA Ball Games II Championship, stating, "We are truly indebted to be a part of this remarkable event. As a ministry, we take great pride in supporting programs that involve our learners. We commend the local leadership and the teams behind the scenes for their outstanding efforts. Together, we will ensure the success of this championship and create a safe and memorable experience for all the participants."

post.Title: Police Assures Smooth Execution of Duties for USSSA Ball Games II Championship
post.Content:
Kabale District, Uganda - As the much-anticipated USSSA Ball Games II Championship draws closer, the Uganda Police Force has reaffirmed its commitment to ensuring the safety and security of participants, spectators, and the community as a whole. In a recent statement, the police emphasized their core mandate of protecting life, and property and maintaining social law and order.

"Our mandate, our core mandate as police is to protect life and property and to maintain the social law and order. And for this very purpose, we want to assure you that we are more than ready," stated a police representative. The commitment to carrying out their duties diligently and effectively was emphasized, giving the stakeholders and participants confidence in the police's ability to handle any security-related matters.

Highlighting the importance of teamwork and adherence to agreed-upon guidelines, the police representative requested cooperation from all involved parties. "In most cases, when among the officials they have differences. You know, these are games, these are competitions, at times they have issues that need to be sorted out today and then. Under such circumstances, we expect everybody to be cooperative. Let's work together as a team, let's be cooperative," added the representative.

Recognizing the potential challenges that may arise during the event, the police expressed their readiness to address any issues promptly and efficiently. Their presence and vigilance will be crucial in ensuring the safety of the estimated 6,000 children and all participants, considering the proximity to the border and the importance of maintaining a secure environment.

The collaboration between the police force and other stakeholders, including event organizers, school authorities, and the local community, is instrumental in creating a safe and successful championship. By working together, they aim to mitigate any potential disruptions and uphold the spirit of fair play and sportsmanship throughout the tournament.

As the countdown to the USSSA Ball Games II Championship continues, the community can rest assured that the Uganda Police Force is fully prepared and dedicated to upholding their responsibilities. With their unwavering commitment to maintaining security and order, participants and spectators can look forward to a memorable and incident-free sporting extravaganza.

The championship is set to kick off on July 9th, showcasing the talents and passion of young athletes from various schools across the country. With the police taking a proactive stance in ensuring a safe environment, the focus can remain on the thrilling competitions and the spirit of camaraderie that unites the participants.

post.Title: Historic Moment as Lacrosse Takes Center Stage at USSSA Ball Games II Championship
post.Content:
Kabale, Uganda - Excitement is in the air as the USSSA Ball Games II Championship gears up to showcase a groundbreaking addition to its lineup of sports. For the first time in the history of secondary school games in Uganda, lacrosse will be featured, and the anticipation among players and fans is palpable. This significant milestone marks the growth and development of the sport since its inception in Uganda in 2019.

Kirinya Isaac, a proud representative of the lacrosse community in Uganda, expressed his enthusiasm for this momentous occasion. "We are so excited for the game to be considered as part of the games in the Ball Games II Championship here in Cavalry. The game being played in Cavalry signifies that it's the first place where the game is being played in a secondary school game since its inception in Uganda in 2019," shared Isaac.

Uganda holds the distinction of being the pioneer of lacrosse in Africa, and this inclusion in the championship opens up immense possibilities for the sport's growth and recognition. The decision to include lacrosse reflects the commitment of organizers to promote diversity and provide opportunities for different sporting disciplines to flourish.

The participation of lacrosse in the USSSA Ball Games II Championship is not only a moment of pride for the players but also a testament to the dedication and hard work put in by the entire lacrosse community in Uganda. The sport has steadily gained popularity, attracting enthusiastic athletes and garnering support from various stakeholders.

"We believe that us playing such games gives us a huge, huge dimension of growth for the game," added Isaac, emphasizing the significance of this opportunity for the sport's expansion and development. Lacrosse's inclusion in the championship will expose more young athletes to the sport, fostering a deeper understanding and appreciation for its unique gameplay and cultural significance.

As lacrosse takes its place alongside other traditional sports in the championship, it opens doors for aspiring players to showcase their skills and compete on a larger stage. This exposure will not only benefit the individual athletes but also contribute to the overall growth and recognition of lacrosse in Uganda and across the African continent.

The USSSA Ball Games II Championship in Cavalry will witness the historic debut of lacrosse in secondary school games, adding an exciting new dimension to the tournament. The enthusiasm and anticipation surrounding this development highlight the growing passion for the sport and its potential to become a prominent fixture in the country's sporting landscape.

The championship is set to unite athletes, spectators, and sports enthusiasts from various disciplines, creating an atmosphere of camaraderie, sportsmanship, and cultural exchange. As lacrosse makes its mark on this grand stage, it paves the way for future opportunities, inspiring generations of young players and propelling the sport to new heights.

The USSSA Ball Games II Championship promises to be a memorable event, showcasing the rich diversity of sports in Uganda and celebrating the country's pioneering role in introducing lacrosse to the African continent. With each game played, the passion and determination of the players will serve as a testament to the sport's enduring spirit and the bright future that lies ahead.

post.Title: St. Mary's College Rushorooza Gears Up to Host USSSA Ball Games
post.Content:
Rushorooza, Uganda - The vibrant atmosphere at St. Mary's College is abuzz with anticipation as the school prepares to host the prestigious USSSA Ball Games. In a press conference held at the college, officials expressed their warm welcome to all participants and affirmed their readiness to ensure a successful event.

"We wish to welcome all of you to St. Mary's College and, at the same time, welcome you to this press conference as St. Mary's College. We accept the host role officially, and we are more than ready," announced the school HM St Mary's College.

With meticulous planning and coordination, St. Mary's College has made extensive arrangements to provide a seamless experience for the participating schools and institutions. The co-hosting institutions include Kabale University, Kabale NTC, Kabale UCC, Kigezi High School, Kigezi High School Primary, Kigezi College Butobere, Kabale Municipal Stadium, St. Paul's Seminary, St. Maria Gorreti Secondary, St. Theresa Girls Primary, Hombe High School Primary, Hombe High School Secondary, Rubale Secondary, and St. Teresa Primary, among many others.

The college has formed dedicated committees responsible for the welfare and care of the participating learners. The arrangements encompass their accommodation, meals, and overall well-being. "We plan to feed them very well. Of course, we are prepared. We shall provide them with excellent meals, including posho, rice, matoke, meat, and nutritious snacks," assured Christopher Monday, HM St Mary's College.

Safety and security have been given utmost priority, with close collaboration with relevant authorities. The involvement of the District Commissioner (DC) and the District Police Commander (DPC) underscores the concerted efforts to ensure a secure environment for all attendees. Health and sanitation measures have also been diligently addressed, including the provision of adequate sanitation facilities and access to clean water.

Transportation facilities have been arranged to facilitate smooth movement within the venue and surrounding areas. The hosting schools generously provided playgrounds for the games, ensuring that participants have suitable venues for their respective sports.

"We have planned meticulously for our duties, and we have extended our reach even to Rwanda District. We believe that the entire Kigezi region will benefit from this event, including the hotel fraternity, food and beverage vendors, and various other sectors," expressed the representative, highlighting the positive impact the championship will have on the local economy.

The event aligns with the Ministry of Education and Sports' vision of holistic development for learners. Sports and games play a vital role in physical and psychological development. The college acknowledges the support and guidance of Mama Janet Museveni, who leads the Ministry, and emphasizes the importance of teamwork to achieve success.

As St. Mary's College Rushorooza prepares to host the USSSA Ball Games, the excitement continues to build. The commitment and dedication of the organizing team, combined with the collaborative efforts of stakeholders, promise an exceptional experience for all participants. The road to success lies in unity and mutual support, and the college is poised to create an unforgettable event that will leave a lasting impression on the participating schools, the Kigezi region, and the entire sporting community.

post.Title: National Organizing Committee Ready to Deliver Memorable Ball Games II Championship
post.Content:
Rushorooza, Kigezi - The National Organizing Committee for the USSSA Ball Games II Championship expressed their satisfaction after conducting a thorough inspection of the facilities and preparations for the upcoming event. The Chairman of the Committee extended gratitude to all stakeholders for their invaluable contributions and outlined the high expectations for the championship.

"We have completed our inspection, and we are pleased with the efforts put forth thus far. Thank you so much to everyone involved. We are immensely grateful for the journey we have undertaken," stated the Committee Chairman, Hajji Twahil Kitezeela

Uganda, known as the Champion of East Africa, recognizes the significance of these games as qualifiers for the Fiasa Games scheduled for August this year. The country's youth have already gained international exposure through engagements in Slovakia, Serbia, France, and emerging triumphant. The Chairman expressed gratitude to the government for their support and financial extensions, ASSHU for their financial assistance to schools participating in national events, and ASU for their continued support.

Acknowledging the crucial role of headteachers, the Chairman commended their dedication and acknowledged St. Mary's Rushorooza and its partners for hosting the event. The Committee also expressed appreciation for the assurance of security provided by the relevant authorities.

"Now, as the organizing committee, we commit ourselves to deliver a successful championship. We promise to fulfill our responsibilities," declared the Chairman.

However, before the championship begins, the Chairman emphasized the expectations of the spectators and participants. The Ball Games II is a significant event, which is why the committee chose the Kigezi region, particularly Rushorooza, as the host. The Chairman highlighted the region's capability to handle the challenge and emphasized the importance of showcasing the renowned hospitality and culinary prowess of Kigezi, known as the food basket of Uganda.

"We are aware of the immense fan base and the enthusiasm for sports in this region. With over 6,000 participants, excluding officials, and countless fans, it is essential to plan accordingly. We aim for a memorable championship, with all eyes set on Kigezi. And I have no doubt that Kigezi has never disappointed. We sincerely wish you a wonderful championship and assure you that we will deliver on all aspects," concluded the Chairman.

As the anticipation builds, the National Organizing Committee remains committed to ensuring a seamless and unforgettable experience for all participants, officials, and spectators. The success of the championship rests on the collaborative efforts of all stakeholders, and the committee's dedication to delivering a memorable event will undoubtedly leave a lasting impact on the sporting landscape of Uganda.

post.Title: St. Mary's College Rushoroza Declared Ready to Host Ball Games II
post.Content:
Rushorooza, Kabaale - An assessment was conducted to determine the readiness of St. Mary's College of Rushorooza to host the highly anticipated Ball Games II. This event is considered the biggest in our activity, involving a significant number of students, officials, and various disciplines.

Recognizing the magnitude of the event, the organizing committee left no room for chance and visited St. Mary's Rushorooza to evaluate its preparedness. The college had previously submitted a bid in November, which was successfully qualified for hosting. This visit aimed to ensure that all the necessary arrangements were in place.

"I am pleased to announce that St. Mary's Rushorooza has done an outstanding job and deserves a round of applause," stated the CEO USSSA - Christopher Mugisha Banage. The burden of hosting such a grand event falls on the shoulders of the entire school, and their efforts have not gone unnoticed.

USSSA CEO - Christopher Mugisha Banage

The Ball Games II will feature an array of disciplines, including football for under 14 and under 16 boys and girls, basketball 3 by 3 for both genders, volleyball, handball, rugby 7s, athletics for both boys and girls, dance sports, woodball, and lacrosse. Notably, netball stands out as the highlight of the championship.

With over 400 teams and approximately 6,000 participants from different districts across the country, the event will bring an unprecedented level of excitement to Kabaale. Furthermore, it will attract sports enthusiasts who wish to spectate and explore the vibrant city.

The venues scattered throughout Kabaale have been evaluated and deemed in good shape. However, additional support is required to ensure that the competition venues meet the required standards and become a source of pride for the young participants.

The ASSHU Kabaale district expressed their commitment to collaborating with the entire school to ensure the success of the games. While the participating schools have been advised on their responsibilities, the final implementation phase will require tremendous support.

In a press conference held to reassure the nation of St. Mary's College's readiness, the representative extended an invitation to the headteacher to provide assurance of the school's preparedness.

"I am confident in announcing that St. Mary's College of Rushorooza is fully prepared to host the games," affirmed Chris Mugisha.

Chris Mugisha Banage - CEO USSSA

With the assurance of St. Mary's College's readiness, the spotlight now turns to the collaborative efforts of all stakeholders to ensure the event's success. The upcoming Ball Games II not only promises a thrilling sporting experience but also an opportunity for Kabaale to showcase its vibrant atmosphere and hospitality to visitors.

As the countdown to the championship begins, it is expected that the efforts invested by St. Mary's College and the collective support of the community will create an unforgettable event, leaving a lasting legacy in the world of sports in Kabaale.

post.Title: Buganda Schools Cup Launched: A Journey Towards Sports Brilliance and Youth Empowerment
post.Content:
On the 15th of June 2023, a momentous event took place as the Buganda Schools Cup was officially launched, marking the beginning of another chapter in school sports in the region. The ceremony, held at Bulange, witnessed the presence of notable guests, officials, and sports enthusiasts who gathered to witness the inauguration of a tournament aimed at promoting integrity, football development, and healthy competition among schools.

The proceedings commenced with a captivating presentation delivered by the first vice president of the Federation of Uganda Football Associations (FUFA) and president of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) Justus Mugisha. His address centered on the crucial need to enhance the integrity of school tournaments by ensuring that players participating in these competitions are of the appropriate age and genuine students of their respective schools. This emphasis on fair play and authenticity will undoubtedly contribute to the overall development of football in Uganda.

"I am deeply honored to launch the Buganda Schools Cup today, with a strong focus on enhancing the tournament's integrity. It is crucial that players are of the right age and genuine students, as this will contribute to the overall development of football in our nation," stated the first vice president of FUFA and president of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association.

Justus Mugisha

As the first vice president of FUFA and president of USSSA, he expressed his unwavering commitment, along with the support of both organizations, to ensure the successful execution of the Buganda Schools Cup. This collaboration between Buganda, FUFA and USSSA is of paramount importance in realizing the shared vision for the tournament and its impact on football development.

Recognizing the significance of collective strength, Mugisha emphasized the need to strengthen all aspects of the tournament, leaving no room for weak points. By prioritizing professionalism, fairness, and integrity in areas such as player registration and match officiating, the Buganda Schools Cup aims to set a high standard for school sports in the region.

"Buganda, FUFA and USSSA are committed to working together to ensure a tournament free from weak points, as a strong chain requires strengthening every aspect," Mugisha added.

The Buganda Schools Cup not only serves as a platform for showcasing the exceptional sports talent of young players but also as a catalyst for character development, sportsmanship, and camaraderie. Through this tournament, participants will have the opportunity to display their skills, compete at a high level, and kindle their passion for the beautiful game.

The impact of the Buganda Schools Cup extends beyond the boundaries of the tournament itself. It provides a gateway for talent identification, giving young players the chance to dream big and pursue a future in professional football. By fostering an environment that nurtures growth and opportunity, the tournament aspires to contribute to the broader success and progress of football in Buganda and Uganda as a whole.

The organizers expressed their gratitude to all the schools, coaches, parents, officials, and sponsors who play a pivotal role in making the Buganda Schools Cup a reality. Their unwavering support and dedication are invaluable in creating an exceptional experience for the participating students.

"We have launched the schools' sports today, marking a significant moment in our calendar. Our focus this year is to revive these competitions and ensure active participation from schools across the Buganda kingdom," stated Owek. Henry Sekabenbe. "We are forming a committee to investigate the necessary steps for bringing schools back into the competition, building sponsorships, and emphasizing discipline and humanity as fundamental pillars of sports development," Owek. Henry Sekabenbe added. "These school competitions play a crucial role in strengthening all levels of sports in Uganda, creating a chain link from schools to leagues and age groups. Let us pray for the success of the most prepared schools in this year's competitions," Owek. Henry Sekabenbe concluded

With the official launch concluded, the anticipation for the forthcoming matches and the profound impact they will have on the lives of the young participants continues to grow. The Buganda Schools Cup not only symbolizes excellence on the games field but also embodies the values of unity, sportsmanship, and pursuit of greatness.

"We are excited to launch the Kabaka Cup, Buganda Cup, and Nabagereka Cup, catering to primary and secondary schools, as well as girls' primary schools," shared Hajji Sekabira Abdul Lukooya, head of sports in Buganda schools. "It is an honor to have the presence of FUFA's 1st vice president and Hon. Minister Henry Sekabembe to inaugurate this year's edition," he added.

The Buganda Schools Cup has arrived, and it promises to be a celebration of football, camaraderie, and personal growth. Let the games begin, and may the best-prepared schools triumph in

"With the participation of numerous schools expected, we have already secured all the trophies. The winning school will also be rewarded with a bull. We are confident that this year's edition will be bigger and better, and we urge schools to join us," said Hajji Sekabira. "Next week, schools will begin competing in various games such as woodball, basketball, volleyball, handball, and football for both boys and girls. The draws will determine which schools will kick off the tournament," he concluded.
