post.Title: USSSA Condoles with the Victims of Terrorist Attack on Lhubirira Secondary School
post.Content:
Date: 17th June 2023

Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) expresses its heartfelt condolences to the family members, relatives, friends, and the entire school community affected by the recent terrorist attack on Lhubirira Secondary School in Mpondwe, located just 2 kilometers from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) border. The attack, carried out by ADF rebels, has left the nation in shock and mourning.

In the horrifying incident that unfolded last night, the Uganda Police reported a terrorist attack on Lhubirira Secondary School. The rebels set fire to a dormitory and looted a food store within the school premises. The consequences of this senseless act of violence have been devastating. To date, the authorities have recovered the bodies of 25 victims from the school, which have been transferred to Bwera Hospital. Additionally, eight individuals remain in critical condition and are receiving urgent medical attention at the same hospital.

Following the attack, the Uganda People's Defense Force (UPDF) and the police have launched a joint operation to apprehend the perpetrators. The pursuit is currently underway towards the Virunga National Park. The security forces are determined to bring those responsible for this heinous act to justice.

During this time of immense grief and sorrow, USSSA stands in solidarity with the families who have lost their loved ones and extends prayers and thoughts to those who have been injured. The association acknowledges the profound impact this tragedy has had on the affected community and offers its support and condolences to all those affected.

USSSA urges the government, security agencies, and the public to prioritize the safety and security of educational institutions across the country. Measures must be put in place to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future, ensuring that students can learn and thrive in a safe environment.

As more details of the attack emerge, Uganda Police will provide updates and further information to the public. In the meantime, the association calls upon the nation to unite, offering support and strength to those affected by this tragedy.

In this time of profound sorrow, USSSA joins the nation in mourning the loss of innocent lives and stands with the affected families and community. May the souls of the departed find eternal peace, and may healing and resilience prevail in the face of such adversity.

For additional information or support, please contact Uganda Police

post.Title: Revised Athletics Competition Format and Scoring System Announced
post.Content:
Kampala, 17th June 2023 - The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) has released a revised format and scoring system for the upcoming athletics competition, addressing the feedback and concerns raised by participants. The new format aims to ensure a fair and competitive environment while maintaining the spirit of healthy competition.

The competition is part of the upcoming USSSA Ball Games II scheduled to run from 9th - 18th July 2023. Hosted by St Mary's College Rushoroza in Kabale, will see selected students represent their respective schools, districts, and zones. With the introduction of a scoring system for schools, districts, and zones, individual athletes will now contribute points based on their performances in their respective disciplines.

In the revised scoring system:

  • Individual Disciplines: Athletes competing in individual disciplines will score points for their schools, districts, and zones, rewarding their individual achievements.
  • Relays: Relay events will only contribute points to the district and zone levels, as they involve athletes from multiple schools.

To summarize the scoring distribution:

  • Schools: Points earned by individual athletes will contribute to their respective schools' scores.
  • Districts: Points will be earned from both individual athlete performances and relay events within the district.
  • Zones: Points will be earned collectively from all the districts that make up the zone, including individual and relay events.

The competition will feature several trophies to recognize outstanding performances:

  • Best School (Girls and Boys)
  • Best District (Girls and Boys)
  • Best Zone (Girls and Boys)
  • Overall District Champion

It is important to note that only athletes who constitute the district team will compete for their schools. The maximum number of athletes per district will be limited to 25 girls and 25 boys.

This new scoring system aims to strike a balance between recognizing individual performances and fostering a sense of unity among athletes representing their schools, districts, and zones. By allocating points to each level, the competition promotes healthy rivalries, encourages teamwork, and motivates athletes to strive for excellence in both individual and collective endeavors.

As the anticipation for the USSSA Ball Games II 2023 athletics competition builds, athletes, coaches, and spectators eagerly await the showcase of talent, dedication, and teamwork that will be on display at the district, zonal, and eventually the national level. The new scoring system is poised to provide an exhilarating and inclusive experience for all participants, culminating in a celebration of athletic prowess across all levels of competition.

The USSSA encourages all students to actively participate in the athletics competition, showcasing their talent and contributing to the success of their schools, districts, and zones. Dedication and sportsmanship will play a vital role in achieving excellent results.

For any queries or clarifications, participants are advised to contact the USSSA Secretariat. Let us embrace the spirit of healthy competition and make this event a resounding success!

Press Contact: USSSA Secretariat

Competitions Director - usssa2002@gmail.com - +256 701 376353

Chief Executive Officer - cbkbanage@gmail.com - +256 772 684214

post.Title: USSSA Extends Online Registration and Announces Zonal Qualifiers Calendar for 2023 Sporting Calendar
post.Content:
Date: 17th June 2023

Kampala, Uganda - In a collaborative effort between the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) and the Association of Secondary School Headteachers of Uganda (ASSHU), important updates have been made regarding the USSSA Online Registration and the release of the Zonal Qualifiers Calendar for the upcoming 2023 Sporting Calendar.

Following a successful meeting between USSSA and ASSHU, several decisions were made to enhance the registration process and provide schools with a clear timeline for the zonal qualifiers. These decisions aim to ensure widespread participation and fair competition across all levels.

Firstly, the USSSA Online Registration period has been extended to accommodate schools' needs. Initially scheduled to close on Friday, June 16, 2023, at 11:59 pm, schools now have until Tuesday, June 20, 2023, at 11:59 pm to complete their registration. This extension offers schools additional time to finalize their registration process and guarantees their eligibility for participation.

In a stern directive, USSSA emphasizes that no school team will be allowed to take part in any level of sporting events without completing the USSSA Online Registration. This requirement ensures that all participating schools are officially registered, creating a level playing field for competition.

Furthermore, the eagerly awaited Zonal Qualifiers Calendar has been unveiled, marking a significant milestone in the preparation for the sporting events. The calendar provides participating schools with a comprehensive schedule of events and important dates leading up to the culmination of the zonal qualifiers on Sunday, July 2, 2023. It is essential for schools to review the calendar diligently and make the necessary arrangements to compete in their respective zones.

Mugisha Christopher Banage, Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of USSSA, expressed his well wishes to all participating schools as they embark on the Sporting Calendar 2023. He emphasized the importance of these sporting events as a platform for students to showcase their talents, foster camaraderie, and promote healthy competition.

As the USSSA strives to uphold the highest standards of organization and fairness, the extended online registration period and the release of the zonal qualifiers calendar will undoubtedly contribute to the success of the forthcoming sporting events.

Schools are urged to take advantage of the extended registration deadline and complete their USSSA Online Registration promptly. The USSSA Secretariat is available to address any queries or concerns regarding the registration process or the zonal qualifiers.

With anticipation building, the school sports fraternity eagerly awaits the commencement of the 2023 Sporting Calendar, which promises to be an exciting showcase of talent, dedication, and sportsmanship.

For more information and updates, please visit the USSSA website or contact the USSSA Secretariat.

post.Title: Apply for USSSA Ball Games II 2023 Accreditation: Submit Your Application Today!
post.Content:
Media Journalists and Content Creators Encouraged to Provide the Required Information for Consideration

By USSSA Communicationons

Kampala, 19th June 2023 - The USSSA Ball Games II 2023 accreditation process is in full swing, and media journalists and content creators are invited to apply for the opportunity to cover this highly anticipated sporting event. To ensure a seamless application process, interested applicants are requested to provide the following information for consideration:

  1. Passport Size Photo: Please attach a recent passport-size photo of yourself. This will help us identify you during the event and create your official accreditation badge. The photo should be clear, well-lit, and show your face prominently.
  2. Email Address: Provide a valid email address that we can use to communicate with you regarding your accreditation status and updates related to the USSSA Ball Games II 2023. It is essential to provide an active email address to ensure you receive all necessary information leading up to and during the event.
  3. Media House: Specify the media house or content platform you represent. This could be a newspaper, magazine, radio station, television network, online publication, blog, or any other established media outlet. If you are an independent content creator, please mention that as well.
  4. Official Phone Numbers: Please include the official phone numbers of both the journalist and their respective editor(s). This will allow us to contact you directly for any accreditation-related queries or important updates. Ensure that the provided phone numbers are active and easily reachable.

By submitting this information, you will be taking a significant step toward gaining access to the USSSA Ball Games II 2023 as an accredited media journalist or content creator. This exclusive opportunity will allow you to capture the electrifying moments of the event and share them with your audience.

The USSSA Ball Games II 2023, featuring a range of sports disciplines, promises to be an exhilarating showcase of talent and sportsmanship. By obtaining accreditation, you will join a select group of professionals who will have privileged access to press areas, interview opportunities, and behind-the-scenes experiences. This will enable you to provide comprehensive coverage and bring the excitement of the games to your readers, listeners, or viewers.

To submit your application, please send an email to [Accreditation Email Address] with the subject line "USSSA Ball Games II 2023 Accreditation Application." Attach your passport-size photo and include the following details in the body of the email:

  • Full Name:
  • Email Address:
  • Media House:
  • Brief Description of Your Coverage Plan:
  • Journalist's Official Phone Number:
  • Editor's Official Phone Number:

We kindly request all applicants ensure that their applications are submitted by the designated deadline in order to be considered for accreditation.

Don't miss out on this exceptional opportunity to be a part of the USSSA Ball Games II 2023 and contribute to the promotion of sports excellence in Uganda. We look forward to receiving your applications and welcoming you to the vibrant world of beach soccer at St. Mary's College Rushoroza.

For further inquiries or clarification, please feel free to contact +256 752 841468 or +256 771 034619. We appreciate your interest and enthusiasm in covering this momentous sporting event.

As the USSSA Ball Games II 2023 draws near, let's come together and make this a memorable experience for athletes, fans, and media professionals alike.

post.Title: USSSA Ball Games II Online Registration Concludes, Nationals in Kabale at St Mary's College Rushoroza Awaited
post.Content:
1826 Schools Register for Event Following Reduced Registration Fee. A file is attached for download

Date: 21st June 2023

Kampala - The highly anticipated USSSA Ball Games II are just around the corner as the online registration phase recently came to a close. The focus now shifts to the upcoming nationals set to take place at St Mary's College Rushoroza in Kabale.

Since its opening on May 29th, 2023, the online registration process garnered an overwhelming response from secondary schools across the region. A total of 1826 schools eagerly registered to be part of this prestigious sporting event, which celebrates the spirit of healthy competition and camaraderie among students.

Notably, the initial registration fee of 5,000 UGX underwent revision following fruitful engagements with the Ministry of Education and Sports and the Association of Secondary School Heads of Uganda (ASSHU). As a result, the registration fee was reduced to 3,000 UGX, making it more accessible to a wider range of schools. This collaborative effort highlights the commitment to inclusivity and ensuring equal opportunities for all participating schools.

The successful closure of the registration window marks a significant milestone in the journey toward the USSSA Ball Games II Nationals. The organizing committee is now fully dedicated to finalizing the intricate logistics, refining schedules, and arranging the venues to provide an unforgettable experience for all participants.

St Mary's College Rushoroza, situated in the picturesque setting of Kabale, has been selected as the venue for the nationals. Renowned for its exceptional sports facilities and breathtaking surroundings, the college is poised to host a tournament that will leave an indelible mark on young athletes.

Here is the list of registered schools(Downloadable file)

List of Registered SchoolsDownload

The excitement continues to build as the USSSA Ball Games II Nationals draw near. Participants from the registered schools will compete across various sports disciplines, including football, basketball, volleyball, athletics, and more. The competition promises to be intense, with the students showcasing their talent, skill, and unwavering determination in the pursuit of victory.

Following the closure of online registration, the organizing committee has announced that a new registration window will be opened. This additional opportunity will ensure that more schools can participate in this remarkable event and enjoy the benefits of healthy competition, personal growth, and teamwork.

"This process marks a significant leap into the future of service delivery at USSSA," stated CEO Chris Banage, "We are dedicated to providing an exceptional experience for all schools involved and setting a benchmark for schools sporting events."

As the countdown to the USSSA Ball Games II Nationals continues, all stakeholders are encouraged to stay updated through official channels for the announcement of the new registration window, as well as updates on the tournament schedule, team line-ups, and other relevant information. post.Title: USSSA Teso Zonal Championship Set to Commence in Amuria
post.Content:
Subheading: Teams Qualify for Highly-Anticipated Athletics Tournament

Date: 21st June 2023 | Source - Grabriel Esiku, Media officer Teso Zone

Amuria - The stage is set for the USSSA Teso Zone Zonal Championship, where the region's finest athletes will compete in a series of thrilling athletic events. All qualified teams are expected to arrive promptly in Amuria by 8:00 am on the 22nd of June 2023, as the championship kicks off with the verification of athletes at 9:00 am.

The zonal championship, organized by the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) Teso Zone, promises to be a spectacle of athleticism, teamwork, and sportsmanship. With the participation of talented athletes from various schools in the region, the event is expected to showcase the immense potential and determination of the youth.

The management of USSSA Teso Zone has requested the timely arrival of all qualified teams to ensure a smooth and efficient commencement of the championship. Promptness in reporting will enable the verification process to be conducted seamlessly, allowing athletes to focus on their performances.

"We are thrilled to host the USSSA Teso Zone Zonal Championship and witness the incredible talent on display," said the management of USSSA Teso Zone. "We encourage all teams to adhere to the specified arrival time, as it will facilitate a successful start to the tournament."

The championship's first day will feature several athletics events, with the action set to begin at midday. Athletes will have the opportunity to compete in various disciplines, including sprints, long-distance running, jumps, and throws. Participants are expected to showcase their skills, discipline, and determination in pursuit of victory and personal excellence.

The success of the USSSA Teso Zone Zonal Championship heavily relies on the cooperation and support of all stakeholders involved. The management of USSSA Teso Zone extends its appeal for the active participation and cooperation of teams, coaches, officials, and spectators throughout the event.

"We greatly appreciate the support and collaboration of all individuals and schools involved," stated the management of USSSA Teso Zone. "Together, we can make this championship a memorable and inspiring experience for everyone."

The USSSA Teso Zone Zonal Championship aims to foster the spirit of sportsmanship, unity, and personal development among participating athletes. The event will not only provide a platform for showcasing talent but also serve as an opportunity for athletes to learn from one another and build lifelong friendships.

Mr. Langa Godfrey

post.Title: Uganda Secondary Schools Association Showcases Sports Services at Africa Public Service Day
post.Content:
Date: June 23, 2023

Kampala, Uganda - The Kololo Ceremonial Grounds bustled with excitement as the Government of Uganda organized the Africa Public Service Day celebration. The event, aimed at highlighting the diverse services provided by various government ministries under the public service sector, witnessed the active participation of the Uganda Secondary Schools Association (USSSA) in showcasing their invaluable contributions to education and sports.

Esteemed guests, including Prime Minister Robinah Nabbanjja, Katty Lamaro, the Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Education and Sports, inspected the exhibition, expressing their support for the USSSA's initiatives. The USSSA, operating under the Ministry of Education and Sports and in collaboration with the Department of Physical Education and Sports, as well as the Association of Secondary School Health Teachers of Uganda (ASSHU), took this opportunity to present their range of services to the public.

Nsimbi Martin, a Secretariat member of the Uganda Secondary School Sports Association, shared his enthusiasm for being part of the exhibition and acknowledged the significance of engaging with the public to raise awareness about the services they offer.

"We are delighted to be a part of this prestigious exhibition, which allows us to connect directly with the public and educate them about the wide array of services we provide," stated Nsimbi Martin. "As an association, we take pride in our role in fostering education and sports in secondary schools."

The USSSA, entrusted with the responsibility of promoting physical education and sports on behalf of the Ministry of Education and Sports and ASSHU, showcased several notable services during the Africa Public Service Day celebration. These services include:

  1. Organization of National Tournaments: The USSSA takes the lead in organizing major national tournaments, such as the Fresh Dairy National Secondary School Games, featuring sports like rugby 15s, girls' football, basketball, racket games, and more. These tournaments provide a platform for young athletes to showcase their talents and engage in healthy competition.
  2. National Secondary School Football Championship: Recently concluded at Nyakasura School in Fort Portal, this championship brought together talented football players from secondary schools across the nation, encouraging teamwork and fostering a spirit of sportsmanship.
  3. National Secondary School Ball Games II: Anticipation builds for the upcoming event, set to be held in Kabale and hosted by St. Mary's College Rushoroza. The competition will feature various ball games, further promoting physical fitness and friendly competition among students.
  4. Participation in Regional and International Competitions: The USSSA extends its support to secondary school teams by facilitating their participation in prestigious competitions at different levels. This includes events within the East African region, such as the Federation of East African Secondary Schools Sports Association (FEASSSA), as well as continental competitions like the Federation of African Schools Sports (FAS) and international events under the International School Sport Federation (ISF).
  5. Introduction of an Online Registration Portal: In their pursuit of efficiency, the USSSA recently implemented an online registration portal. This platform enables the association to collect comprehensive data on learners participating in secondary school sports, ensuring accurate records and the identification of genuine athletes.

Through the services, the USSSA aims to instill a culture of physical activity, teamwork, and healthy competition among secondary school students. By providing opportunities for talented athletes to excel both nationally and internationally, the association plays a crucial role in nurturing their skills and promoting holistic development.

As the Africa Public Service Day celebration drew to a close, attendees departed with a greater understanding of the USSSA's significant contributions in collaboration with the Ministry of Education and Sports and ASSHU. The association's commitment to education and sports underscores Uganda's dedication to empowering the country's youth and fostering a brighter future.

The Africa Public Service Day celebration stands as a testament to the instrumental role played by public service organizations in driving positive change and uplifting communities. The USSSA's active participation and the services showcased at the event serve as a reminder of Uganda's unwavering commitment to promoting educational excellence and athletic achievement among secondary school students.

Photos by: Nkoola Joseph, Ministry of Education and Sports

post.Title: Historic Qualifiers From USSSA Greater Mukono Zone Set To Shine At National Ball Games
post.Content:
Source: @sekago9

Mukono - In an exhilarating display of talent and competitive spirit, schools from the USSSA Greater Mukono Zone showcased their skills at the qualifiers held at St. Mathias Kalemba. The event witnessed remarkable performances that will go down in history, as several schools qualified for the prestigious USSSA National Ball Games set to take place in Kabale in 2023. Amidst cheers and applause, these schools celebrated their unprecedented achievements and look forward to making a mark on the national stage.

In the Volleyball category, both girls and boys divisions witnessed intense competition. Seroma Christian High School and Amazima School triumphed in the girls' division, showcasing their exceptional skills, teamwork, and strategic play. Their qualification to the USSSA National Ball Games marks a significant milestone for these schools, as they prepare to compete against the best teams from across the country. In the boys' division, Hilton High School and St. Mathias Kalemba School displayed their volleyball prowess and secured their spots in the national competition, igniting a new era of volleyball excellence for these schools.

Netball proved to be another thrilling category, with Dynamic School, Hamdan School, and Mbalala Secondary School emerging as the qualified teams. These schools exhibited exemplary teamwork, agility, and strategic play, earning their places in the highly competitive USSSA National Ball Games. The qualifiers showcased the growing talent and dedication of netball players in the Greater Mukono Zone, setting the stage for an exciting showcase at the national level.

As the qualifiers concluded, the qualifying schools celebrated their historic achievements and expressed their gratitude for the opportunity to compete at the USSSA National Ball Games. The teams are now focused on rigorous training and preparations, determined to represent their respective schools and the Greater Mukono Zone with pride and distinction.

The USSSA Greater Mukono Zone qualifiers have not only provided a platform for schools to demonstrate their sporting abilities but have also fostered a sense of camaraderie and sportsmanship among the participating teams. The event brought together young athletes, coaches, and supporters, creating an atmosphere of excitement, encouragement, and mutual respect.

The upcoming USSSA National Ball Games in Kabale are expected to showcase the best talent from various zones across the country. The Greater Mukono Zone qualifiers have set the stage for an intense battle on the national platform, as the qualified teams aim to make a mark and bring glory to their schools.

The USSSA Greater Mukono Zone is proud of the accomplishments of all the qualifying schools and wishes them success in the upcoming national competition. The achievements of these schools highlight the dedication, talent, and determination of the young athletes who have embraced sports as a means of personal growth and excellence.

post.Title: Teso Zone Athletes Secure Qualification For USSSA National Champioship
post.Content:
Source: Gabriel Esiku, Media Officer Teso Zone

Amuria - The Teso Zone Secondary School's Ball Games II culminated with a thrilling display of talent and determination as athletes vied for qualification to the highly anticipated USSSA National Championships. Schools from across the region showcased their skills in various disciplines, aiming to secure their place among the nation's finest. Let's delve into the remarkable achievements of the qualifying teams and athletes.

In the Athletics Overall category, the girls' division witnessed a fierce battle for the top spot. Soroti City emerged as the champions, amassing an impressive 129 points. Their stellar performances in various track and field events demonstrated their exceptional athleticism and dedication. Following closely were Serere and Ngora, securing second and third place with 100 and 98 points, respectively. Amuria, Kumi, Kapelebyong, Kalaki, Katakwi, and Bukedea also showcased their talent and determination, contributing to the intense competition.

The boys' division in Athletics Overall saw Soroti City claim the championship title with an outstanding total of 158 points. Their exceptional performances in sprinting, jumping, and throwing events showcased their versatility and strength. Kapelebyong and Amuria displayed commendable performances, securing the second and third positions with 112 and 100 points, respectively. Ngora, Kalaki, Serere, Kumi, Katakwi, and Bukedea also exhibited their prowess in the field.

With the culmination of all disciplines, the overall ranking solidified Soroti City's dominance as the Teso Zone's ultimate champions, amassing a remarkable total of 287 points. Ngora, Amuria, Kapelebyong, Serere, Kumi, Kalaki, Katakwi, and Bukedea secured their positions in the top ten, highlighting their remarkable performances throughout the tournament. Unfortunately, Kaberemaido did not have representation in the competition.

Aside from athletics, other disciplines also witnessed outstanding performances from the participating schools. In Handball, Soroti SS emerged as the champions in the boys' division, while Ngora High School showcased their dominance in the girls' division. The basketball category saw Soroti SS claim the championship title in the boys' division, showcasing their skills and determination.

In Netball, Dr. Aporu Okol SS, Soroti SS, and Bukedea Comprehensive emerged as the champions, displaying their remarkable teamwork and strategic gameplay. These schools demonstrated their excellence in the sport, earning their well-deserved spots in the upcoming national championships.

Volleyball proved to be a thrilling category, with Bukedea Comprehensive, Amus College, and Ngora High School securing the championship title in the boys' division. In the girls' division, Ngora High School, Amus College, and Kanyumu Comprehensive displayed exceptional talent and teamwork, earning their place in the national championships.

The football category witnessed impressive performances in the U-14 division, where Amus College secured the championship title among the boys. In the U-14 girls' division, Amus College continued their winning streak, showcasing their prowess on the field.

The U-16 divisions showcased Amus College School's dominance, as they emerged as champions in both the boys' and girls' categories. Teso College Aloet and Asamuk SS put up commendable performances but were unable to surpass Amus College School's exceptional gameplay.

While Dance Sports, Rugby 7s, Lacrosse, and other disciplines did not have participating teams, the spirit and excitement of the event remained undeterred, as the focus shifted to the remarkable achievements in the qualifying disciplines.

These outstanding athletes and teams have now secured their qualification for the

upcoming USSSA National Championships, set to take place in Kabale in 2023. They will compete against the best schools from across the country, aiming to bring glory to their respective zones and schools.

The Teso Zone Secondary School's Ball Games II not only showcased the incredible talent within the region but also provided a platform for young athletes to pursue their sporting dreams and inspire others. The journey to the national championships has just begun, and the Teso Zone's representatives are ready to give their all and leave an indelible mark on the national stage. The entire community eagerly awaits their performance, as they aim to bring home glory and make their schools proud.

post.Title: USSSA Announces Pre-Championship Verification for National Ball Games II National Championship 2023
post.Content:
Date: June 26, 2023

Uganda Secondary School Sports Association (USSSA) has officially announced the commencement of the Pre-Championship Verification process for the highly anticipated National Ball Games II National Championship 2023. In a letter addressed to Games Teachers and Sports Directors, USSSA has invited them to participate in the screening, which is scheduled to take place from Tuesday, June 27th to Tuesday, July 3rd, 2023, at the USSSA Secretariat.

The Pre-Championship Verification is a crucial step in ensuring the fair and transparent selection of participants for the National Ball Games II National Championship. USSSA has urged all schools to actively participate in this process by presenting their Games Teachers and Sports Directors along with all the necessary documents for their students.

Among the essential documents required for the Pre-Championship Verification are the fully filled Pre-Championship Verification Form, which must be completed for each student, and a signed Form A by the respective School Headteachers. These forms play a vital role in verifying the eligibility and authenticity of the participants.

In addition to the forms, USSSA has emphasized the need for Games Teachers and Sports Directors to bring the Photo Album generated from the USSSA Online Registration Portal that was utilized during the District and Zonal Qualifiers. This album serves as a visual record of the athletes who successfully progressed through the earlier stages of the competition.

The USSSA Secretariat will be hosting the Pre-Championship Verification from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm throughout the designated dates. It is imperative for all participating schools to adhere to the provided schedule and ensure timely submission of the required documents.

USSSA remains committed to promoting sportsmanship, integrity, and healthy competition among secondary schools in Uganda. The Pre-Championship Verification process plays a pivotal role in upholding these values, as it guarantees that only deserving athletes will compete in the highly prestigious National Ball Games II National Championship 2023.

As the Pre-Championship Verification commences, USSSA wishes all participating schools the best of luck in this process and looks forward to witnessing an extraordinary display of sporting prowess during the National Ball Games II National Championship 2023.

For further inquiries or information, schools are advised to contact the USSSA Secretariat directly.

post.Title: Rwanda Minister of Education Meets FEASSSA Inspection Team
post.Content:
Date: Wednesday 28th June 2023

Kigali, Rwanda - The Minister of Education of Rwanda Hon. Dr. Uwamariya Valentine, along with officials from the Rwandan Federation, welcomed the inspection team from the Federation of East Africa Secondary School Sports Associations (FEASSSA) on Wednesday. The inspection team, consisting of representatives from Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania, arrived to assess the preparedness and facilities for the upcoming FEASSSA tournament. However, three teams, South Sudan, Congo, and Burundi, were yet to arrive.

The meeting commenced with a brief from the President of the Rwanda Association, who expressed his gratitude for the warm reception received by the FEASSSA inspection team. He highlighted the importance of sports in improving the quality of education and fostering unity among the East African Community. He also expressed regret over the absence of the other participating countries and emphasized Rwanda's commitment to hosting a successful tournament.

Hajarah Ddembe the leader of the delegation from Uganda, one(Uganda) of the founding members of FEASSSA, shared her positive experience of Rwanda, praising its beautiful scenery and expressing confidence that it would inspire the participating students. She stressed the need for improved networking among students from different countries and assured Rwanda of Uganda's government support in facilitating the participation of their 1,300 students. She conveyed greetings from the Ugandan government and extended best wishes to all the participants.

"We have enjoyed the beautiful scenery of Rwanda; this will inspire the students once they land in Rwanda," said the Hajarah representative. "We believe that the environment here is favorable for networking among students from different countries. The Ugandan government is ready to support the 1300 students who will participate in this year's edition. As one of the founding members of FEASSSA, we are determined to take victory home, and we bring greetings from the Ugandan government, wishing everyone the best ahead of this year's tournament."

Hajarah Ddembe - Uganda Leader of Delegation

The inspection team also received a briefing from the Tanzania Federation, highlighting the history of FEASSSA. The organization was formed two decades ago and has since witnessed the emergence of talented athletes who have gone on to represent their national teams. Rwanda had previously hosted the tournament in 2018, and the last edition, the 20th anniversary of FEASSSA, was held in Arusha, Tanzania. The upcoming editions of the tournament will be hosted by Uganda in 2024 and Kenya in 2025.

In response to the briefings, the Rwandan Minister of Education addressed the gathering, emphasizing the manifold benefits of sports, including its positive impact on education and youth development. She acknowledged that sports fosters unity and collaboration within the East African Community, providing a platform for sharing experiences and opportunities. The Minister expressed gratitude to the inspection team for their visit and requested their valuable feedback to ensure the safety and comfort of the participating students. She pledged to offer the best hospitality and make the students feel at home, leveraging Rwanda's familiarity with hosting such events.

The Minister expressed regret over the absence of South Sudan, Congo, and Burundi, stating her disappointment that these countries would not be able to participate in this year's edition. However, she expressed her pride in hosting the tournament and reaffirmed Rwanda's commitment to developing competitive athletes at all levels, from local to regional and international competitions.

"We want our students to be competitive at all levels, from the country to the regional and international stages," declared the Rwandan Minister of Sports. "Hosting this year's edition of the FEASSSA tournament is a great opportunity for us to showcase our commitment to sports development and create a platform for our young athletes to shine. Let us work together to ensure a safe and welcoming environment for all participants. We want them to feel not only like competitors but also like part of our Rwandan family."

Dr. Uwamariya Valentine

The inspection team will evaluate the facilities, accommodation, and overall preparations for

post.Title: FEASSSA Inspections 2023 Conclude with Positive Recommendations for Rwanda's Hosting Abilities
post.Content:
The much-anticipated FEASSSA (Federation of East Africa Secondary Schools Sports Associations) Inspections for 2023 have concluded in Rwanda, and the host nation has received positive feedback from the visiting delegation. The inspection contingent, comprising representatives from Uganda, Kenya, and Tanzania, was warmly welcomed by Karemangigo Luke, the President of the Federation of Rwanda Schools Sports.

During their visit, the delegation paid a courtesy call to the Ministry of Education, where they were received by the Honorable Dr. Uwamariya Valentine, the Minister of Education. Minister Valentine reassured the delegation of Rwanda's readiness to host the games and extended her best wishes for a successful inspection. This affirmation from the Minister further solidified the delegation's confidence in Rwanda's capabilities as a host nation.

On the 28th of June, the inspection team traveled to Huye, the host district, to conduct assessments of the accommodation and competition venues. Their primary objective was to ensure that the proposed facilities meet the high standards set by FEASSSA. The delegation carefully evaluated various aspects, including the quality and suitability of accommodation, as well as the venues for different sporting disciplines.

As a result of their inspections, the delegation has made remarks regarding the sports pitches and facilities. There was a need to identify pitches for specific disciplines as follows: one hockey pitch, one football pitch, and one rugby pitch. These recommendations aim to ensure that each sporting discipline has suitable and dedicated venues for the upcoming games.

The inspection team was pleased with the level of preparedness displayed by Rwanda, and the recommended venues and accommodations meet the required standards for hosting the FEASSSA games. These recommendations will contribute to the smooth organization and execution of the sporting event.

With the conclusion of the FEASSSA Inspections 2023, Rwanda is now one step closer to hosting the games. The positive feedback from the visiting delegation, along with the approved venues and accommodations, further solidifies Rwanda's position as a capable and well-prepared host nation. The anticipation and excitement among participating countries continue to build as preparations progress. The stage is set for an outstanding display of sportsmanship, camaraderie, and the exceptional talent of East African youth.

In terms of accommodation and venues, the inspection team assessed several venues and their capacities. Here is a summary of the venues, their capacity, gender, and category:

Summary of the inspection for Venues and Accommodation

This table provides a concise overview of the recommended venues for specific disciplines and the assessed accommodation facilities during the FEASSSA Inspections 2023. With the approved venues and the assurance of Rwanda's preparedness, the stage is set for a remarkable and successful FEASSSA event in 2023.

post.Title: Uganda Dance Sport Federation Gears Up for USSSA Ball Games II National Championships 2023 Kabale, Hosted by St. Mary's College Rushoroza
post.Content:
July 2, 2023

The Uganda Dance Sport Federation (UDSF) is leaving no stone unturned as it prepares for the highly anticipated USSSA Ball Games II National Championships 2023 Kabale, set to take place from July 9th to July 18th. This prestigious event, hosted by St. Mary's College Rushoroza, promises to be a thrilling display of talent and skill across multiple sports disciplines.

Dance sport, as one of the youngest sports in Uganda, has been gaining momentum and popularity, thanks to the concerted efforts of UDSF in collaboration with USSSA zonal leaders and the technical team. The inclusion of dance sport in the USSSA Ball Games II National Championships is a significant milestone, highlighting its growth and recognition within the sporting community.

To ensure equal opportunities and representation, the USSSA has allocated 12 slots for both boys and girls in the dance sport category. These slots have been distributed among schools from various regions across Uganda, providing a platform for talented dancers to showcase their abilities. The selection process involved staging qualifiers in 12 zones, where participants competed for a chance to represent their respective regions.

"We have worked closely with USSSA zonal leaders and the technical team to organize the dance sport qualifiers. Our aim is to give talented dancers from all over Uganda an opportunity to participate and shine on a national stage. By including dance sport in the USSSA Ball Games, we are promoting its growth and encouraging more students to embrace this beautiful art form," stated Barnabas Sebuyungo, General Secretary of UDSF.

In order to establish a solid foundation for dance sport in secondary schools, UDSF has implemented various initiatives. The federation has launched dance sport clubs in every region, ensuring that students have access to training, mentorship, and regular competitions. This approach not only nurtures talent but also fosters a sense of community and camaraderie among young dancers.

UDSF has also prioritized the training and development of technical personnel to ensure the smooth conduct of dance sport competitions. Qualified judges, proficient DJs, and competent MCs have been appointed to officiate and enhance the overall experience. The federation has conducted extensive training programs, equipping three students per school with the necessary skills to serve as DJs, MCs, and judges in their respective regions.

The dance sport qualifiers have been held across the country, with several regions already completing their competitions. The remaining zones, including the upcoming Rwenzori zone hosted by Nayaksura School on Wednesday, July 28th, are eagerly preparing to showcase their top-performing dancers. These qualifiers not only determine the finalists but also serve as a platform for talent identification and development.

Beyond the excitement and competition of the USSSA Ball Games II National Championships 2023 Kabale, UDSF sees this event as a significant stepping stone towards Olympic qualification. The federation has formed a national team consisting of 32 exceptional dancers, 12 of whom are current secondary school students. These talented individuals, identified through a rigorous national ranking system, have demonstrated immense potential and are poised to represent Uganda on the global stage.

Among the rising stars is a remarkable 15-year-old girl Kawala Sophia who recently transferred from Kazo Secondary School to Saint Julian. She stands on the cusp of Olympic qualification, with just three points separating her from securing a spot at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Her dedication, talent, and relentless pursuit of excellence serve as an inspiration to aspiring dancers across the country.

The USSSA Ball Games II National Championships 2023 Kabale not only provide a platform for athletes to showcase their

skills but also create an avenue for new talent to emerge. UDSF envisions a future where dance sport becomes a staple in Ugandan schools, nurturing and empowering the next generation of dancers.

As the countdown to the championships continues, anticipation and excitement are building. The USSSA Ball Games II National Championships 2023 Kabale will undoubtedly be a celebration of athleticism, artistry, and the unifying power of sports.

post.Title: Kibuli Secondary School Continues with Preparations for the World Schools Championship
post.Content:
By USSSA Media

Lugogo, Kampala - Uganda - The Kibuli Secondary School is leaving no stone unturned in their preparations for the upcoming World Schools Championship in Morocco. With just a little over two weeks remaining, the team is determined and confident about their chances in the prestigious tournament.

Hassan Tembo Isingoma, the coach of Kibuli SS, expressed his team's readiness for the tournament. "We are preparing for the Morocco tournament, World School Championship, and barely, I think 2 or 2 1/2 weeks remaining," he said. "And I can assure you that we are there, we are ready. Much as, of course, there are some small, small things that are still missing, we are trying to see how best we can patch them together. We will go when we are fully prepared."

Isingoma also highlighted the importance of their recent friendly match with the KCCA FC junior team. "It's good that we have had our first friendly match with the KCCA FC junior team, which, at least if you've seen that, at least you've seen our boys putting up a very good display," he added. "We are very optimistic that they will have a good show in Morocco."

The coach emphasized the team's efforts to prepare the players mentally and psychologically, especially those who are participating in such a tournament for the first time. "We have been trying to make sure we prepare these boys mentally, psychologically, etc. because some of them, it's their first time to play in such a tournament," Isingoma explained. "So we are working on all those aspects so that at least by the time we leave this place, they are fully ready for that tournament."

Katende Bahira Mukiibi, the captain of Kibuli SS, echoed the coach's sentiments and assured everyone of the team's readiness. "We have prepared, and we are just remaining with two weeks, coping up with our coaches," Mukiibi said. "They are giving us physical training, fitness training, and mental training. We are ready for everything and ready to represent the country."

The Kibuli Secondary School team is determined to make their mark on the international stage and bring pride to their school and country. With their focused preparation and the support of their coaches, the players are eager to showcase their skills and give their best performance in the World Schools Championship.

The 2023 ISF World Schools' Football championship will be held in Morocco between the 22nd and 31st of July. Uganda will be represented by three schools; Kibuli S.S and Amus College (boys) as well as St Noa Girls Zzana (Girls).

Kibuli SS is preparing two teams; one for FEASSSA Games and one for Morroco

As the departure date approaches, the entire Kibuli SS community is rallying behind the team, wishing them success in their endeavors. The World Schools Championship is set to be a thrilling competition, and Kibuli SS is poised to make its presence felt on the global platform.

post.Title: Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association Officials Participate in One-Day Symposium to Shape Football Future
post.Content:
Njeru, Uganda - The FUFA Technical Centre in Njeru played host to an important gathering as Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) officials Christopher Mugisha Banage, CEO, and Patrick Alfred Okanya, President Emeritus, joined a one-day symposium. The symposium, organized by the Federation of Uganda Football Associations (FUFA), aimed to discuss and devise a comprehensive National Football Technical Plan for the period 2023-2030.

Bringing together a diverse range of key stakeholders, experts, and professionals from various domains within the football industry, the symposium aimed to foster collaboration in shaping a strategic and all-encompassing technical plan for the nation's football.

As leaders in the USSSA, both Christopher Mugisha Banage and Patrick Alfred Okanya demonstrated their commitment to advancing sports and nurturing talent among Uganda's youth. Their participation in the symposium highlighted the association's dedication to contributing to the growth and development of football in the country.

The football technical plan, under discussion at the symposium, was driven by a mission focused on achieving three key objectives. Firstly, it aims to establish mass football for all, with the goal of ensuring that football reaches every corner of Uganda. By encouraging widespread participation, this initiative aims to create a solid foundation for the sport's growth at all levels and provide opportunities for aspiring players across the country.

Secondly, the plan seeks to cultivate a high-performance culture for elite performers. Through the provision of advanced training facilities, specialized coaching programs, and comprehensive support systems, Uganda aims to nurture and elevate its most talented players, enabling them to compete at the highest levels of the sport.

The third objective of the plan is to establish a universal playing style for Uganda's national teams and clubs, which will result in producing entertaining and purposeful football. This ambitious vision aims to raise the profile of Ugandan football, attract global recognition, and create opportunities for players and clubs to showcase their skills on the international stage.

During the symposium, several key pillars were discussed to shape the technical plan. These pillars include mass football, which focuses on broadening access and inclusivity to the sport; elite football, which emphasizes the development of top-tier players and teams; professional football, which aims to enhance the overall infrastructure and commercial aspects of the sport; life after football, which addresses the well-being and post-career support for players; coach education, which aims to produce skilled and knowledgeable coaches; talent identification, which seeks to identify and nurture promising young talent; referees development, which emphasizes training and support for match officials; and finally, medicine, science, and technology, which explores advancements in sports science to enhance player performance and well-being.

The symposium provided a valuable platform for experts to exchange ideas, share experiences, and collectively develop a roadmap for the future of Ugandan football. The insights gained from this collaborative effort will help shape policies, programs, and investments to drive football development across the nation.

CEO Christopher Mugisha Banage expressed his enthusiasm for the symposium, stating, "This symposium is a critical step towards transforming football in Uganda. By harnessing the collective knowledge and experience of stakeholders, we can create a unified and strategic plan that will elevate our football to new heights. I am honored to be part of this initiative and look forward to the positive impact it will have on our sport."

Patrick Alfred Okanya, President Emeritus of USSSA, also voiced his optimism, saying, "The symposium presents an incredible opportunity for us to collaborate with experts in the football industry and shape the future of Ugandan football. It is our responsibility to ensure that the right systems and structures are in place to nurture talent and create a thriving football ecosystem in

post.Title: USSSA To Conduct Draws for National Ball Games II Championship 2023, Frank Video Anyau Is Ready
post.Content:
Date: July 6th, 2023

Venue: USSSA National Offices

Time: 10:00 am

Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) is set to host the draws for the highly anticipated National Ball Games II Championship 2023 today at the USSSA National Offices. The event, scheduled to commence at 10:00 am, will unveil the matchups and fixture schedule for various sports disciplines, promising an exhilarating and fiercely competitive tournament.

With representatives from schools across Uganda eagerly gathered, the draws will cover a wide range of disciplines, showcasing the diverse sporting talents within the nation. The sports disciplines featured in the championship include Football U14, Football U16, Netball, Volleyball, Basketball 3x3, Handball, Lacrosse, Athletics, Rugby 7s, Dancesport, Woodball, Beach Soccer, and Beach Volleyball.

The draws will be conducted with fairness and transparency, ensuring that each participating school has an equal opportunity to face challenging opponents and showcase their skills in their respective disciplines. Coaches, players, and officials are eagerly anticipating the matchups that will shape their tournament journey.

The National Ball Games II Championship is an esteemed platform for young athletes to demonstrate their prowess, teamwork, and sportsmanship. It represents the culmination of countless hours of training, dedication, and passion, embodying the values of competition, camaraderie, and personal growth.

As the draws are unveiled, participating schools and teams will dive into intensive preparations and strategic planning. Coaches and players will analyze their opponents, study their strengths and weaknesses, and devise game plans to secure victories and propel themselves to championship glory.

Among the participating schools eagerly awaiting the draws is Amus College, whose football team, under the guidance of Coach Frank Video Anyau, has been training rigorously in anticipation of the championship. Coach Anyau expressed his team's excitement, saying, "We are eagerly waiting for the draws to see who we will face in the competition. We have prepared well and are ready to compete at our best in Football."

The National Ball Games II Championship represents not only a competitive arena but also an opportunity for young athletes to forge lifelong memories, friendships, and personal growth. The championship aims to foster a spirit of sportsmanship, resilience, and excellence among participants, inspiring a new generation of sports enthusiasts.

As the draws unfold, the stage is set for an unforgettable tournament filled with intense matches, memorable performances, and inspiring displays of skill. Spectators, fans, and supporters can expect to witness captivating moments across the various sports disciplines, showcasing the talent and dedication of young Ugandan athletes.

Stay tuned as the USSSA reveals the draws for the National Ball Games II Championship 2023, igniting the spirit of competition and setting the stage for an exhilarating sporting extravaganza that will captivate the nation.

post.Title: Amus College Prepares for World School Championships in Morocco
post.Content:
Source: Emmanuel Sekago

Bukedea, 4th July 2023 - Anyawo Frank, commonly known as "Video," the head coach of Amus College in Bukedea, expressed his gratitude to Honorable Isiagi Opolot for providing the college with the opportunity to participate in the upcoming World School Championships. Coach Frank also extended his appreciation to the school administration and parents for their support in nurturing the students who will represent Bukedea on a global platform.

The preparations for the highly anticipated World School Championships, set to take place in Morocco, are in full swing at Amus College. Coach Frank, along with his fellow coaches, is tirelessly working day and night to ensure that the team delivers a commendable performance that reflects positively on Uganda and East Africa as a whole.

"We are dedicated to preparing our team to the best of our abilities. We want to make sure that when we go to Morocco, we represent Uganda with pride and do justice to the talent and potential of our players," said Coach Frank. "The level of football worldwide has risen significantly, and it is crucial for us to perform at the highest standard."

To gauge their preparedness, Amus College has been engaging in friendly matches with other local teams. However, Coach Frank acknowledged the uncertainty surrounding the abilities of other participating colleges, such as those from Brazil, China, France, and various other countries. Despite this, the focus remains on Amus College's own performance, aiming to achieve their best on the international stage.

The World School Championships provide a unique opportunity for young athletes to showcase their skills and compete against talented teams from across the globe. The tournament serves as a platform to foster international camaraderie, cultural exchange, and sportsmanship among students.

Amus College is determined to make the most of this opportunity and continue raising the profile of football in Uganda and East Africa. With Coach Frank's guidance and the dedication of the team, the college hopes to leave a lasting impression at the World School Championships and inspire future generations of athletes. Amus College is grouped in A with schools from France, Chile, and Nepal. Uganda is also represented by Kibli SS (Boys) and St Noah Girls SS

As the tournament approaches, the entire community of Bukedea stands united in support of Amus College. Excitement fills the air, and everyone eagerly awaits the kick-off of the World School Championships in Morocco, where the young athletes from Amus College will aim to shine brightly on the global stage.

post.Title: Draws for 2023 USSSA Ball Games II Held
post.Content:
The draws for the highly anticipated 2023 USSSA Ball Games II were held at the association headquarters located at GNS Plaza in Old Kampala on Thursday, July 6, 2023. The event was witnessed by numerous stakeholders, including Hajji Twahil Kitezaala, the vice president of the association, and the esteemed president Emeritus Patrick Okanya. Representatives from various schools and sports commissars were also present to witness the exciting moment.

The draws were conducted with great anticipation, determining the groups for the different disciplines that will be showcased during the games. These include Netball, Handball, Football (U-14 & U-16), Basketball (3X3), Rugby 7’s, Woodball, and Lacrosse. The draws were executed meticulously to ensure fairness and balance among the participating schools.

"We have held successful draws for the 2023 USSSA Ball Games 2. The schools are eager to have the action kick off at St Mary’s Rushoroza in Kabale," expressed Kitezaala, highlighting the enthusiasm among the participating schools.

To ensure a competitive atmosphere, the schools have been assigned to different groups within each sport. In most cases, the groups will compete against each other, with the successful teams advancing to the knockout rounds. However, sports such as Basketball (3x3) and Lacrosse will follow a round-robin format, allowing each school to face all opponents in their respective groups.

The 2023 USSSA Ball Games II are scheduled to take place from July 9th to July 18th, 2023, providing an exhilarating ten days of intense sporting action and showcasing the remarkable talents of the young athletes.

post.Title: USSSA Ball Games II National Championships – Day 2 Delivers Thrilling Matches and Engaging Media Coverage
post.Content:
Kabale, July 11, 2023 – The USSSA Ball Games II National Championships continued to captivate audiences on its second day with a plethora of exciting activities and intense sporting competitions. As the tournament unfolded in Kabale, participants and spectators were treated to a showcase of exceptional talent and sportsmanship.

The first day of the championships was dedicated to the arrival of teams from various schools across the country. It provided an opportunity for participants to settle in, familiarize themselves with the surroundings, and prepare for the exhilarating battles ahead.

As the tournament progressed into its second day, the confirmation of teams that had arrived took place, ensuring that all expected participants were accounted for. This step was essential for the smooth organization of the championships and to guarantee fair play for all involved.

The verification process for participants in the different disciplines followed suit, as organizers meticulously checked the credentials of each athlete. This verification aimed to maintain the integrity of the competition and ensure compliance with the tournament regulations.

A Technical Coordination meeting was held, gathering team managers, coaches, and officials to discuss important details such as rules, schedules, and logistical arrangements. This meeting ensured that all parties involved were well-informed and on the same page, contributing to the overall coordination and success of the event.

Not only were the athletes the focus of attention, but the media also played a crucial role in covering the championships. A capacity-building session was conducted to provide media officers, who were students representing their schools, with the necessary skills and knowledge to effectively report on the tournament. This initiative aimed to empower young media representatives and promote responsible and accurate media coverage.

Accreditation of participants and officials was an important step in maintaining a secure and controlled environment. Only authorized individuals were granted access to the tournament venues and facilities, ensuring the smooth progression of the competitions.

As the day unfolded, matches kicked off at different venues, thrilling both participants and spectators. Netball matches took place on five courtyards at Kigezi Primary School, showcasing the skills and teamwork of the talented athletes. Dance Sport enthusiasts gathered at St Ignatius University Kabale, mesmerizing the audience with their graceful moves. Volleyball matches, held at Kabale University Grounds, demonstrated the athleticism and competitive spirit of the players. In an intense Lacrosse fixture between Nabisunsa Girls and St Mary's High School – Ziroobwe, Nabisunsa Girls emerged victorious with a score of 26-06.

The excitement continues as all other sports are set to commence their fixtures today. Anticipation is building for the Track and Field Athletics competitions, which are scheduled to begin on Wednesday, July 13, 2023. The athletes, honed in their respective disciplines, are ready to showcase their speed, agility, and endurance, promising a display of outstanding athletic prowess.

The USSSA Ball Games II National Championships encompass a total of 12 sports disciplines, providing a platform for young athletes to excel and showcase their talents. These disciplines include Football U14/U16, Netball, Volleyball, Basketball 3x3, Handball, Lacrosse, Athletics, Rugby 7s, Dancesport, Woodball, Beach Soccer, and Beach Volleyball. The championships serve as a celebration of youth sports and offer a pathway for aspiring athletes to pursue their dreams.

As the action intensifies, spectators and participants alike eagerly await the battles yet to come. The USSSA Ball Games II National Championships epitomize the essence of sportsmanship, camaraderie, and competitive spirit. It is a testament to the dedication and passion of the young athletes who strive for excellence in their chosen disciplines.

Stay tuned for further updates as the tournament progresses, and join us in celebrating the exceptional performances and memorable moments that will shape the USSSA Ball Games II National Championships.

-End-

post.Title: USSSA Ball Games II 2023 Officially Opened: Celebrating Sports Excellence
post.Content:
By John Wycliffe Musinguzi | Photos by Mutebi Julius

Kabale Municipal Stadium, Uganda - The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) Ball Games II was officially launched on the afternoon of July 12th, 2023, amidst a highly attended event. Reverend Duncans Mugumya, the Commissioner of Physical Education and Sports from the Ministry of Education and Sports, graced the occasion as the esteemed Chief Guest.

The festivities commenced with a vibrant procession led by the brass band and security, with participants marching from St Mary's College Rushoroza through Kabale Town to the venue. The enthusiasm and energy were palpable as the young athletes paraded their dedication to sportsmanship.

Ball Games II, an integral part of the Ministry of Education and Sports calendar, focuses on sports not covered during Ball Games I and Fresh Diary Games, held in the first term. This championship, held during the second term, includes an extensive array of games such as Basketball 3X3, Football Under 14 and 16 for girls and boys, Netball, Volleyball, Beach Soccer, Beach Volleyball, Rugby 7s, Woodball, Handball, Lacrosse, Athletics, and Dance Sport.

"This edition of the USSSA Ball Games II marks a significant milestone as we introduce several new games, including Beach Volleyball and Beach Soccer, which provide an opportunity for students to explore different sports," Reverend Mugumya stated, highlighting the progressive nature of the championship.

With over 8,000 students, both boys and girls, alongside officials present in Kabale for the highly anticipated games, the atmosphere is electric. The competition began on Sunday, July 9th, and will continue until Tuesday, July 18th, 2023.

Addressing the gathered crowd at Kabale Municipal Stadium, Mr. Monday Christopher, the Headmaster of St. Mary's Rushoroza, expressed heartfelt gratitude to the association for selecting their school as the host for this year's competitions. "We are grateful as St. Mary's Rushoroza to have been chosen out of all the districts in the western side. We don't take it for granted," Mr. Christopher humbly acknowledged, emphasizing the honor bestowed upon their institution.

Taking the opportunity to advocate for support from the government, Mr. Christopher added, "We call upon the government to support schools, especially in terms of facilities. This support will not only help us host such events but also aid in identifying and promoting new talents."

The Chief Executive Officer of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association, Mr. Christopher Mugisha Banage, expressed his heartfelt appreciation to all the schools that participate in USSSA activities, acknowledging their unwavering commitment.

"We are deeply grateful to the schools that participate in all USSSA activities, no matter how challenging it may be. Your dedication is crucial in our quest to become the number one school sports federation in Africa," Mr. Banage remarked, recognizing the collective effort required to achieve their ambitious vision.

Hajj Twahil Kiteezaala, the acting President of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association, highlighted their focus on training young officials. "Our vision is to train young officials and develop their skills. Currently, we train student referees, assistant coaches, and media officers who we hope to utilize in our future games. Furthermore, we have displayed outstanding performance, winning 18 out of the 24 East African trophies at the FEASSSA Games in Tanzania last year," Hajj Twahil Kiteezaala proudly stated.

"The Association of Secondary Schools Headteachers of Uganda (ASSHU) is delighted to witness the official opening of the USSSA Ball Games II. This championship provides a remarkable platform for our students to showcase their talents and passion for sports. We commend the efforts of USSSA in promoting and nurturing sports excellence among our youth," stated Oluk the representative of ASSHU, highlighting the association's support and enthusiasm for the event.

Reverend Duncan's Mugumya, representing Honorable Peter Ogwang, praised the USSSA for their successful events and expressed the government's commitment to supporting sports, particularly in schools. "We are very proud to witness the successful organization of USSSA events. The government is ready to continue supporting sports, and we are also planning to develop primary school sports," Reverend Mugumya assured, highlighting the government's dedication to nurturing young talents.

Rev. Canon Dr. Duncans

Following the official opening ceremony, the championships showcased some thrilling matches:

Dance Sport
Dance Crew Category
Mbarara High School 3-2 St Julian High School Gayaza

Football Under 16 Boys
St Mary's Rushoroza 0-2 Madina Muslim SS

The USSSA Ball Games II promises to be a week filled with exhilarating competition as students from various schools exhibit their athletic prowess and sportsmanship in a multitude of sports. The games will continue until July 18th, 2023, providing a platform for young talents to shine and inspire the next generation of athletes.

Here is the link to the whole event

#USSSABallGames23 Opening Ceremony
