Deep in the day Buddo SSS the reigning champions faced off with Bukedea SSS which they heavily defeated by scoring 47 against 13. Still, in the same quarter, Jinja SSS faced off against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School which mercilessly hit 37 against 28

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games: DAY 2 OF THE BASKETBALL UPDATES.
post.Content:
By: Kasemeza Catherine.

Following the multiple wins of yesterday's games, the day began with a 5X5 Girls' match between Jinja SS and Gombe SS. This proceeded with numerous shoots from Jinja where by it led in the first quarter with 17 baskets on 8. The second quarter ended when Jinja SS had scored 8 on 6 with Nakigudde Catherine being the top scorer for Gombe SS. The third quarter ended 13-8  and the fourth 6-6, which totaled up to 44- 28 with Jinja SS being the winners.

Right after, a 3X3 game between Jinja College and Jinja SS got underway. This was so tight due to a couple of defenses making it total up to 5-4 and Jinja College emerged as the champions of the match.

A 5X5 match between Jinja College and Jinja SS ended the day. The first quarter started sprightly with a lot of dribbles, and defenses shot by the two rivalries, and ended 14-11. The second quarter proceeded with more three-pointers by Jinja College players and it ended 14-5. Jinja College still led in the third quarter with 11-9 and the the fourth quarter ended 5- 8. This led to a full-time time of 44-33 with Jinja College leading.

post.Title: USSSA Capacity Building products Are Happy To Officiate Elite Games
post.Content:
By Aisha Nakato

The graduates of the USSSA capacity building training have been availed an opportunity to officiate at the Elite Games 2024 in Jinja SS and Jinja College.

The participants were selected by the FUFA instructors under whose guidance and mentorship they have been through the year.

This USSSA training was started with the sole objective of skilling teachers and students in refereeing, umpiring, and coaching in fields such as football, netball, athletics, volleyball, handball, basketball, and media.

Through the training, Namusoke Zainah a student at St. Joseph’ Kisubi studying automotive engineering in her second year has attained level II as a football referee.

Namusoke attended the level 1 football refereeing course in January 2023 at Kibuli SS and was taught by  FUFA Referee Instructors Harriet Nattabi, Faisal Nsubuga, and Sewaya Ismail Miti. She went on to attend level II in January 2024 at the same venue under the guidance of experienced FUFA referee Egesa Samuel.

Isabirye Ali, a student at Kyasanku Hill College in Mpigi has attended both Level I and II in Mbarara (Ntare School, January 2023) and Kibuli SS (January 2024) under the instruction of Egesa Samuel.

Mukama Delivered, a senior four student at Ntare School, Mbarara was among the first participants to undertake the training at his school in December 2022 and later level II in January 2024 at Kibuli SS both under the instructions of FUFA referee instructor Egesa Samuel.

The referees explain their experiences (The trio were on the touchline as Boni Consilli Girls' SS played out to a goalless draw against Jinja SS)

Namusoke Zainah, a student at St.Joseph’s Vocational Kisubi.

“I chose refereeing because I love it. During these games, I have been a part of 8 games, one as a center referee, two as a fourth official, and five as a first assistant referee. The start was tough but as I went on I learned how to cope with not only the coaches but the fans as well. I promise to work even harder whenever I get the chance”

Isabirye Ali, a senior six student at Kyasanku Hill College, Mpigi.

“I have learned how to handle games because this has been very practical. Being a referee means you also behave professionally off the pitch. I am looking forward to Nationals and I hope to build a career in refereeing. Thanks to USSSA for training and also for making sure we get a chance to practice. I love what am doing”.

Mukama Delivered, a senior four student at Ntare School, Mbarara.

“I have gained more confidence because these are big people we are dealing with so I must make decisions very fast and accurately,” he said.

The management of USSSA is looking forward to using their own trained umpires and referees soon for all their competitions.

The training has had over 7000 participants trained from December 2022 to January 2024.

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Football Girls: Kawempe Muslim bags gold, former FEASSSA Champions Settle For Bronze As The Games Climax In Jinja.
post.Content:
By Jude Atwiine

Saturday 27th January was the last dance for the 5th Edition of the championship in Jinja. For the Girls' Football category, the 3rd day of the championship was the day the gold winner would be determined.

Kawempe Muslim SS came from a goal down to salvage a point against Bukedea Comprehensive School courtesy of a Shadia Nabirye strike. A point was just enough to hand the Valley Warriors their first trophy this year. Kawempe finished top of the group with 13 points and one point above second-placed Boni Consili Girl's School which settled for silver and St. Noa Girls SS which took bronze home.

St. Noa had their title chances nailed on the first day as they were stunned by Boni Consili Girl's School through a Rina Ariho strike which was enough to seal their first win of the championship.

Rina Ariho, 15 from Boni Consili Girl's School was the most valuable player of the championship having shown great ability in front of goal including bagging 5 goals in a single match.

Shadia Nabirye of Kawempe Muslim SS, Gloria Mutesi of Jinja SS, and Sumaiyah Nalumu of St. Noa Girls SS were also very impressive as they put up spectacular performances and bagged a couple of goals to ensure that their sides performed well.

The USSSA sporting calendar curtain raiser ended on Saturday evening at Kakindu stadium where all winning teams were awarded trophies and their respective medals.

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Volleyball: Bukedea Conquer This Year's Edition in Both Boys and Girls Categories
post.Content:
By Nankya Saudah

The third and final day of the Elites Games 5th Edition saw Bukedea Comprehensive School teams emerge as the overall winners of the Volleyball games. This remarkable achievement came after intense matches against Ngora High School and Standard High School Zana.

In the girls' match, Bukedea displayed exceptional skill and determination against Ngora High School, securing a well-deserved victory with a score of 3:1. This outstanding performance posed a significant challenge for Ngora High School, who had previously proven themselves as unbeatable. The unexpected turn of events left Ngora High School with the silver medals, while Katikamu S.D.A claimed the bronze.

On the other hand, Standard High School Zana claimed the silver medals in the boys' category, with Jinja College taking home the bronze. It is important to note that the competition included other formidable teams such as Mariam High School Kisaasi, Immaculate Heart Girls School, and Jinja Senior Secondary School. Although these teams did not secure top rankings, their participation added excitement to the tournament. Mariam High School finished in fourth place, Jinja SSS came in fifth, and Immaculate Heart Girls School secured the sixth position.

In the boys' category, Jinja SSS finished in fourth place. We anticipate that these teams will continue to engage in spirited and competitive matches in the future.

We extend our heartfelt congratulations to Bukedea Comprehensive School for their remarkable achievement. They have truly reached a significant milestone in their sporting journey.

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Netball: Buddo SS Defend Title With a Victory Against Baptist High School
post.Content:
By Komugisha Prilla

The USSSA Elite Games concluded today, with various school champions being recognized and awarded for their outstanding performances. The closing ceremony was attended by notable figures such as Sammy Odong (Assistant Commissioner Physical Education & Sports), USSSA EXCO, head teachers and the DPC of Jinja City, creating an atmosphere of prestige and importance. Enthusiastic supporters flocked to the event, eager to witness the final football match between two rival eastern schools.

In a thrilling display of skill and determination, Jinja Progressive Academy emerged as the victors, defeating Jinja SSS with a score of 4-3 in a penalty shootout. The highly competitive netball game saw defending champions Buddo SSS claim the USSSA Elite Netball title for the second consecutive year, defeating Baptist High School with a score of 32-28. Buddo SSS also showcased their dominance in girl's basketball, triumphing over host school Jinja SSS with a score of 40-27. The intensity of the netball games was such that no other schools were able to secure titles in the tournament.

The first day of the games witnessed Jinja SSS suffering a heavy defeat against Buddo SSS, with a score of 46-21. Bukedea Comprehensive also faced disappointment, losing to Kawempe with a score of 29-19. However, Baptist High School emerged victorious against Kawempe Muslim Secondary School with a score of 40-19, followed by a narrow triumph over Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School with a score of 30-27. Jinja SSS faced another defeat, this time against Bukedea Comprehensive, with a score of 34-21. Meanwhile, Buddo SSS continued their dominance in netball, securing a score of 35-18 against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School. Bukedea Comprehensive also suffered a loss against Baptist High School, with a score of 47-12.

On the second day of the games, Bukedea Comprehensive once again faced defeat, this time against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School, with a final score of 23-44. Jinja SSS engaged in a thrilling match against Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, emerging victorious by a narrow margin of 31-30. However, Kawempe Muslim Secondary School encountered a formidable challenge from Buddo SSS and suffered a resounding defeat, with a score of 13-40. Jinja SSS, unfortunately, experienced their fourth loss in a row, this time against Baptist High School, with a score of 32-23. On the other hand, Buddo SSS continued their winning streak, securing another triumph against Bukedea Comprehensive, with a score of 47-13. Lastly, Jinja SSS concluded the games with yet another loss, this time against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School.

The second day of the games witnessed a series of intense battles, showcasing the determination and skill of the participating schools. Despite their best efforts, Bukedea Comprehensive could not turn the tide in their favor, succumbing to Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School with a score of 23-44. Meanwhile, Jinja SSS engaged in a nail-biting clash against Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, ultimately emerging victorious by a mere point, with a final score of 31-30.

However, the day proved to be a challenging one for Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, as they faced a formidable opponent in Buddo SSS. The latter demonstrated their dominance on the court, delivering a crushing defeat to Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, with a score of 13-40.

On the second day of the games, Bukedea Comprehensive once again faced defeat, this time against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School, with a final score of 23-44. Jinja SSS engaged in a thrilling match against Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, emerging victorious by a narrow margin of 31-30. However, Kawempe Muslim Secondary School encountered a formidable challenge from Buddo SSS and suffered a resounding defeat, with a score of 13-40. Jinja SSS, unfortunately, experienced their fourth loss in a row, this time against Baptist High School, with a score of 32-23. On the other hand, Buddo SSS continued their winning streak, securing another triumph against Bukedea Comprehensive, with a score of 47-13. Lastly, Jinja SSS concluded the games with yet another loss, this time against Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School.

The second day of the games witnessed a series of intense battles, showcasing the determination and skill of the participating schools. Despite their best efforts, Bukedea Comprehensive could not turn the tide in their favor, succumbing to Ahmadiyya Muslim Secondary School with a score of 23-44. Meanwhile, Jinja SSS engaged in a nail-biting clash against Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, ultimately emerging victorious by a mere point, with a final score of 31-30.

However, the day proved to be a challenging one for Kawempe Muslim Secondary School, as they faced a formidable opponent in Buddo SSS. The latter demonstrated their dominance on the court, leaving Kawempe Muslim Secondary School with a heavy defeat, the score standing at 13-40.

On the other hand, Buddo SSS continued their winning streak as they emerged victorious once again, showcasing their exceptional skills and teamwork. Jinja SSS, despite their valiant efforts, could not break their streak of losses, as they faced yet another setback against Baptist High School, with a final score of 32-23.

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Handball: Kakungulu Memorial School Successfully Defends Boys Handball Title, While Gombe SS Makes History on the Girls' Side
post.Content:
By Mukwaya Arnold

Kakungulu Memorial School, a renowned powerhouse in Uganda's Secondary Schools handball, has once again emerged victorious in the boys' category at the USSSA Elite Championship. Their hard-fought win against Wampeewo Ntake SS in the final game secured their second consecutive handball accolade.

Meanwhile, Gombe SS's girls' handball team has etched their name in history by clinching their first-ever handball championship at the USSSA Elite Games. Displaying exceptional skill and determination, they emerged triumphant in all their tournament matches.

The elation and joy among the Gombe SS team members are palpable. "We are thrilled and overjoyed by this championship victory. We are growing stronger and setting our sights on the FEASSA tournament, where we are confident of securing another triumph," expressed Tibakalamu Grace, a student at Gombe SS.

The Elite championship featured five sports disciplines, namely football, netball, basketball, handball, and volleyball, with various schools vying for glory.

Jinja Senior Secondary School served as the host for this year's edition, providing a fitting venue for the intense sporting battles that unfolded.

Handball Rankings:

Girls:

  1. Gombe SS
  2. Wampeewo Ntake SS
  3. Kakungulu Memorial School
  4. Kakira SS
    MVP: Kwiochwiny Brenda (Gombe SS)

Boys:

  1. Kakungulu Memorial School
  2. Wampeewo Ntake SS
  3. Gombe SS
  4. MM College Wairaka
  5. 5. Jinja College
    MVP: Opio Franco (Kakungulu Memorial School)

In a display of exceptional talent and sportsmanship, these schools have showcased their prowess in the thrilling game of handball. Congratulations

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Football Boys: Jinja Progressive Academy Triumphs Over Jinja Secondary School to Claim Their Maiden Elite Games Title in Football Boys Division.
post.Content:
By John Wycliff Musinguzi

James Jarieko scored the winning penalty to lead Jinja Progressive Academy to its first-ever USSSA Elite Games title as Sowedi Lwenda missed for Jinja Secondary School.

USSSA Elite Games 2024 Football Boys
Full Time
Jinja Secondary School 0(4)-0(5) Jinja

Jinja Progressive Academy (JIPRA) Saturday emerged victorious in a penalty shootout against Jinja SS, securing a 5-4 win after a goalless draw in regular time. The intense battle at Kakindu Stadium unfolded under the spotlight of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) Elite Games 2024.

As the game grew both teams searched for the opener but credit to defenders and goalkeepers for their outstanding performance to keep the game level. James Jarieko had sent the later champions in early jubilations with a tap but the referee's flag had already gone up and it was ruled out for offside.

Near the end of the first half, Jinja Secondary School had a chance to go to half-time in the lead with a great opportunity of a free kick outside the 18-yard box but Jordan's efforts went into the hands of the goalkeeper.

In the second half, Jinja Secondary School goalkeeper Swaleh had gifted JIPRA with a lead by miscalculating the ball in his box, Swabir tried to go for a direct shot but the defender was in position to clear.

James Jarieko had the best chance of of second half after a well-delivered cross from Richard Okello but his header near the goalposts went over the bar which left the crowd at Kakindu in embarrassment.

Despite being a holiday, people thought fans would not turn up because students were in break but that was a different story to the fans that the game pulled.

The highly intensified game was forced into penalty shootouts after a goalless draw in normal time.

Isabirye Regan, Nicholas Mukibi, Kirunda Emmanuel, Sowedi Lwenda who missed and Barasa Mangoli were among the players showcasing their penalty prowess for Jinja SS.

JIPRA through successful penalties from Isabirye, Mukibi, Emmanuel, Lwenda, and captain James Jarieko sent the team into jubilations securing their 5-4 victory.

After the game, JIPRA was awarded its historical maiden Elite Games Boys Football Gold medals and trophy dethroning Standard High School Zzana who bowed out from the group stages this time.

Rivals Jinja Secondary School were silver medalists while Westville High were bronze medalists after wiping Kawempe Muslim 2-0 in the third-place playoff

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games Basketball: Buddo SS And Jinja College Crowned ChampionsUSSSAElite Games Basketball
post.Content:
By Catherine Kasemeza

The USSSA Elite Games 2024 reached its pinnacle with an exhilarating 5x5 match between Buddo SS and Jinja SS, culminating in a final score of 44-27. The intensity of the competition was palpable as both teams showcased their exceptional skills and determination.

Following the gripping match, the closing ceremony commenced, where the outstanding performers were duly recognized and honored. The coveted awards were presented to the best overall winners, who had demonstrated exceptional prowess throughout the tournament.

In the boys' category, the Jinja SS team was awarded the silver medals for their remarkable performance. Meanwhile, the Jinja College team emerged victorious, securing the gold medals and solidifying their status as champions.

In the girls' division, the Buddo SS team emerged triumphant, showcasing their exceptional talent and teamwork. The Jinja SS team secured the second position, displaying their commendable skills. Lastly, the Gombe SS team secured the third position, demonstrating their resilience and determination.

The USSSA Elite Games 2024 provided a platform for these exceptional athletes to showcase their abilities and compete at the highest level. The dedication, sportsmanship, and passion exhibited by all the participants were truly commendable.

As we reflect on this remarkable event, we extend our heartfelt congratulations to Buddo SS and Jinja College for their well-deserved victories. Their exceptional performances have undoubtedly left an indelible mark on the USSSA Elite Games 2024, inspiring future generations of athletes to strive for greatness.

post.Title: ISF Football: USSSA President Justus Mugisha Returns After a Successful Trip to China
post.Content:
USSSA President Justus Mugisha safely returned from his trip to Dalian City, China, where he had the opportunity to finalize the inspection of the facilities that will host the prestigious ISF (International School Sports Federation) World Cup from the 17th to the 27th of May 2024. He was pleased to report that the facilities had exceeded all expectations and passed with flying colors.

Justus was invited as the President of the Technical Commission for Football by the ISF. The purpose of the trip was to conduct a thorough venue inspection from the 22nd to the 26th of January 2024. It was a privilege to represent the ISF and contribute to the successful organization of this event.

I am delighted to announce that China was been selected to host the U18 ISF World School Football Championship in Dalian from the 17th to the 27th of May 2024 and it has exceeded all expectations and passed with flying colors. This prestigious tournament will bring together talented young athletes from around the world, showcasing their skills and passion for the sport.

USSSA President Justus Mugisha in a meeting with other ISF members in China

"If all goes according to plan, Uganda will have the honor of being represented at the Football World Cup by two school girls' football teams and two school boys' teams. This is a remarkable achievement for our country, and I am confident that our teams will make us proud on the international stage", Mugisha noted

"As the President of the Technical Commission for Football at the ISF, I am committed to ensuring the highest standards of excellence in the sport. I will continue to work tirelessly to support and promote football development, both in Uganda and globally", Justus Added

Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to witnessing the success of the ISF World Cup in Dalian, China.

post.Title: USSSA Elite Games girls Football: A deeper insight into the championship surprise team.
post.Content:
By Atwiine Jude

The Elite games in Jinja had six teams vying for the girls' football gold. The competition was very tight on paper considering the presence of reigning FEASSA Champions Kawempe Muslim SS and former National and FEASSA champions St. Noa who were widely regarded as favourites for this championship.

Isingiro-based Boni Consili Girls' School traveled over 400 km to Jinja to prove a point in the 5th edition of this championship.

Meanwhile, under the stewardship of coach Hussein Saidi and his technical bench, Boni Consili capped off the championship by strongly upsetting St. Noa Girls SS in a game that was also witnessed by the Crested Cranes coach Sheryl Botes.

Boni Consili showed a great level of resilience, grip, and tenacity, especially in a game where they spent large spells in their half defending against the speedy and tricky attackers of St.Noa. In a game where Boni Consili struggled to create many goal-scoring opportunities, they had to be clinical enough in front of goal. Here the tournament's revelation who later ended up as top scorer came to the table. Rina Ariho's close tap-in was just enough to see off the game in their favor.

Rinah Ariho who is the tournament's top scorer and arguably the MVP of the championship scored 8 goals in 6 games which is more than half of the team's goals.
This shows how instrumental she was to the team's success having only failed to score against Kawempe Muslim.

By the end of the championship, Boni Consili Girl's School had scored an impressive 12 goals and conceded only on 4 occasions winning 4 of their 5 games as a result.

Boni Consili will feel undone but with plenty of positives to take from this year's edition having finished as runners-up just one point behind Kawempe Muslim SS

Boni Consili walked away happily with silver. Their next target will be the Fresh Dairy Games 2024 which makes it an even better foundation for young girls.

post.Title: Capacity Building Media Trainees Showcase Zeal For Sports Journalism And Portray Skills At Elite Games.
post.Content:
By John Wycliffe Musinguzi

Media is one of the courses that are trained under the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association capacity building training. Many students, teachers, and, sports lovers have enrolled but the enthusiasts and passionate are already benefiting from the training.

In December 2022, the first-ever media course was held at Kibuli Secondary School where passionate students and teachers attended, and discovered more knowledge about sports media.

USSSA has so far trained a total of 431 media trainees since the inception of the Capacity Building Training Program

FUFA Communications Director Ahmed Hussein, FUFA Communications officers Aminah Babirye, and Alex Kasirye have been the big brains behind the shaping of the next generation of media officers and future sports journalists.

During the previous championships, the Association has given opportunities to a limited number to showcase their capabilities in delivering media duties but always promised to increase the number with time.

At the just concluded USSSA Elite Games, seven media officers were given the opportunity to cover the games on behalf of the association with full support and facilitation.

The Seven Media Officers And Their Roles At USSSA Elite Games 2024

  • Mujwega Travor - Media Officer Football Boys
  • Jude Atwiine - Media Officer Football Girls
  • Kasemeza Catherine - Media Officer Basketball
  • Mukwaya Arnold - Media Officer Handball
  • Musinguzi John Wycliffe - Media Officer Football Boys
  • Komugisha Priscilla - Media Officer Netball
  • Nankya Saudah - Media Officer Volleyball

The participants share their experiences before, during, and after the games.


"I was a media officer for my school ( Gombe S.S) in the Fresh Diary Games that were hosted in Ntare School where I used to cover Basketball and Badminton making graphics for the matches, taking photographs, interviews. I have gained more experience from the Elite Games in different media activities for example writing stories among others." Kasemeza Catherine

"Apart from USSSA Elite Games 2024, I had covered other championships like FEASSSA, Ball Games II, and National Football Championship where I performed different duties but this was a championship that had a short time and needed work to be delivered at a higher speed which needed more accuracy. My principle is to use every championship to improve in different fields and I think I have used it well to master new tactics, hopefully, the next one I will be better." John Wycliffe Musinguzi - S4 Vaccist Kitumba Secondary School, Fort Portal

"I had very little experience ce on how to use cameras and news writing but during the games, I learned how to use a camera and news writing. I can write my own stories and post them on my Twitter handle" Mukwaya Arnold - S6 Student Akii Bua High School

"Before the Elite games, I had only been to the Fresh Dairy games in Mbarara 2023, where I had a different role. During the Elite Games, I experienced the real pressure of delivering updates in real-time. This was the best time to make mistakes and rectify them. I was also able to write up a couple of stories about Girls' Football under the guidance of the director Mr. Omaria Bosco and madam Aisha Nakato. I think I can only get better. After the Elite Games, I think I am better placed not to repeat the same mistakes and also do even more professional content." Atwiine Rugaba Jude - S6 Vaccist Uganda Martyrs High School, Lubaga

"I learnt to be more resilient and to always go an extra mile when doing things so that they turn out well" Nankya Saudah - third year student Makerere University

"I didn't have any experience before the Elite Games but I got a chance to experience what it feels like to be part of the Elite Games. It was a good experience, I learned a lot of things, made friends, and was exposed to some things I didn't know I enjoyed every moment of the Elite Games, and if given another chance I will be pleasured to work with USSSA again". Komugisha Priscila - s6 vaccist Jinja SSS

Experience- (Before) - I had the desire and passion to be one of the most celebrated photographers but I had nothing not even a helping hand to fulfill my dream.

During - It was such an honor for usssa to introduce capacity building that it was an adventure to start doing what I dreamt of, I acquired more knowledge in both photography and content creation I was given hands-on skills and awakened my dream and it was an opportunity to be the Usssa photographer since I was trained with the best instructors (Omaria Bosco, Aisha Nakato, Julius Mutebi)

After - I am now more knowledgeable in Media especially in photography and willing to go on with my career and fulfill my dream. Trevor Mujwega - S6 Vaccist Royal Giant High School

Appreciation And Encouraging Messages To Other Students


"USSSA capacity building program has done me well, it has helped me know what I can do better and what I can't do. I appreciate all my instructors who have groomed me to this level and also thank Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association for giving us a chance to prove our abilities." Komugisha Priscilla

"I urge students to engage themselves in sport because this will keep them healthy which will enable them to perform well academically. I also help them improve their public relations because they meet people from various regions of the country." Kasemeza Catherine

"I urge students to be focused and take the knowledge taken during the training seriously because it can be expounded into a career" Nankya Saudah

"With the sports sector growing day by day, everyone needs to be educated to handle most of the tasks. Capacity Building will serve the Ugandan sports sector by educating many people mostly the young ones who will grow within the games." John Wycliffe Musinguzi

"I want to encourage my fellow students, that this is a golden opportunity to enhance your knowledge in Sports because sport is no longer leisure it's a profession. Even if you have something else you are doing diverse your brain with sports knowledge because it has endless opportunities." He adds

"I had the desire and passion of being one of the most celebrated photographers but I had nothing not even a helping hand to fulfill my dream. It was such an honor for USSSA to introduce capacity building that it was an adventure to start doing what I dreamt of, I acquired more knowledge in both photography and content creation I was given hands-on skills, and awakened my dream." Mujwega Trevor

Old Is Gold, Capacity Building Program Proprietor Addresses The Young ones

While addressing all the capacity-building trainees at the Elite Games including Referees, Mr Patrick Okanya urged the students to be disciplined.


" Without discipline, you will head nowhere, even if you are a good media officer or referee you will be dumped because of your unsporting and personal behaviors because they tarnish our brand," said Okanya in a brief meeting with the trainees.

Besides discipline you must work hard, you have to deliver your best because you are not the only trained personnel but why are you the only ones here? He posed a touching question.

"Being here doesn't guarantee you a place to be on our every championship, it's through determination and hard work that you will be available for selection next time and also go for international tournaments" he added

post.Title: USSSA ATHLETICS CAPACITY BUILDING TRAINING CONCLUDED AT MAKERERE.
USSSA ATHLETICS CAPACITY BUILDING TRAINING CONCLUDED AT MAKERERE.
post.Content:
By Atwiine Jude

A capacity-building training of athletes has successfully come to a close at Makerere University sports ground.

A total of 66 participants, 18 boys, and 48 girls have been undergoing training at Makerere University and Old Kampala SS for a fortnight. The participants were selected from different schools in various regions across the country.

The residential training focused mainly on participants below the age of 18. They mainly competed in the under-12, 15, and U18 categories. There are two major international events where the athletes who emerged top will be selected to participate. ISF World Cross Country from 10th to 14th May 2024 will take place in Nairobi, Kenya, and the World Gymnasiade from 23rd to 30th October 2023 in Manama, Bahrain. Other events are on the upcoming USSSA calendar for both Zonal and National games.

The training started on 15th January 2024 and was concluded today morning 30th January 2024.  Dr. Rev. Canon Duncans Mugumya, Commissioner of Physical Education and Sports was the chief guest.

Officials that attended the closing ceremony.

  • Dr. Rev. Can. Duncans Mugumya – Commissioner Department Physical Education and Sports, Ministry of Education and Sports.
  • Grace Abalo- Senior Education Officer, Ministry of Education and Sports.
  • Hajji Twahil Kiteezaala – First Vice president USSSA
  • Harriet Margaret Apolot- 3rd Vice President USSSA
  • Mr. Okanya Patrick- President Emeritus USSSA and National Coordinator Capacity Building Programme.
  • Bayiga Justine - Coach
  • Latigo Kassim -Coach
  • Bithola Ocukune Francis – USSSA Executive Committee, West Nile.
  • Mawa James Onzima - USSSA Executive Committee, West Nile.

Dr. Rev. Can. Duncans Mugumya – Commissioner Department Physical Education and Sports, Ministry of Education and Sports. To the young athletes; you should continue doing personal training. If you develop your talent the sky is not even the limit!

Hajji Twahil Kitezala, USSSA 1st Vice President.

"Part of our mandate as the USSSA is to identify, nurture and develop talent. Here we have identified and the next part is nurturing it.We will work closely with the coaches”.

Margaret Harriet Apolot

" We had participants from the age of 11 to 18 years. These were from different regions all over the country. As they complete this training it can be seen that they have improved in different aspects like physical fitness."

The children in Camp were mainly primary students considering the age category required for this particular training.

The Participants

Otage Solomon, 18 a student from Ngora High School- Kumi was also boys' captain while in camp at Old Kampala SS.

"The environment has been very convenient. This training has enabled me to improve on my time of running and speed. The coaches were there to help us and advise us especially with arm swinging and leg lifting among others".

"I have learnt to work out properly and also be consistent in training. I look up to Cheptegei and Kiprotich as my role models." Malaika Nangono, 11 year old primary seven pupil at Taiba International.

 “Parents should interest themselves in the activities of their children and support them at all times.I am grateful to the people at Ministry of Education who directed me to USSSA as I was looking for a place where my child could train as she loves to run. We do not get so much information in International schools as regards such activities”.Rita Namakiika , a mother to Malaika Nangono who had been part of the camp.

post.Title: Sporting And Developing Talent From The Grassroots, 9 Students Summoned For National Team.
post.Content:
By John Wycliffe Musinguzi

On 25th/01/2024, Crested Cranes Head Coach Sheryl Botes traveled to Jinja City to follow the proceedings of the USSSA Elite Games which kicked off on that day, a definition of a real talent discoverer and promoter

Her journey has delivered fruits with 9 students having summoned and added to the teen Cranes camp which is preparing for the FIFA U17 World Cup qualifier against Cameroon.

Uganda Women's U17 team (Teen Cranes) will start its World Cup dream with a test of Cameroon on Saturday 3rd February 2024 at St Mary's Kitende Stadium.

The 9 players were added on merit after a stellar performance and hard work in their opening games as explained by Botes. The championship reigning champions and powerhouse in Ugandan women's football Kawempe Muslim has dominated the list.

The 9 players and their schools.

  1. Imelda Kasemiire - St Noah Girls School Zzana
  2. Sylivia Kabene - St Noah Girls School Zzana
  3. Lilian Nakirya - St Noah Girls School Zzana
  4. Vanessa Namazi - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
  5. Agnes Nabukenya - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
  6. Dorcus Kisakye - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
  7. Shadia Nabirye - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
  8. Monica Nanono - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
  9. Mary Augi - Jinja Secondary School.

St Noah Girls School Zzana has got three players on the rota, shot-stopper Lilian Nakyirya, exciting midfielder Sylvia Kabene, and skillful midfielder Imelda Kasemiire who gets her first appearance in the national colours.

FUFA Women Super League's top scorer after the first round Agnes Nabukenya was another big boost for Botes alongside CAF African Schools CECAFA zonal qualifiers top scorer Shadia Nabirye, more players from Kawempe are Monica Nanono, Dorcus Kisakye, and Vanessa Namazi.

Energetic Mary Augi was the only player chosen from hosts Jinja Secondary School.

Immediately after the climax of the Elite Games, players joined camp on Sunday 27th, they have been training well and all eyes are on the game.

Botes wants to build to build players from the junior teams to the senior side.


"I want to start these girls when they are still young, they have the talent and the capability to make steady progress," said Botes.

"These are the same players we are going to use for all Africa games for U20 because they can and if we see they are not ready we shall bring them back to U17 to build them more. I have even seen players on the U20 that we shall promote to crested cranes soon" Sherly added.

post.Title: USSSA, UPSSA in advanced stages for Joint School's Sports Federation.
post.Content:
USSSA, UPSSA in advanced stages for Joint School's Sports Federation.

The Uganda Secondary School Sports Association, Uganda Primary School Sports Association (UPSSA), and National Sports Officers Association (NASOA) held a meeting on 8th January 2024 at USSSA offices to plan for the collaboration.

As an international norm one school's sports federation in a country is recognized, though the partnership will serve in other areas like capacity building, training camps and administration and event management.

In his address, USSSA President Mugisha explained to the members present on why this collaboration is important and what the collaboration will entail.

Odong Sammy the Assistant Commissioner Physical Education and Sports told both parties that they must have a constitution.

“Take time while working on this new constitution, seek advice if and when you need it. We need to organize and plan because there are a lot of things you can do if we work together with USSSA” Sammy Odong, Assistant Commissioner Physical Education and Sports, Ministry of Education and Sports

During the Press conference today 1st February, Justus Mugisha, the USSSA President elaborated more about what the collaboration will serve. "Our partnership started last year, we offered Capacity Building training to teachers. This year, we will provide Administration and event management which includes the secretariat, media, branding, certificate and accreditation, Capacity Building training". President Mugisha.

"We are going to form a joint sports federation that will unite us since one school's sports association is recognized in each country at the international level" Justus added

"For capacity building training our target was to train 5000 participants but we managed to train 7524 trainees which was an achievement and 255 of these were Primary School teachers who were trained during the games in Mbarara in September 2023" President Justus Mugisha.

USSSA has advanced and trained 108 students and teachers for level II in refereeing and umpiring in football, volleyball, netball and basketball. It has gone forward to hold two athletics training camps at Old Kampala Secondary school (66 participants) and in Kapchorwa with 72 participants.

post.Title: New Leagues Introduced as Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association Highlights On 2024 Activities.
post.Content:
Special Needs Education (SNE) games and secondary schools’ leagues are the new innovations that will be on USSSA activities calendar for 2024.

The schools’ leagues will be competed by schools that are neighboring one another and the SNE's will be for students with disabilities.

"While not all schools cater for special needs students, we have identified a few that cater for these needs and have the facilities. Special Needs Competitions will be introduced in ball games II, this year we are starting with goal ball under the guidance of the different federations." -President Justus Mugisha

"Every student has a right to play for at least one hour per day, the new lower curriculum provides enough time for children to play. Schools must provide facilities for each child to play for at least one hour, the new sports law provides for facilities for at least 15 different sports in every school" President Mugisha added.

According to the Mugisha, USSSA Is Advocating For The Following

•Sports day to be mandatory in every school.

• Each school to participate in at least 3 interschool competitions

• Artificial turf for schools to be classified as scholastic material, hence tax-free

Competition format.

•All teams are going to play same number of matches

•All positions will be competed for hence classification matches will be put in place

• Number of competition days reduced from 14 to 9 for football boys

Competition Rules and Regulations

"The rules have been drafted and sent to the department of Physical Education and Sports pending the signature of the Commissioner. Once they are signed they will be released." Justus Mugisha, President

On player transfer guidelines schools are required to submit students on sports bursary

"Player transfer guidelines have also been put in place ,players who are on bursary can only move from one school to another with the consent of the former school headteacher" President Justus Mugisha

Slots Allocations

Slots will be given on merit according to the following;

•Last Year's Slot Allocation

•Last Year's Slot Utilization

•Last Year's level of competition at the zone

•Interest in development of the sport

•Last year's performance at National championships

USSSA Organizes several numbers of championships starting with the Elite Games in January which act as a curtain raiser.

Other championships include;

Fresh Dairy Secondary School Games –May

Secondary School National Football Boys’ Championship May

Secondary School National Ball Games II-July

Secondary School National Swimming Gala-

post.Title: No more free player movements for students on bursary as online registration opens.
post.Content:
The guidelines and screening procedures revealed for the year 2024 during the press conference held on 1st February ,2024 at GNS Plaza, Old Kampala.

Normal online registration opened on 1st January 2024 and will close on 29th February 202

There will be special registration to be done at National level starting on the 1st of March 2024 to 15th March 2024 for any player who has not been enrolled (free agents) by the 29th of February 2023.

Schools are required to submit (by registering) all their players that they intend to play during the various sports activities whether on sports bursaries or not so that they are not encroached by other schools. However, if two or more schools are having disputes over a player there is a committee at USSSA ready to guide them. Any complaints should be put in writing and addressed to the Mugisha Christopher, the Chief Executive Officer, USSSA.

"Player transfer guidelines have also been put in place, players who are on bursary can only move from one school to another with the consent of the former school and players not on bursary may move freely" President Justus Mugisha

Online registration guidelines

• The registration opened on 1st January and will close on 15th March 2024.

• Any player who has not been enrolled will become a free agent after the 29th of February 2024.

• Special registration to be done at National level.

• Only players dully registered will be allowed to take part in USSSA competitions.

• Every student should be registered using his or her Learner Identification Number (LIN).

• School albums of registered players will be released by the secretariat to the district before kickoff of qualifiers.

To register, use this link https://usssaug.com/ .For any inquiries call 0393256054

post.Title: USSSA Products Watch: Goal made from the classroom as Uganda , Cameroon share spoils at the FIFA U17 women's world cup qualifiers first leg.
post.Content:
By John Wycliffe Musinguzi | Featured Image by FUFA

Kawempe Muslim's trio Esther Nangendo , Shadia Nabirye and Agnes Nabukenya combined efforts in the 34th minute to give Uganda the lead.

FIFA U17 women's world cup qualifiers.
Full time
Uganda 1-1 Cameroon
Agnes Nabukenya 34'
Ernestine Heutchou 50'

Students on match day squad.
Starters.
Lilian Nakiirya - St Noa Girls School Zzana
Agnes Nabukenya - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
Shadia Nabirye - Kawempe Muslim Secondary School
Bushira Muhammad Nalunkuma - Rines Secondary School
Sylivia Kabene - St Noa Girls School Zzana

Substitutes
Imelda Kasemiire - St Noa Girls School Zzana
Angella Adeke Taggy High School.

The draw against the physical opponent Cameroon was held at St. Mary’s Stadium-Kitende, on Saturday 3rd February2024 in game that was not allowed to have fans.

In the 4th minute, Uganda had an early chance to take the lead after speed merchant Sylivia Kabene was brought down few meters away from the box but saw Agnes Nabukenya's powerful direct shot go over the bar.

Both teams failed to control and stabilize the game instead it was up and down play where we saw the game reach 20 minutes with very few chances from both sides.

In the 25th minute, the visitors had a chance to take the lead after Uganda's defensive error which set up Cameroon's forward Fraiche Tiwa Melong Lys one on one with custodian Lilian Nakiirya who stood tall to save Uganda and the score remained level.

In the 34th minute , Bortes' side got a relief with Agnes Nabukenya's goal to put Uganda ahead.

The goal was a result of a brilliant interplay between Kawempe's Shadia Nabirye and Esther Nangendo where Nabirye finally set up Nabukenya from the left flank to slot the ball past Cameroon custodian Chelsea Ngole.

Despite the poor display from both sides, Agnes' goal was the deference at half time.

At the start of the second half, Ernestine Heutchou capitalized on Uganda's defensive sleep to go for power outside the box and her shot found the back of the net to level terms in the 50th minute.

In the 83rd minute, Uganda had a chance to take the lead again after a well delivered cross from Sylivia Kabene but Shadia Nabirye right in the middle of the goal struck the ball over the bar but seemingly fauled from behind but the penalty appeal was rubbed with a play on by referee Lamia Atman.

In the 89th minute, Agnes Nabukenya had a chance to double her tally and regain Uganda's lead but her powerful shot outside the 18 yard box went over the bar.

The game ended level and return leg awaits on 9th February 2024 at Yaounde Stadium in Cameroon.

The winner on aggregate will face the winner between Zambia and Tanzania at the next round of qualifiers.

The 8th edition of the FIFA U17 women's world cup will be held in Dominican Republic from Wednesday 16th October to Sunday 3rd November 2024 with 16 teams from 6 confederations competing for the title.

Sheryl Botes, the team head coach is more confident and still believes in her girls that the mission can be accomplished.
"We aimed at scoring goals because it's the only way we can win games but it didn't happen and we are looking forward to work on that" Botes said during the press conference.

"With the players we have I am very confident that we shall shine only that we need to give them time and confidence" Botes added

post.Title: USSSA groomed athletes sweep National cross-country championship in Tororo
post.Content:
The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) trained athletes showcased exceptional talent and determination at the National Cross-Country Championship held at the Tororo Golf Course today, leaving an indelible mark on the prestigious event.


With a great performance that captured the essence of sportsmanship and dedication, USSSA athletes illuminated the competition with their outstanding achievements .National cross-country championship was used to identify athletes that will be used at the international level.

USSSA athletes demonstrated their prowess and mettle on the challenging cross-country course with other ones un matched .

Guided by their coaches the athelatics where top notch this was due to a three weeks training camp that unvailed talents , according to their head coach Rapheal Kassajja says that the camp was to useful to in the indefication proccess.

" It is the only way to go by starting at a high stage so that the future can be determined ,training according to the law of the game put Uganda on the next level because as a country we're known for the best athletes ." Raphael Kasajja ,a coach.


From the starting to the finish line, USSSA athletes exemplified the spirit of endurance and resilience, navigating treacherous terrain and surmounting obstacles with unwavering determination.

With each stride, they propelled themselves forward, fueled by a burning desire to excel and a commitment to representing their schools and association with pride.

Their stellar performances, marked by speed, agility, and tactical prowess, earned them accolades and admiration from peers and supporters gathered at the Tororo Golf Club.


In the U15 women Faustine Chepteris from Kween district was spot on to win the race clocking 10:06.03 followed by Mercy Chemusto- 10:08.08 in the second position and Rispa Chekwemboi- Kween- 10:15.02 in the third position as in the U15 men Mathew Kiplagat from Kapchorwa won the race with 09:10.06 followed by Chemunumwa Lucia -Kween - 9:11.02 in the second position and Kenneth Bekele scored 9:12.05 in the third position.

Meanwhile, in the U12 boys category Kibet Celeb 02:57:01 won the race Sande Celeb 02:57:01 in the second position and Loout Kizito 02:59:07 in the third position in the same category girls shinned with a high speed as Chemutai Shirah 03:12:06 in the first position followed by Chemutai Esther 03:13:06 and Chebet Oliver 3:13:06 in the third position.

Patrick Okanya USSSA President emeritus cofirmed full support to these athletics and promised to organise these training camps on annual basis .

USSSA organised two athletics training camps in January 2024.

Their shining performances at the National Cross-Country Championship not only reaffirmed USSSA’s commitment to nurturing talent but also heralded a new era of athletic achievement and pride within Uganda’s secondary school sports community.

.

Both athletes received a new pair of shoes for their achievements.

post.Title: NDEJJE SSS promises to organise the best schools' tournament in 2024.
post.Content:
Ndejje Senior Secondary School has started the preparations for the Fresh Dairy Secondary School Games 2024. 

The 2024 Ball Games I are scheduled to take place from 26th April to May 5th 2024 at Ndejje SS in Luweero District.

Ndejje SSS applied and won the bid to host the games after a successful inspection was carried out at various schools in November 2023.

Ndejje SSS will co-host the games with their neighbours Ndejje University.

The Deputy Headteacher Mrs.Eyatoru Eunice Yung who spoke on behalf of the Headteacher Canon. Dr. Charles Kahingiriza who was grateful to USSSA and the Ministry of Education and Sports for entrusting Ndejje SS with hosting these games and promised that they will do their best to deliver a good tournament.

"We thank you for entrusting Ndejje SS with the responsibility to organize these games. We are very humbled and hope to give our best during these games come April 26th 2024." Mrs. Eyatoru Eunice Yung, Deputy Headteacher (Administration).

In addition to the facilities and venues at Ndejje SS and Ndejje University there are several grounds that will be used namely Bombo Army SS, Bombo UMEA,St. Janan SS,St. Johns Nandere, Standard High Zana (Ndejje Campus),Nalinya Lwantale Girls' School,St. Mary's Namaliga among others within the community.

 We are still doing several preparations to host you in the most favorable manner. Please come prepared knowing that everything you will need in terms of accommodation, healthcare and everything that has been asked of us is all set for you." Busulwa Derrick ,Games teacher Ndejje SSS.

Online registration for schools and participants before the zonal and district qualifiers is currently taking place. For more information call 0393256054

post.Title: USSSA Products Watch: Nine Capacity Building Trainees Summoned For CAVB Refereeing Course.
post.Content:
By John Wycliffe Musinguzi

The Confederation of African Volleyball CAVB National referees course is scheduled from 19th to 23rd February 2024 in Kampala city, upon completion the participants will be fully fledged National USSSA and UVF referees and will also be registered in CAVB database.

The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association capacity building training no longer needs hype but it's fruits continues to fully define the program.

From the football referees and media excellence it has now turned the page to volleyball as nine of the a thousands trained volleyball officiating officials awaits the continent badge.

At USSSA, Volleyball officiation is overseen by international referee Innocent Komaketch who like other instructors has also mentored his students and gone on to monitor their performance after the training which has helped them to perfect their duties.

Besides other three disciplines, volleyball is among the sport that has held two courses under the USSSA capacity building training (level 1 and level 2), level II was just held for it's first time in December last year and more are to come.

The Nine Referees Summoned For The Training.

  1. Nahabwe Alfred - Engari SS (Kazo).
    He practiced during UVF league games after his 1st & 2 Level capacity building referees course. He was not officially nominated but attended the championship as a volunteer.
  2. Kobusingye Cynthia - Sport Scientist based in Kampala.
    Attended both Level 1 and 2 Capacity building referees course. She has been officiating league matches at federation level. One of the top referees among ladies.
  3. Katusabe Jackie - Teacher (Namakwa SS Mukono). Attended both level 1 and 2 capacity building referees course and shown zeal to higher levels.
  4. Akankunda Bridget - Student (Boniconsilli Girls ) Sheema.
    Attended both level 1 and 2 capacity building referees course. Practiced during Uganda Volleyball Federation Western league games in Mbarara, one of the great talents among girls.
  5. Nampeera Sherinah - student ( Namugongo Sec and Voc sch).
    Attended both level 1 and 2 capacity building referees course,she practiced during school training and league games.
  6. Ainembabazi Arnold Major - sport scientist. He was already UVF trained referee before doing capacity building referees course, he has been officiating league matches.
  7. Dramadrio Janet - Student (Jinja SS).
    Attended both Level 1 and 2 capacity building referees course and practiced with Jinja Volleyball Club during trainings. One of the strong female referees.
  8. Kimbowa Alex Alvin - Student ( St. Antonio Orthodox SS, Mukono). Attended both level 1 and 2 capacity building referees course, he practiced during National University Games last December at Uganda Christian University and also during league games.
  9. Obbo Alfred - Teacher (Brain Trust School, Nansana). He was already Uganda Volleyball Federation trained referee before attending capacity building referees course and has been officiating national league.

The development comes a few weeks after some of these referees had already showcased their prowess at the USSSA Elite Games 2024, the USSSA calendar opener which was held in Jinja City later January Jinja Secondary School and Jinja College the hosts and co hosts respectively as Bukedea Comprehensive emerged both boys and girls champions in the discipline.

"All these referees officiated under minimal supervision. Nearly all of them will attend the confederation of African Volleyball (CAVB) National Referees course scheduled in Kampala 19th - 23rd February 2024. Upon successful completion of the course, they will be fully fledged National USSSA/UVF referees and will also be registered in CAVB Database." Said Senior Volleyball Instructor and Referee Innocent Komaketch.

post.Title: Planning meeting for zonal chairpersons and secretaries held.
post.Content:
The USSSA president Justus Mugisha has thanked the zonal chairpersons and secretaries for the good work they are doing at zonal levels during a planning meeting held on February 15th,2024 at the USSSA offices in Old Kampala.

Top on the agenda was the road map and guidelines for USSSA and competition formats for USSSA Championships in 2024.

The meeting was also attended by USSSA Executive committee members Apolot Harriet Margaret (3rd Vice President) Langa Geoffrey, Bithola Francis Ocukune,Ayub Khalifan Kiyingi,Godliver Apolot,Alwenyi Alice, Elizabeth Tindimwebwa,Muhumuza Richard and President Emeritus Okanya Patrick.

In his address, Justus Mugisha the President mentioned the following.

Uganda to Host FEASSSA games at Bukedea Comprehensive School and Amus College College.

"I would like to remind you that Uganda is hosting the East Africa Secondary games (FEASSSA) in the Eastern Region this year. Bukedea Comprehensive will co-host together with Amus College School.The two schools have invested heavily to put facilities in place including a swimming pool and an arena that can accommodate about 4000 spectators. This is good because the facilities have been put up within the schools and can always be used for any other school tournaments."

ISF Events

Mr. Mugisha informed the members present of all the ISF events that Uganda will be taking part in and reminded them why it is important to prepare early enough for international events.

“For example we will selected 48 athletes out of 72 who attended the training in January for the ISF World Cross Country championship in Nairobi but the participants will definitely require to have processed for them early enough so maximum cooperation is important for all of us.”

Online registration

The USSSA online registration portal opened on 1st January and will close on February 29,2024 and only athletes born on or after January 1st 2004 will be registered on the portal as explained by Emmanuel Kasakya, Director of Competitions, USSSA.

ZONES CALENDAR - QUALIFIERS 2024Download

On Capacity Building Mugisha appreciated the secretaries for constantly mobilizing participants to take part in the training. Over seven thousand participants have been trained since December 2022 to January 2024.

"We have trained over 7000 participants in the past year at several venues. We are very pleased with the turn up. There are provisions for participants to advance to the next level. For example, football refereeing had 41 participants trained for Level II in January 2024 at Kibuli SS and these referees were deployed at the recent Elite games in Jinja afterwards. With your co-operation all Beginners' courses training will be organized at district level and only Level II organized at National level except for sports that whose participants remain fewer. We as USSSA will facilitate the instructors as well as branding and anything else you may need." Justus Mugisha, USSSA President.

Members had an interactive session in which they gave feedback to the Presdient and his Executive Committee.

"The people of Busoga are grateful for the opportunity to host the 2024 USSSA Elite Games, it was a one of a kind event that despite rival schools playing in the final, there were no indiscipline cases from both the athletes and the fans". Musota Daniel, Chairman Busoga Zone.

"We thank the USSSA President for noting the challenges in Sebei and Karamoja Zones, we are very glad that you have given us an affirmative action". Bukose Issa Asadi Chairperson Sebei Zone

IN PICTURES

post.Title: USSSA Polls: By-Elections For Vacant Positions To Be Held
post.Content:
Following recent transfers of school administrators by the Ministry of Education and Sports, some Zonal and District positions have remained vacant and occupied by those in acting positions. To that note, USSSA has released the program for the by-elections to fill these vacant slots across the country.

The Association has communicated February 29 as the deadline to declare all vacant positions to enable the returning officer to organize elections to fill the vacant positions.

The letter signed off by Mugisha Christopher Banage (USSSA CEO) clearly states that some positions became vacant because of the recent transfer of headteachers and teachers by the Ministry of Education and Sports.

post.Title: Uganda Primary School Sports Association holds Ordinary Assembly.
post.Content:
The Executive Committee of Uganda Primary School Sports Association has held an Ordinary Assembly at the GNS Plaza in Old Kampala on 22nd February 2024.

The meeting was attended by Justus Mugisha, USSSA President and Mugisha Christopher, USSSA Chief Executive Officer, Ms. Abalo Grace a Senior Education Officer, Gilbert Orikiriza and Namulalo Betty all from the department of Physical Education and Sports, Ministry of Education and sports together with Uganda Primary School Sports Association led by Pauline Musigire and Bwambale William, President and General Secretary respectively.

The other members in attendance were Games teachers form several Primary Schools and districts namely Maracha,Nebbi,Mbale,Kisoro,Isingiro,Kabarole,Gulu City,MasindiMunicipality,Napak,Moroto,Buvuma,Budaka,Rakai,Telego,Sororti,Kitgum,Kibuku,Kiboga,Hoima,Kikuube,Kiryandongo,Bugiri,Rukungiri,Kiruhura,Bugweri,Luuka,Sironko,Abim,Koboko,Ntoroko,Kabale,Kyenjojo,Kasanda,Kumi,Dokolo,Buyende,Serere,Otuke,Kasese,Kibale,Kagadi,Masaka,Namayingo,Amudat,Pallisa,Pakwach,Amuria,Bukedea,Kanungu,Busia,Kaberamaido ,Nabilatuk,Namisindwa, Nwoya, Kwania,Arua,MadiOkollo,Moyo,Entebbe ,Kakumiro ,Tororo Nakapiripirit,Luwero ,Jinja,Bukomansimbi,Mubende,Butaleja and Kyankwanzi.

The remarks

Justus Mugisha, USSSA President

"I would like to thank you for accepting to be hosted here today. The mandate to run school sports lies with the Ministry of Education and Sports under the Department of Physical Education and Sports (PES)." Mugisha Justus, USSSA President.

"Talent Identification starts at Primary level and not Secondary level as many people think. Each one of us here plays a vital role in identifying these talents. USSSA organized a capacity building training during the Uganda Primary Games in Mbarara (2023) specifically for Primary School teachers. The 255 participants can now coach and officiate in their various districts and regions."

Gilbert Orikiriza, Desk Officer for Primary Schools Games and Sports

“We are previledged to be here with such a big team. We need to build consensus on how we shall move forward. We would like to see this association become more responsive. The constitution you had in place was obsolete yet you continued to use it but it good that to have adopted the new one today.”

“In a country like ours where sports can’t take its own direction. This association needs to be guided and remember that no one is above the law therefore we should consult one another whenever necessary.”

All the 35 articles in the new constitution were read by Musigire Pauline, President UPSSSA. The member later adopted the constitution.

Below are the key highlights in the constitution.

Article 1: The official name of the association shall be Uganda Primary Schools Sports Association (UPSSA).

Article 2: UPSSSA Headquarters shall be in Kampala and it shall be affiliated to Uganda secondary school sports association (USSSA) while any other sports bodies shall be decided by the General Assembly from time to time.

Article 4: Membership shall be open to all paid up Zones and each zone to be represented by five delegates in the General Assembly.

Article 5: District Primary School Sports Associations (DPSSA) will be the association recognized as per the geographical location of the schools except for Kampala which will be based on divisions.

Article 12: The athletes to take part in Primary School competitions should strictly be Under 12 and 14.

Special Needs is another category of participants.

Article 14: The composition of the Executive Committee led by the President and will constitute 21 members with a few positions ring fenced for females (the 3rd Vice President, the Secretary for women affairs and at least one zonal delegate for each zone).

The qualifications and duties of each executive committee member are clearly outlined.

Article 17: Elections

Elections shall be by secret ballot.

Executive shall hold office for four years but maybe re-elected and no official shall serve in the same position for more than two terms consecutively.

The winner shall be decided by simple majority.

One must be a delegate in order to qualify to contest.

Article 18: Standing Committees and sub-committees will be appointed on assumption of office by the Executive Committee. These will include the following Finance, Technical, Publicity, Competitive, Disciplinary, Appeals and Marketing.

Article 19: Finance

The financial period shall be annual.

There shall be a fee contributed by the District Association (School) for every competition.

UPSSA shall have powers to look for sponsors of different sports activities.

Article 26: Secretariat

This will carry out all administrative work of UPSSA and shall be led by the Chief Executive Officer (whose duties and responsibilities are clearly outlined) who will be appointed by the executive committee

The members adopted the constitution.

Roadmap and Guidelines for the forth coming Elections 2024 were read in detail to the members by Bwambale William, General Secretary UPSSA.

Below are the key Highlights of the Election guidelines.

District Elections will take place in March 9,2024 at various district headquarters, Zonal Elections on Saturday March 16,2024 and the national elections will be held on Saturday 23rd March ,2024 at GNS Hotel.

The electoral committee will have three members led by Patrick Alfred Okanya former USSSA President who had also been a returning officer at FUFA before, Namulalo Betty a desk officer from department of Physical Education and Sports (Ministry of Education and Sports) and Ssenyonga Brian,Wakiso Sports Officer and Executive Committee member ,National Association of Sports Officers.

post.Title: Electoral guidelines for the upcoming zonal, district and national UPSSA elections released.
post.Content:
Electoral guidelines released for the upcoming zonal, district and national UPSSA elections.

UPSSA-DISTRICT-ELECTION-DOCUMENTSDownload

All the information and guidelines on the upcoming Uganda Primary School Sports Association (UPSSA) elections have been released during a press conference held on 28th February 2024 at the GNS Plaza in Old Kampala.

The press conference chaired by Mr. Okanya Patrick Alfred the returning officer assured all interested parties that the elections will be free and fair.

Ssenyonga Brian will represent all sports officers under National Sports Officer Association (NASOA)

District Elections will be the start to the whole exercise on 9th March 2023 at all district headquarters.

The executive positions to contest for at this level are Chairperson, Vice Chairperson, Secretary & Assistant Secretary, Treasurer, Organizing Secretary, Secretary for Women, Committee Members (3 Members) and an Ex-Official Association of District Primary School Head teacher.

There will be five delegates to the zone who will be nominated by the District Executive and at least one of them must be a female.

Zonal Elections will take place on the 16th of March at the Zonal Headquarters and below are the guidelines

-Each district will be represented by 5 voting Delegates.

-All delegates must be Professional Teachers

-Each delegate is to carry National Identification and Introduction Letter

-All the delegates must be representatives of schools in Districts within the respective zones.

The executive positions at the zonal level are Chairperson, Vice chairperson, Secretary, Assistant secretary, Treasurer, Organizing Secretary, Secretary for Women and One Coordinator (s) for each of the various Sports disciplines.

National elections will be the climax of the whole exercise and these will take place on 23rd March at Old Kampala. The positions at this level are President,1st Vice President,2nd Vice President,3rd Vice President, Secretary for Women, Regional Representative and an Ex Official Association of Primary School

Headteachers of (UPSHA) representative (to be named by UPSHA National Executive)

The regions and zones to be represented during the national elections include the following Buganda (Mukono,Luwero, Wakiso, Mpigi & Masaka), Eastern (Teso, Sebei, Bugisu, Bukedi & Busoga) ,Northern (Acholi, Lango And Karamoja), Kampala (the divisions of Kawempe, Rubaga, Nakawa,Central & Makindye),Western (At least one female Kigezi, Ankole, Rwenzori And Bunyoro ).

There will be three delegates for each region(zone) except for Kampala that will send two.

National Nominations

Zonal Nominations

1 Nomination of Candidates February 29 – March 6, 2024

2 Submission of Nomination Forms March 3– 7, 2024

3 Payment of Nomination fee March 1 – 7, 2024

4 Display of Candidates Lists March 7 – 8, 2024

5 Elections Saturday March 9, 2024

District Nominations

- Nomination of Candidates March 9 -13, 2024

- Submission of Nomination Forms March 9 -13, 2024

- Payment of Nomination fee March 9 -13, 2024

- Display of Candidates Lists March 15, 2024

- Elections of Candidates March 16, 2024

National Nominations

-Nomination of Candidates March 16 – 19, 2024

- Submission of Nomination Forms March 17 - 19, 2024

- Payment of Nomination fee March 17 - 19, 2024

- Display of Candidates Lists March 22, 2024

- Elections March 23, 2024

NOMINATION FEES

Nomination Fees must be paid in the Bank Account/Mobile Money as follows:

Payments can only be made on: USSSA ACCOUNT (UPSSA Currently HAS NO BANK ACCOUNT)

Steps to follow

a.Your Surname and District as Depositor Eg. Okanya Palisa (Okanya is Surname and Palisa is the District)

b. Account Title: - Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA)

b. Name of the Bank: - Centenary Rural Development Bank (Entebbe Road Branch)

c. Account Number: 3010609431

d.References: Name of Candidate & Position

MOBILE MONEY

a. USSSA Official Number: 0393-256054

b. NAME: ASSIMWE RONAH 0774165108

District Elections

1 Chairperson UGX 50,000

2 Vice Chairperson UGX 40,000

3 Secretary UGX 20,000

4 Treasurer UGX 39,000

5 Organizing Secretary UGX 15,000

6 Secretary for Women UGX 14,000

7 Committee Members UGX 10,000

Zonal Elections

1 Chairperson UGX 100,000

2 Vice Chairperson UGX 80,000

3 Treasurer UGX 80,000

4 Secretary UGX 50,000

5 Assistant Secretary UGX 30,000

7 Organizing Secretary UGX 25,000

8 Secretary for Women UGX 25,000

9 Coordinators UGX 20,000

National Elections

1 President UGX 500,000

2 Vice Presidents UGX 300,000

3 Secretary for Women UGX 295,000

4 Regional Representatives UGX 200,000

ALL INQUIRIES should be directed to: -

1.SSENYONGA BRIAN, Assistant Returning Officer (0789380066 / 0701787688)

2.NAMULALO BETTY Assistant Returning Officer, PES/MoES (0782719197 / 0704782786)

3.AGUTI ANGELLA (Personal Assistant Returning Officer (0787682482 / 0701606257)

4.OKANYA ALFRED PATRICK,Returning Officer (0772589370, Email: patokanya@gmail.com)

QUALIFICATIONS

Zonal Level

1. For all positions, the candidate must be:

a) A representative of a school in the district.

b) a professional Primary school teacher currently teaching in a school in the district

2. Chairperson: must be either a substantive Headteacher of a registered Primary School or a Director of a private Primary School recognized by Ministry of Education and Sports. Such a Director must-have professional qualifications that meet the minimum academic requirement to be a Headteacher of a government Primary School.

3. Treasurer: must be either a substantive Headteacher of a registered Primary school or a Director of a private Primary school recognized by Ministry of Education and Sports. Such a Director must have professional qualifications as a Primary School Headteacher.

4. Secretary & Assistant Secretary: Must be a registered and practicing Classroom Teacher.

5. Secretary for Women: must be a female

6. Other positions are open

NOMINATION

a) The nomination forms may be picked from the Returning Officer, or downloaded from the internet

b) The candidate, nominator and seconder must be coming from different schools

c) One need not be a delegate to qualify to contest for a position

d) Upon closure of nomination, if a position has not attracted any candidate, such a position will be filled by nomination on the Election Day. The candidates to be nominated must meet the qualification and the financial requirement for that position.

MODE OF VOTING

a) Voting will be by secret ballot; The Electoral Committee will decide on the validity of the ballots.

b) Voting by proxy or by letter will not be allowed (only people physically present are eligible to vote

c) Results will be by simple majority – candidate with the highest number of the valid votes, will be declared elected.

d) In the event of a tie for No. 1, another round of voting will be done for the tying candidates

i. In a second round, the candidate with the higher number of votes will be elected.

ii. In the second round, if the 2 candidates would receive the same number of votes, there will be

a third round.

iii. In a third round, the candidate with the higher number of votes will be elected.

iv. In the third round, if the 2 candidates receive the same number of votes the decision will be made by lot taken by the 2 candidates and the result declared by the Electoral Committee publicly.

v. a ballot will be considered invalid if it is marked in any other way other than as instructed.

e) Each delegate must tick only one candidate on the ballot except the case where they are clearly instructed to tick more than one name.

f) Fully nominated candidates may be voted for even in absencia

Zonal Level

1. For all positions, the candidate must be:

a. A representative of a school in the district.

b. A professional Primary school teacher

2. Chairperson: must be either a substantive Headteacher of a registered Primary School or a Director of a private Primary School recognized by Ministry of Education and Sports. Such a Director must have professional qualifications as a Headteacher Primary School.

3. Treasurer: must be either a substantive Headteacher of a registered Primary school or a Director of a private Primary school recognized by Ministry of Education and Sports. Such a Director must have professional qualifications as a Headteacher Primary School.

4. Secretary and Assistant Secretary: Must be a registered and practicing Classroom Teacher.

5. Secretary for Women: must be a female

NOMINATION

i. The nomination forms may be picked from the Returning Officer, or downloaded from the internet.

ii. The candidate, nominator and seconder must be coming from different Districts

iii. The nomination form must be signed by the Chairperson and Secretary of the nominating and seconding districts

iv. Only persons coming from paid up districts are eligible for nomination and voting

v. Upon closure of nomination, if a position has not attracted any candidate, such a position will be filled by nomination on the Election Day

vi. Nomination and secondment for zonal candidate must only be done by districts within the Zone.

National Level

a) President

i. Must be a substantive Head teacher of a recognized Government Primary School or a Director of a

Private Primary School recognized by the Ministry of Education and Sports who holds professional

qualifications of a Teacher.

ii. Must have been on UPSSA National Executive Committee for at Least one Term

b) 1

st Vice President

i. Must be a substantive Head teacher of a recognized Government Primary School or a Director of a

private Primary School recognized by the Ministry of Education and Sports who holds professional

qualifications of a teacher.

ii. Must have been on UPSSA National Executive committee for at least one term

c) 2

nd Vice President

i. Must be a substantive Head teacher of a recognized Government Primary School or a Director of a

private Primary School recognized by the Ministry of Education and Sports who holds professional

qualifications of a teacher.

ii. Must have served as a Zonal, District, City, Municipality, Estate Chairperson for at least one term

d) 3

rd Vice President

i. Must be a substantive Head teacher of a recognized Government Primary School or a Director of a

private Primary School recognized by the Ministry of Education and Sports who holds professional

qualifications of a teacher.

ii. Must have served as a Zonal, District, City, Municipality, Estate Chairperson for at least one term

iii. Provided that none of the top three is a female then the 3

rd Vice President must be a female for

affirmative action

POSITION ALLOCATION

One of the top 4 Position President, 1, 2 and 3rd Vice President must be occupied by a Female. The Position will be open for nomination on the floor if none of the top 3 is a Female and no Female has applied for it.

e) Secretary for Women Affairs must be a female and must have been on UPSSA National Executive Committee for at least one elective term.

NOMINATION

i.The nomination forms may be picked from the Returning Officer, or down loaded from the internet

ii. The candidate, nominator and seconder must be coming from different districts (chairpersons and secretaries)

iii. The nomination form must be signed by the Chairperson and Secretary of the nominating and seconding districts

iv. Upon closure of nomination, if a position has not attracted any candidate, such a position will be filled by nomination on the Election Day

vi. Nomination and secondment of National Executive must only be done by Districts.

post.Title: EXTENSION OF USSSA ONLINE REGISTRATION
post.Content:
Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) executive  has announced an extension of the Online registration deadline for the 2024. The extension is aimed at ensuring that all eligible athletes  do not miss out on the opportunity to register.

The original deadline for registration was February 29, 2024, but this has now been extended to March  7, 2024. The  Chief Executive Officer of  USSSA,Mugisha Christopher Banage  urged games teachers  and Headteachers to take advantage of this extension and ensure that all eligible athletes  are registered.

REGISTERED-SCHOOL-FOR-2024-1ST-RELEASEDownload

“USSSA has extended the period of registration…to accommodate more athletes that had not been able to register by the end of the initial deadline of 29th February 2024,” Mugisha noted.  According to USSA statistics, by the original registration deadline, a total of 12000 athletes  have  been registered across all disciplines . However, specific figures for each discipline were not disclosed.

With the registration extension, schools have until June 7th to register candidates without any additional fees. surcharge.

It is important for schools to note that no athletes  will be allowed to register after March 7th 2024 apart from Senior Five students.

For assistance Contact
