post.Title: Schools Receive Boost with Zakayo Balls Ahead Of Zonal Qualifiers
post.Content:
Both Secondary (3) and Primary (2) schools received a boost ahead of the 2024 District and Zonal games. FUFA Executive member Rogers Mulindwa donated the FUFA official match ball “ZAKAYO” to the Luweero district-based schools and urged the institutions to prepare well ahead of the Fresh Dairy Games.

Bombo SSS was welcomed back into the games after their recent absence. Mulindwa noted how the school was a powerhouse producing excellent athletes and urged them into active and competitive football.

Other schools were Bombo Valley View SS, Agape Christian High School, Bombo Umea Primary School, and Katikamu Soccer Primary School all in Luweero District Football Association.

Mulindwa also urged both girls and boys to maintain hard work and discipline in academics adding that the best player is the well-schooled.

post.Title: USSSA Volleyball instructor to Officiate at the All Africa Games in ghana.
post.Content:
USSSA Volleyball instructor to Officiate at the 13th All Africa Games

Innocent Komakech, USSSA Chairman Technical Committee Volleyball has been appointed to officiate at the 13th All Africa Games- Accra 2023 slated to take place in Ghana from 9th to 24th this month.

The USSSA is delighted upon Innocent's appointment as it is a symbol of appreciation for his unmatched dedication, skills, positive impact in volleyball and the Sports world as a whole.

His participation in the 13th All Africa Games-Accra 2023 is a great opportunity to scale him to new heights in the sport in terms of experience and new developments in the game.

This will proportionally be passed on to the young generation through the USSSA Capacity building Program trainings.

Innocent Komakech is also an instructor of the USSSA Capacity building Program where he has overseen over 250 volleyball referees undertake the Volleyball Refereeing course in Kibuli on 5 occasions and also during the USSSA ball games II.

Much excitement is in the air ahead of future USSSA competitions and training programs as the bar of officiation will be raised even higher baring the experience Komakech will have beefed up on the forthcoming weeks.

post.Title: Careers: USSSA Marketing Manager
post.Content:
Are you passionate about sports and marketing? Do you thrive in dynamic environments where creativity meets strategy? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

Serial: USSSA/Careers/HRDMC202403/001

Job Opportunity: Marketing Manager         

The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Marketing Manager to join our team. USSSA is a leading organization that oversees more than 19 sports disciplines in schools across Uganda, promoting sports excellence and fostering talent development.

Position: Marketing Manager
Location: Kampala, Uganda
Salary: UGX 1.2M per month
Report to: Director Marketing, IT and Communications

Job Description:

As a Marketing Officer at USSSA, you will play a crucial role in promoting our organization's mission and expanding our reach within the community. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing Marketing Strategies.
  • Coordinate Content Creation, promotional, and branding materials.
  • Digital Marketing.
  • Partnership Development.
  • Event Promotion.
  • Market Research.
  • Reporting and Analysis

Qualifications & Skills

As a Marketing Officer at USSSA, you will play a crucial role in promoting our organization's mission and expanding our reach within the community. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or related field.
  • Proven experience in marketing, preferably in the sports industry.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
  • Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms.
  • Knowledge of the Ugandan School Sports landscape is a plus.
  • Organizational skills and leadership;
  • Relational skills;
  • Creativity
  • Good analytical, observational, and anticipatory skills and decision-making.

To apply, please send your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you're the perfect fit for this role to careers@usssaonline.com by Friday, 15th March 2024.

Christopher Mugisha Banage
CEO - Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association

post.Title: All African Games 2023: USSSA Products Watch
post.Content:
By Jude Atwiine (Photos by FUFA Media)

The Under-20 Men's National side commenced their quest for gold at the 13th Edition of the All Africa Games-Accra 2023 last evening with an inspired victory over Nigeria thanks to two super strikes by Usama Arafat and Ivan Irinimbabazi.

The game saw several very familiar faces from the USSSA National Boys Championship- 2023 take center stage and play a pivotal role in what was a sweet revenge over the Young Eagles.

In the 33rd minute, Allan Oyirwoth ( previously a student at Amus College School) sparked off an attack from deep within his own half to set up Usama Arafat for the first goal of the tournament for Coach Morley Byekwaso's side.

With Uganda enjoying a lion's share of the ball possession, the Nigerians capitalized on a corner kick which leveled matters for the contest. This set up an even clingy second stanza with both sides looking to find a winner but there was always one inspired side.

The 81st minute was bound to see Usama Arafat ( former student at St. Mary's Boarding School kitende) present a clear-cut chance in the hands of Ivan Irinimbabazi who made no mistake but to restore Uganda's lead.

Here's a list of players that were involved in the clash and their schools

Ronald Madoi -(St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende)
Rogers Torach - St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
Allan Oyirwoth - Amus College School (previously)
Jonah Patrick Kakande - Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga ( previously)
Hakim Mutebi - St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
Enock Luyima- St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
John Innocent Kisolo - St. Henry's College Kitovu
Shamulan Kamya - Royal Giant High School

With these youngsters' involvement in the ongoing championship in Ghana, there is a clear path for the development of talents all from school sports to professional level.

As a result, all eyes will be on the USSSA National Boys Championship- 2024 in Masaka to watch out for the next crop of players to step on the big stage.

Meanwhile, Uganda leads Group B by three points, same as Senegal who won 1-0 against South Sudan on the same day.

The Uganda Hippos will return to action on Monday, 11th March 2024 against Senegal at the same venue.

post.Title: Ugandan schools know opponents for ISF WSC Volleyball this April
post.Content:
The Ugandan schools that will be participating in the International School Federation(ISF) championship have today been drawn into groups.

International School Sport Federation (ISF) is an international non-profit sport organization, acting as the umbrella organization and governing body for national school sports organizations around the world, organizing sports, and educational events for youth from 12 to 18 years old.

Recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) in 1995, the ISF currently consists of 134 members over the five continents organizing over 10 events per year, and has more than 30 different sports included in its competition programme.

Besides its sports events, ISF also creates and delivers quality education and capacity-building activities for physical education teachers, national school sports representatives, coaches, officials, and students around the world.

Namugongo Secondary and Vocational School, Bukedea Comprehensive School, and Standard High Zzana will represent Uganda at the ISF WSC Volleyball.

The championship is scheduled to take place in the Serbian capital, Belgrade from 19th to 29th April 2024.

The 3 boys’ teams have been drawn in groups D, E and G. Namugongo Secondary and Vocational School will face sides from Bulgaria and Georgia in group E, Bukedea Comprehensive in group G Alongside schools from Chinese Taipei, Cyprus and Bangladesh while Standard High School is drawn in group D to face sides from Germany, Iran and Belgium.

Bukedea Comprehensive School is the only girls' school that will represent in Belgrade and will face Germany, Italy, and Georgia.

The school qualified after a good performance at the FEASSSA games that took place in Huye Rwanda in August 2023.

Namugongo Secondary and Vocational School were 1st runners up after losing the final to the Kenyan side but they emerged as the best Ugandan side.

“We have a group of 17 members,13 students and 4 officials that is ready to travel because all documents have been acquired and we are now focusing on training. The students are training every day after classes at 3:00 pm to 6:00 pm and we are ironing out the mistakes that cost us the trophy in Rwanda last year”. Lubega Pius, Games’ Teacher at Namugongo Secondary and Vocational School.

“Our target is to make the final and emerge champions, we understand that being an international we must do a few things differently but this is possible”. Lubega Pius concluded.

Draws

Groups

  • A: France, Denmark, and Mexico
  • B: Serbia, P.R. China, Saudi Arabia, Netherlands.
  • C: Italy, Austria, Montenegro and Luxembourg.
  • D: Germany, Iran, Standard High Zzana, and Belgium
  • E: Bulgaria, Georgia, and Namugongo Secondary and Vocational School
  • F: Turkey, Chile, and Libya
  • G: Chinese Taipei, Cyprus, Bangladesh, and Bukedea Comprehensive School
  • H: Greece, Czech Republic, and Bahrain

Other ISF Championships to take place in 2024 include:

  • May -ISF WSC Cross Country in Nairobi, Kenya.
  • May -ISF WSC Basketball in Macao, China.
  • June -ISF Football World Cup in Dalian, P.R China
  • October-ISF Gymnasiade in Manama, Bahrain.

post.Title: USSSA PRODUCTS Watch: Amus Starboy strikes Uganda into the Semi-Finals
post.Content:
All African Games 2023 |By Jude Atwiine (Photo by FUFA Media)

The Uganda Hippos continued with their impressive start into the 13th All Africa Games-Accra 2023. The lads showed up with another fine display against the young lions of Teranga to ensure they collected maximum points on the night. 

The under-20 men's National team had to wait until the twenty-sixth minute when Usama Arafat was brought down in the forbidden area which earned them a penalty. Allan Oyirwoth was lucky to hit the rebound after his initial shot was saved by the Senegal goalkeeper.

The Senegalese responded by piling a lot of pressure on the Ugandan wall marshaled by Captain captain Torach Rogers. Royal Giants High School goalkeeper Shamulan Kamya was forced into making a very fine save from a Senegal free kick in the dying minutes of the first stanza.

The Hippos managed to keep the Senegalese at bay for the rest of the match, they now top the group and have already made it to the semi-finals.

In a game won by simply fine margins, the USSSA PRODUCTS continued to shine. 

Allan Oyirwoth (previously a student at Amus College School) made his second successive start in the championship. He is well known for his goal-scoring prowess from the USSSA National Boys Championship- 2023, to the FEASSA games in Huye Rwanda, and at the ISF Football championship in Morocco. He had his strike from the penalty spot initially saved but was lucky to make amends with a rebound. His goal proved to be a winner for coach Morley Byekwaso's side

Shamulan Kamya a student at Royal Giants High School getting his first start at the games replacing Abdu Magada who sustained an injury. Kamya showed no nerves as he was forced into making a very fine save in the dying minutes of halftime. A simple touch on the ball parried the ball onto the crossbar bar keeping Uganda in the lead hence preserving his clean sheet.

Hakim Mutebi, a student at St. Mary's Boarding School kitende made his second cameo for the hippos at the full hour mark replacing Kakande Patrick Jonah. Hakim provided the team with freshness and a different sense of control on the game. 

Other players involved on the matchday besides their schools.

  • Rogers Torach - captain fantastic from St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
  • Ronald Madoi - a former student at St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
  • Ivan Irinimbabazi - a former student at Royal Giant High School
  • Kakande Jonah Patrick - a former student at Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga
  • Enock Luyima- ( unused substitute) St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende
  • John Innocent Kisolo - St. Henry's College Kitovu

The Hippos are off to a flying start in the championship and will look to go one better than they did in the AFCON finals in 2020.

Meanwhile, the Queen Cranes will be in action in Cape Coast for their second game.

post.Title: ALL AFRICA GAMES 2023: USSSA PRODUCTS WATCH
post.Content:
All African Games 2023 |By Jude Atwiine (Photos by FUFA Media)

The Queen Cranes made their mark in the 13th All Africa Games-Accra last evening against Tanzania in the Junior East African Derby.

Under the bright stadium lights of Cape Coast, the anticipation was palpable as the teams took their positions. The whistle blew and the game sprang to life with both sides eager to stamp their authority on the match from the get-go.

Midfield battles became a heartbeat of the dugout as players clashed with a mix of skill and determination, each pass and move building the story of a thrilling encounter. 

In the 41st minute, Margaret Kunihira pounced on a well-threaded pass from Zaina Nandede to give coach Sheryl Botes' side a deserved lead. 

However, a disappointing end was always on the cards with the Queen Cranes failing to capitalize on their chances on several occasions. The Tanzanians salvaged a draw with one minute to the end of the regular ninety minutes.

With the Queen Cranes failing to start their campaign on a high note, it was rather eye-watering to watch very familiar faces from the Fresh Dairy Games 2023 and the just concluded USSSA Elite Games-  Jinja 2024. 

The team's Skipper on the night, a very fast-paced winger from St. Noa Girls' School Catherine Nagadya was one of those who caused several problems to the Tanzanians' defense, especially with her pinpoint deliveries from set pieces.

Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga was well represented on the night with three of their players making it into the starting eleven on the night. Showstopper Sharon  Kaidu, Latifah Nakasi, and  Shamsa Najjuma who were all influential in the game.

Here's a list of players involved on the matchday and their respective schools

  • Shamsa Najjuma - Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga 
  • Catherine Nagadya - St. Noa Girls' School
  •  Phiona Nabulime - Kawempe Muslim SS  
  • Latifah Nakasi - Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga 
  • Juliet Nalukenge - ( previously at Kawempe Muslim SS)
  • Sharon Kaidu-  ( previously at Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga)
  • Krusum Namutebi - Kawempe Muslim SS
  • Kebirungi claire Hilda- Kawempe Muslim SS
  • Cecilia Kamuli - King of Kings SS

Some of these faces will be available to represent their schools in the upcoming Fresh Dairy Girls Football Championship 2024 in Luweero district but also new youngsters will be expected to make a mark on the stage.

Meanwhile, the Queen Cranes will hope to get their first win on Tuesday as they face Ethiopia  at the same venue

post.Title: Invitation for USSSA Media Rights: Invitation for Media Stakeholders to Broadcast USSSA Sports Events
post.Content:
Courtesy Image

Dear Esteemed Media Stakeholders,

The Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) is extending a cordial invitation to all media houses interested in broadcasting our thrilling sports events live. As an organization dedicated to promoting sports in schools across Uganda, USSSA is committed to fostering partnerships with esteemed media entities to amplify our reach and impact.

About USSSA:
USSSA oversees a diverse array of sports disciplines across secondary schools, totaling over 19 sports activities. Our mission extends beyond mere competition; we strive to identify, nurture, develop, train, and promote sports talent at the grassroots level, laying the foundation for a vibrant sports culture in Uganda.

Objectives of Partnership:
Through collaboration with media houses, USSSA aims to achieve the following objectives:

  • Increase awareness of school sports to all citizens of Uganda
  • Increase awareness of USSSA's initiatives and endeavors.
  • Enhance engagement and participation in USSSA activities.
  • Foster loyalty among USSSA's fans and stakeholders.
  • Showcase USSSA's achievements, stories, and values to a wider audience.
  • Attract sponsorships, donations, and partnerships to support USSSA's mission.
  • Promote sports literacy through school sports

Our Championships/Events:
USSSA hosts a series of prestigious events throughout the year, including but not limited to:

Terms of Partnership:
Media houses collaborating with USSSA will enjoy the following privileges:

  • Access to all USSSA championships and events.
  • Exclusive rights to broadcast from selected game venues/pitches.
  • Collaboration in scheduling games to optimize coverage.
  • Joint efforts in seeking sponsorships and partnerships to support USSSA's initiatives.

Selection Criteria:
Media houses will be selected based on the following criteria:

  • Credibility, trustworthiness, and influence in the media industry.
  • Editorial standards, policies, and values aligning with USSSA's objectives.
  • Relevance and appeal to USSSA's target audience.

Get Involved:
If your media house shares our passion for sports development and wishes to be part of USSSA's journey, we invite you to express your interest and submit your proposal outlining your capabilities and commitment to our shared goals.

For inquiries and submissions, please contact us at usssa2002@gmail.com and admin@usssaonline.com.
Thank you for considering this invitation. Together, let's bring the excitement of school sports events to screens across Uganda and beyond.

Christopher Mugisha Banage
CEO - Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association

post.Title: USSSA products shinning for team Uganda at 13th African Games in Accra.
post.Content:
USSSA products shinning for team Uganda at 13th African Games in Accra.

The African games happening in Accra, Ghana have been a good place for USSSA products to show their skills and talents. The games that kicked off on the 4th March will go on until 24th March. The Ugandan contingent of 17 disciplines is nothing short of students who have been through USSSA games while others are still students in various schools.

Badminton

Husina Kobugabe and Gladys Mbabazi secured Uganda’s first gold medal at the ongoing African Games in Accra, Ghana on Sunday after winning the badminton Women’s Doubles final when they overcame Algeria’s Halla Bouksani and Tanina Violette Mammeri in straight sets.

Husinah Kobugabe beat Kate Foo Kune from Mauritius to qualify for the singles semi-final stage while Fadilah Mohammed also qualified for semi-final.

“They have sacrificed a lot and played gallantly” Head Coach, William Kabindi said to Kawowo Sports reporter, Isabirye David

Two Ugandans Tracy Naluwooza and Gladys Mbabazi did not progress past the quarter final stage.

Table Tennis

Officials

Men

1. Jonathan Senyonga (Mbogo College)

2. Samuel Ankunda (Kibuli SSS)

Ladies

1. Jemimah Nakawala (Kibuli SSS)

2. Parvin Judith Nangonzi (Kibuli SSS)

3. Shanitah Namaala (Mbogo High School)

Nangonzi Judith Parvin from Kibuli SS won two of her three singles games against Moises Nema from Angola (3-0) and Zoglami Mariam from Tunisa (3-2) but fell to Egyptian Helmi Yousra (3-0).

Nakawala Jemimah from Kibuli SS beat Mihindou Ruth from Gabon (3-0) and lost to Garci Fadwa from Tunisia (0-3)

During doubles Nsereko Sharif and Naamala Shanitah beat Cindani Sheldon and Gamago Beria from Congo,Ssenyonga Jonathan and Nangozi Parvin beat the Kenyan pair of Mutua Brian and Lisa Nasimiyu(3-1)

 “Ssenyonga Jonathan will require more esxposure,Ankunda Samuel should understand that planning for each game is very important while all the female players must improve on theior footwork going forward”. Jjagwe Robert, the team manager and President Uganda Table Tennis Association as noted in his report.

Capacity Building

Handball Instructors Aziz Yakoub is the head coach of the women handball team and is being deputized by fellow instructor Jimmie Remmie.

The handball games that start on 14th March will see Uganda face Cameroon,D.R Congo and Mali in the group stages at Bortyman Sports complex. Patrica Arago , as student at Kawanda SS is also part of the 13-man team.

“We have prepared well and expect a competitive championship. The players are physically and mentally ready for the task at hand” Yakoub as he spoke to Kawowo Sports reporter David Isabirye.

Volleyball Refereeing instructor Komakech Innocent is also officiating at the games as well as Badminton's Harriet Nattabi.

post.Title: Stakeholder Engagement: USSSA Holds Successfully Live Streaming And Broadcasting Meeting.
post.Content:
By Wycliffe Musinguzi

The one-day session was aimed at educating headteachers and games teachers about the objectives, importance, and advantages of live streaming, broadcasting, and media relations.

In a meeting held today at USSSA offices at GNS Plaza, over 35 participants who were mainly headteachers and games teachers of different schools managed to attend.

The meeting was chaired by USSSA President Justus Mugisha together with the CEO Christopher Mugisha Banage, President Emeritus Patrick Okanya, and Omaria Bosco the communications and marketing director who presented the session to the heads of the school.

"We have invited you here to plan a way on how we can cooperate to give mileage to the schools that participate in our championships," said the CEO Christopher Mugisha during his opening remarks.


Christopher Mugisha Banage , USSSA Chief Executive Officer addressing the meeting

"Sports investment is expensive and we applaud schools who put in resources and time to develop the students’ talents" Justus Mugisha, President.
"However, schools who have plans, targets, and aims have benefited in sports, with media especially this innovation we are bringing on table of the live streaming and broadcasting will multiply your benefits" Mugisha added

Justus Mugisha ,USSSA President during the meeting

The heads were taken through the objectives of the program which include an increase in awareness, visibility, sponsors and partners attraction, and many more.

The importance of the innovation includes increased reach and accessibility, monetization opportunities, cultural and social impact, real-time interaction and engagement, and more others as explained by Omaria Bosco.

The facilitator urged schools to utilize this program by using students who are passionate about media to create human resources and also send more students for capacity-building training so that they can be equipped with knowledge.

He further explained to teachers the advantages of the program including visibility giving an example of Bukedea Comprehensive which had a total enrollment of 600 students but after excelling in different championships, 784 students were enrolled in senior one only this year.

The teachers have embraced the idea and are ready to put into action what they have been taught today.

Following this training schools will now be able to live stream and broadcast their games and events on their media platforms.

post.Title: USSSA Products Watch : Hakim Mutebi Steers Uganda Into a Maiden Final
post.Content:
The Uganda under-20 men's national team, the Hippos passed the Champions mentality test last evening as they fought back from a two goal deficit against Congo in the Men's football semi-final at the All Africa Games in Ghana

Uganda booked a slot in the final after defeating Congo 4-2 thanks to second half goals by Bruno Bunyaga who scored a brace, Abbas Kyeyune and Hakim Mutebi.

Having suffered a very slow start in the first half, the boys found themselves with a huge load of work to breakdown the congolese defence whose striking line too had the hippos trailing by two goals.

However, one man was ready to rise to the occasion. From Uganda Martyrs Primary School Lubaga to St. Mary's Boarding School Kitende, Hakim Mutebi was the final piece to complete the puzzle for tactician Morley Byekwaso side.

Hakim brought the mental toughness to the game having replaced former Royal Giants High School starlet Ivan Irinimbabazi just at the start of the second stanza. Hakim came in with that much needed extra desire and maturity to this young side to stage a come back in a game where the Congolese thought they had put out of reach for team Uganda.

At a very young age, Hakim boosts having quite a number of gold medals in his bag already. Having won the USSSA National Boys Championship in Fortportal 2023, he followed it up with the FEASSA Boys Football gold medal the same year in Huye Rwanda. Hakim closed the year by adding the CECAFA under 18 Boys Championship Kenya-2023 trophy to his cabin with an MVP accolade too. How many eighteen year olds can say the same?

Having come through the ranks of football development in the country, and now looking forward to bolster his trophy cabin with the All Africa Games - 2023 gold . Hakim is whole definition of progress, resilience and hardwork.

The USSSA National Boys Football Championship 2024 is just a blink away and the qualifiers are already in top gear in various regions across the country. With Masaka Secondary School the centre stage of this action, who will be the next Hakim Mutebi coming through the ranks?

Meanwhile, the Uganda hippos will continue their pursue for gold with the last hurdle at the 13th African Games on Friday as they take on hosts Ghana who beat Senegal 1-0 last evening.

post.Title: UPSSA DECIDES 2024
post.Content:
The Uganda Primary Schools Sports Association acquired a new leadership team for the term 2024 to 2028. This follows the successful voting process which transpired during the UPSSA Elective Assembly at Front Page Hotel Zzana on Thursday 21st March 2024.

The event was meant to provide platform for the UPSSA Delegates to elect the National Executive Committee of the association for the next 4 years. Delegates from allover the country, from all the 19 Zones were present to make their votes count. The Zones are Central, Kampala, Kigezi, Bukedi, Busoga, Ankole, Masaka, Lango, Luweero, Bunyoro, Rwenzori, Teso, Sebei, Acholi, Bugisu, Mukono, Mpigi, Wakiso and West Nile.

The Elective Assembly was graced by Sammy Odong the Assistant Commissioner Physical Education- Ministry of Education and Sports who was the chief guest. Grace Abalo the Senior Education Officer accompanied the Commissioner.

Other officials that were present at the UPSSA Elective Assembly include: Justus Mugisha - President, USSSA Hajji Twahil Kiteezaala -1st Vice president USSSA Mugisha Christopher Banage - CEO, USSSA Gilbert Orikiriza - Desk Officer For Primary Physical Education and Sports, Ministry of Education and Sports Patrick Okanya - President Emeritus and UPSSA returning officer

Sammy Odong, the chief guest emphasized and stressed the importance of the association among other factors.

"Primary is the base, so as the ministry we take this organisation so seriously. I thank you for going through the constitutional review that led to this here. Sport is for everyone so if you are coming in to serve please serve voluntarily with the whole of your heart."

The president of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association Justus Mugisha was overjoyous and greatful on making the opening remarks of the assembly.

"It was a great pleasure for the USSSA and the Ministry of Education and Sports to organize and mobilise resources for this transition of UPSSA. The new leadership will face very many challenges but as the USSSA we shall be there to guide and help because we have also faced the same challenges and designed solutions."

However, all these preceded the core purpose of the day. The voting process followed with returning officer Patrick Okanya taking complete charge in the activity all deemed 'fair and transparent. The results and various positions are presented in the next article.

post.Title: UPSSA EXECUTIVE COMMITEE 2024-2028 ELECTED
post.Content:
The Uganda Primary Schools Sports Association ( UPSSA) entrusted the stewardship of the association for the next four years into the hands of the newly elected members through voting during the UPSSA Elective Assembly. The voting was manned by Patrick Okanya the returning officer together with his electoral team.

All the UPSSA delegates in attendance participated in the electoral process right from briefing to casting to tallying, counting and announcement of the results.

No sooner had the votes been tallied than the returning officer announced the outcome of the process that was more than transparent. Here is the new look UPSSA Leadership .

Mwomweezi Joshua - National coordinator SNE

Therefore with the new Executive Committee put in place the Uganda primary Schools Sports Association can only scale to greatness.

post.Title: USSSA DISTRICT QUALIFIERS 2024: BUKEDEA THWART AMUS DOMINANCE IN THE BUKEDEA DERBY
post.Content:
The district qualifiers are part of the road map to the USSSA National Boys Football Championship- Masaka 2024 and the Fresh Dairy Games Girls Football 2024. The Bukedea district final to determine the district champion was played on the 22nd March 2024 at the Bukedea Primary Ground. The two jumbos of Bukedea region, Amus College School and fast-rising Bukedea Comprehensive School looked horns at either front that is boys and girls gold encounter.

As anticipated, the match attracted hundreds of spectators which thus further enhanced the context of the much heated Bukedea derby. Bukedea primary ground was already filled to the brim by afternoon with very anxious and passionate fans already chanting team songs.

The behemoth kicked off with the girls category where Amus College put their mark by sidelining Bukedea Comprehensive 2-0 thanks to strikes in either half by Tamis and Dorine. This set the tone for the contiguous contest in the boys Football category.

post.Title: USSSA District Qualifiers: Alliance High and Green Light Islamic Bag Gold
post.Content:
The qualification rounds for USSSA National Football Championship- Masaka 2024 and Fresh Dairy games are getting hotter with each passing round as all teams are oozing quality and desire.

The latest of champions is Alliance High School who won the girls football trophy and Greenlight Islamic Secondary School- Kasengejje who lifted the boys football trophy for Nansana zone. Alliance beat St. George High School - Wakiso 7-0 to clinch the girls title while the latter beat London College School Nansana in the Nansana derby. The finals were played at Kabaka Kyabagu stadium before a swarm of very lively spectators all over.

PHOTO: Alliance High School pose with their trophy.

Alliance put up a five star performance having scored 3 times inside the opening first fifteen minutes of the first half. The worst was yet to prevail for St. George as Alliance found no trouble playing through their defence. Following the victory, Alliance High School will face even tougher opponents from other mini-zones like Aggrey, Nsangi among others to qualify for the National finals.

In the boys duel, Greenlight Islamic got the best of starts by scoring in the first minute of the game as they halted the five year dominance of London College- Nansana. Sudaisi Kayiira got quite unlucky as the ball bounced off his shin into his own net.

Moments later, captain Junior Egesa jumped highest to head the ball from a corner kick doubling Greenlight's advantage. Maurice Okello made the game 3-0 just nine minutes into the second stanza that killed any hopes of a come back.

Akram Bin Mousa scored the only goal for London College which only proved to be a consolation goal.

Then win for Greenlight School ceased London College's five year dominance in Nansana.

Individual Awards

Greenlight Islamic School-Nansana also dominated individual awards as they had the top scorer, MVP, best goalkeeper and coach.

Girls Category

post.Title: LAKESIDE SCHOOL DEFIES ALL ODDS TO Lift Jinja trophy
post.Content:
In the USSSA District Qualifiers, Friday 28th March was a day of blitz classics at Gaddafi FC arena as either champion could not be determined in normal play time.

The champions were determined by their luck from the spot kicks.

Lakeside School Masese played out a goalless draw with Jinja Comprehensive School in regular time with both sides struggling to create clear-cut chances.

Lakeside the better side on the day were the luckier side in the spot kicks and lifted the Boys Football title having won 4-3.

In the other final, Jinja Progressive Academy girls team came from a goal down to force a draw against fierce rivals Jinja Secondary School in a very tense match played before a throng of spectators early in the afternoon.

Jinja SS led majority of the game by 1-0 thanks to an early first half goal but could not hold their nerves for the rest of the game as JIPRA piled a lot pressure on their defence.

Jinja Progressive finally grabbed the equalizer in the dying minutes of the second stanza which forced the game into penalties to get the victor.

Jinja Secondary School who were the better side for the majority of the game succumbed to Jinja Progressive Academy in spot kicks. Jinja Progressive won 3-1.

It is also vital to note that Jinja Progressive also won the boys duel in the Elite Games Boys final that was played at Kakindu stadium early in January this year.

The victory battle for bragging rights remained tilted on JIPRA side as they secured their second trophy this year

All the finalists will await to play even much stronger sides at the zonal level in the USSSA Zonal Qualifiers 2024.

The battle to book spots in the USSSA National Football Boys Championship- Masaka and the Fresh Dairy Ball Games 1 is getting even much tastier.

post.Title: Amus College School seeds dominance as Teso Zone qualifiers climax.
post.Content:
Teso zone confirmed its representatives in the forthcoming Fresh Dairy Games-Girls Football and National Boys Football Championship Masaka-2024. The zonal qualifiers finals were played at Ngora High School in Ngora District on 1st April 2024.

For Teso zone which bears four slots for either championship, it means that all semi finalists are through to the National Championship.

In the girls football category, Bukedea district champions Amus College School continued their magic to conquer the region having won 1-0 against Onset Secondary School in a closely contested final. Al Mahad Ibn Umar's second half strike was enough to seal Amus' victory.

Amus College thumped Labira Girls School 8-0 in the semi final while Onset Secondary School ejected Bukedea Comprehensive School at the same stage.

This therefore means all the four schools have booked their slots in the Fresh Dairy Games where Amus will hope to defend their crown.

Meanwhile in the boys duel, hosts Ngora High School were outpowered by Amus College School in the semi finals as Amus won 1-0.

In the second semi-final of the day, Kaberamaido district's Kobulubulu Secondary School conquered Bukedea Comprehensive School 8-7 on penalties having played out a stalemate in regular time. The boys' final date will be communicated by the Teso Region organising Committee.

Therefore Teso zone will be represented by Amus College School, Bukedea Comprehensive School, Kobulubulu Secondary School and Ngora High School in Masaka in the National Boys Championship finals.

post.Title: Goals rain in Kyenjojo as Rwenzori Zone qualifiers commence.
post.Content:
The zonal qualification matches kick started in Kyenjojo on 2nd April in Kyenjojo district. The schools are competing in both girls and boys football.

These schools qualified from districts of Kasese, Kyenjojo, Fort portal City, Kamwenge, Kitagwenda among others which make up the Rwenzori Zone.

The teams are grouped into four groups in the boys and girls category and the top two qualify for the next round as a result.

The boys matches are being played at three venues that is Katooke, Modern and Kuwiga whereas for the girls are at four grounds namely; Town Council, Iboroga, Mukore and Trinity.

.

These schools are vying for the coveted three National slots allocated to the Rwenzori region for either category at the Fresh Dairy Secondary School Games and National Football Boys Championship 2024.

Karugutu Secondary School edged Kakabara SS 1-0 in the opener for the boys category while Katooke Modern Secondary whipped Kanara SS 7-0. Westville Secondary School made light work of Kamwenge as they put a half dozen of goals past them.

post.Title: Victory Road to Nationals: Fort Portal SS and Moons Vocational indomitable.
post.Content:
Fort City's Fort Portal SS were crowned the Zonal Boys football champions as they outwitted Kyabenda SS having come back from a goal down to win 3-1 thanks to a Zilgar Ogwar hatrick.

Jordan Tugume put Kyabenda SS ahead just seconds after kick off capitalizing on Fort portal SS defensive flaws. This however invited a lot of pressure as Fort Portal SS showed that mettle and champions mentality.

Fort Portal star boy Zilgar rose to the occasion levelling matters and later running the show on their journey to championship victory.

Meanwhile in the Fresh Dairy Secondary School Games girls Football Final, Moons Vocational School defeated Nyakigumba Secondary School to lift the girls football trophy.

In a game where either team gave away less opportunities to the opponent the goal margin clearly describes how cagey it was.

However, Moons Vocational managed to come out on top as Rwenzori champions.

The Rwenzori Zone will be represented by three teams both in boys and girls category insinuating that the third place play-off winner joins the champion and the other finalist on the match to the table of men.

In the boys category, Fort Portal SS, Kyabenda SS, and Maddox SS will lift the Rwenzori flag and like wise Moons Vocational School, Nyakigumba Secondary School, and Nyakisenyi Secondary School for the girls.

Here is how teams performed (All results) - road to the crown

post.Title: USSSA Qualifiers: Wakiso Regional Games set to kick-off
post.Content:
Wakiso Regionals has always served cool and hot football vibes due to the rivalries and top talents that sprout from this given part of the country.

After holding draws for Wakiso Regional qualifiers on Friday, April 5 at Wakisha Resource Centre in Wakiso District, the championship will get underway on Monday, April 8.

This time round the championship will be hosted at St Mbaga Nadangira Zone as 32 teams vie for the five spots that are allocated in this zone.

The defending champions, Buddo SS were pitted in Group A with Kasangati High School, Kisubi Mapeera, Zana Mixed, Aiden College Ndejje, Andy Mwesigwa Education School and St James.

Having lost the Nsagi Zone finals to Madinah Islamic, Buddo SS will seek to put their house in order so as to defend their throne.

However, Madinah Islamic will be in Group C with Kitende Zone finalists Light High Seguku. In the same group is Standard High Zanna, Divine SS, Kangulu High School, Kawempe SS, Answar Moslem and St Jona.

Light High Seguku director Samuel Kiberu believes that amidst a challenging group they are ready to compete.

“The sports department has done a great job to put together a strong side. Yes, we have quite a challenging group but the team is ready to challenge and compete at this stage,” he stated.

St Mary’s Kitende is pitted in Group D alongside Greenlight Islamic SS and Entebbe’s Boston High School.

post.Title: USSSA Qualifiers: Holders Buddo register biggest win on Day one
post.Content:
Wakiso Zonal Qualifiers kicked off today Monday, April 8 as 32 teams faced off in thrilling clashes in front of huge crowds.

Holders Buddo SS clearly showed their intentions of seeking to defend the title right from day one of the championship.

The Nsagi Zone finalists played two games scoring a total of 10 goals and conceding none. They also registered the biggest win of the day as they thumped Kajjansi Progressive 9-0.

 Elsewhere, Light High Seguku secured a 6-0 victory against Kakungulu High School in one of the most entertaining duels of the day.

Abedeen Abdulkarim (brace), Benard Bagambe, Emmanuel Nabola and Peter Hire were on the score sheet as the Seguku-based side gathered maximum points.

Still with day one action, St Mary’s Kitende registered two victories in as many games played. In their first game of the day, Kitende secured a 4-0 win before beating God Cares 6-0.

The National champions used two different starting lineups in either game something that the gaffer Daniel Male attributed to testing different players.

In the ongoing championship, Kitende will try and end Buddo’s regional dominance since they (Kitende) have lost to the latter in more than two finals.

Action will continue tomorrow on day two of the championship as the 32 sides continue to vie for the available five slots for the upcoming Nationals.

post.Title: USSSA ZONAL QUALIFIERS: Kibuli faultless in bid to defend Kampala title
post.Content:
The Kampala Zone qualifiers for the National Boys football Championship-Masaka 2024 are sidling up to a delicious stage as the teams battle for the four National tickets.

Defending champions Kibuli SS have set themselves apart in group A. They lead the log with seven points garnered in three games.

Having suffered a setback on day one, Kibuli responded emphatically on day 2 with convincing victories against Bishop Cyprian Kihangire and Kazo Hill 3-0 and 2-0 respectively.

Meanwhile last year's runner up Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga are second placed in the same group having played a game less. The latter has played two games winning 5-1 against Bishop Cyprian and playing out a goalless draw with Old Kampala SS.

In the adjacent group, Lubiri SS ran riot as they beat Lakeside School Luzira a week to nil to make amends for their early morning 2-1 loss to Kakungulu Memorial School.

post.Title: USSSA Games: Kitende, Light High impress on day two of Wakiso Qualifiers
post.Content:
St Mary’s Kitende and Light High School, Seguku put up yet a thrilling show as they perfect run winning all the four games played so far in the USSSA Wakiso Zonal Games.

On day two of the ongoing qualifiers, St Mary’s Kitende secured two victories beating St Mary’s Kasokoso 6-0 in the morning before sealing the day with a 6-0 win against St Micheal International.

In the opening game, Denis Kisiriko (hat trick), Vicent Ayebale, Olimi Nyarwa, and Arafat Nkola were on target as Kitende sealed the well-deserved victory.

The two victories mean that Kitende has now scored 22 goals and is yet to concede in four games played thus far.

Elsewhere, Light High Seguku registered a hard-fought 2-1 victory against Madina Islamic in a thrilling encounter in front of a huge crowd.

Rogers Achema fired Madina Islamic ahead with a thrilling finish before Benard Bagambe and Reagan Okwi scored for Light High Seguku to claim maximum points on the day.

It has not been a great day for Nsagi Zone champions, Madinah Islamic who shared spoils with Divine College in a one-all draw.

Timothy Odwori scored for Divine College while danger-man Rogers Achema scored for Madinah Islamic.

Games will continue into day three as the groups come to an end. Quarterfinals will be played on Thursday as the championship continues to take shape.

post.Title: USSSA ZONAL QUALIFIERS: Semi final showdown in kampala
post.Content:
Kampala Zone qualifiers reached a very tasty stage in the quest to crown the 2024 boys football power house. Group stages came to a close yesterday 10th April where Kawempe Muslim School and Kibuli Secondary School came out on top.

Kawempe Muslim was exceptional topping group B unbeaten. Kawempe won all their four group games whilst scoring twelve and conceding only two goals in the process.

In their final group match, Kawempe put four past Lakeside SS Luzira in a game played at Old Kampala SS grounds credit to strikes by Nyanzi Reagan, Gatluak Buom, Ali Nasser and Kayizi Reagan. Second placed was Kakungulu Memorial School which has also been a joy to watch in the group stages.

Defending champions Kibuli SS also booked a slot in the semi finals as they came out top of group A with 8 points two better than Uganda Martyrs High School Lubaga. Uganda Martyrs H/S Lubaga will hope to go one better than last year as they lost to Kibuli SS 2-0 at the Kampala Zone finals.

Therefore Uganda Martyrs High School-Lubaga, Kibuli SS, Kawempe Muslim School and Kakungulu Memorial School will represent Kampala Zone at the National stage hosted by Masaka Secondary School.

Friday 11th will be the showpiece day as Kawempe Muslim will go toe to toe with Uganda Martyrs H/S Lubaga in the first semi final fixture whereas Kibuli SS will lock horns with Kakungulu Memorial School.

post.Title: USSSA Zonal Football Qualifiers 2024: It is All systems Go for MUKONO Zone
post.Content:
USSSA Mukono Zone Boys Football Qualifiers
13th & 14th April 2024
Group Pools:
A: St Mathias Kalemba SS, Mpoma Royal College, Quality High School, Central College
B: Mehta S.S, Vision For Africa, St Mark High School, Dynamic SS Sonde
C: Mukono Kings High School, Namagabi Secondary School, Lugazi Homeland SS, Mukono High School
D: St Julian High School, Rehoboth Integrated, Mt Camel SS, St John's Kauga
Venues: Buikwe Playground (Group A); Nyenga Playground (Group B), St Andrew's Playground (Group C), Allied Teacher's Stadium (Group D)


The battle for the three treasured slots rages on in Buikwe district this week as the 2024 Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) boys' football zonal championships take center stage. Sixteen schools from the districts of Buikwe (hosts), Mukono and Kayunga will officially kick off on Saturday, 13th April.

Different playgrounds in Buikwe district are ready to host the schools and these are Buikwe Playground, Nyenga Playground, St Andrew's Playground and Allied Teacher's Stadium.
Group pools:
Kayunga district champions St Mathias Kalemba SS, Mpoma Royal College, Quality High School and Central College.

Isaac Kitakuule, head coach of St. Mathias Kalemba SS stated in an interview,

"We shall give our best in all the matches that we have. The target is to return to the nationals.''


Mehta S.S, Vision For Africa, St Mark High School and Dynamic SS Sonde are pooled in group B.


In group C; there is Mukono Kings High School, Namagabi Secondary School, Lugazi Homeland SS and Mukono High.
St Julian High School, Rehoboth Integrated, Mt Camel SS and St John's Kauga are in group D.

Michael Kabali, a coach at St Julian High School noted,

''We shall handle every game with caution. We need to minimize the mistakes and perfect what we do best.''


The tournament will climax on Sunday, 14th April 2024.

post.Title: USSSA Qualifiers: Lango Zone qualifiers kick off in high gear.
post.Content:
By Mukwaya Arnold

The USSSA Lango Zone qualifiers kicked off on Wednesday 11th April at Apac Secondary school in Apac district. A total of 22 teams reported for this year’s edition with over 500 participants.

Last year's finalists Dokolo progressive and Akii Bua Comprehensive SS have been grouped together with the Lira City champion Mentor SS to complete group D.

The championship will run for five days from 10th to 14th April 2024. In the championship's opener Mentor S.S defeated Aki Bua Comprehensive 3-1 whereas King of Kings beat defending champion Dokolo Progressive by a goal to nil.

Amolator SS have the most threatening striking force in the tournament so far having chipped in 7 goals and conceded only two in two matches.

post.Title: USSSA Qualifiers : The final eight in the battle for Masaka Supremacy
post.Content:
Masaka zone confirmed the quarter finalists of the 2024 Uganda Secondary School Sports Association (USSSA) boys’ football qualifiers hosted in Kalangala district.

Masaka SS booked their last eight ticket after a three nil thrashing of St. Gonzaga in a game that was played at Kaala playground. Kirama John Bosco, Lubega Shabil Opoka and Lawrence scored for coach Rogers Lwebuga's side.

The long-time Masaka Zone football Giant will now lock horns with NUMASA High School at the quarter finals.

.Meanwhile, 2023 Nationals finalists St. Henrys College Kitovu will play St. Charles Lwanga Kasasa in the last eight. St. Henry's beat Mawogola high School 1:0 at the quarters.

Elsewhere, Bessed Sacrament Kimanya ousted Kabale Nsajje 1:0 in what was a very tense game where Elvis Oparwoth was on target to score the lone goal for the Masaka city football champion 2024.

USSSA- MASAKA ZONAL QUALIFIERS 2024
QUARTER FINALS FIXTURES

  1. MASAKA S.S VS NUMASA @ 9:00 AM - KAALA GROUND
  2. SSEKE S.S VS AFRICA WITH LOVE @9:00 AM- LUTOBOKA GROUND
  3. ST. HENRY'S COLLEGE KITOVU VS ST. CHARLES LWANGA S.S KASASA @ 11:00 AM - KAALA GROUND
  4. BLESSED SACRAMENT S.S KIMAANYA VS ST.JAMES S.S KYOTERA @ 11:00AM - LUTOBOKA GROUND

Round of 16 results

St. Henrys College1:0 Mawogola high. St. Steven SS Kyotera 1:2 St. Charles lwanga Kasasa Blessed Sacrament Kimanya 1:0 VS Kabale Nsajje. Green hill ss 0:1 St. Jame Kyotera. NUMASA SS 3:0 Mateete Comprehensive

St. Lwanga 1:2 SEKE SS

Bukomasimbi ss 0(0):0(3) Africa with love

post.Title: USSSA Qualifiers: Buddo, Kitende headline Wakiso football quarterfinals
post.Content:
2024 USSSA Wakiso Regional Qualifiers | Quarterfinals

  • Buddo SS vs London College
  • Kyadondo SS vs Andy Mwesigwa
  • Standard High vs Greenlight 
  • St Mary’s Kitende vs Kakungulu

It will be a busy day on Saturday, April 13 as USA Wakiso Regional Qualifiers will be entering the quarterfinal stage.

After a busy group stage that harbored 32 schools, it's now the last standing eight that will go all the way to hustle for glory.

The quarterfinals will be played at Emirates High School as well as Wakiso Muslim playgrounds. Then later in the day, the semifinals will be played at Emirates.

Holders Buddo SS will take on London College at the Emirates ground while Standard High Zanna will lock horns with Greenlight at Wakiso Muslim at 8:30 am in the morning.

Kyadondo SS and Andy Mwesigwa will face off at 10:30 am at Wakiso Musilim while St Mary’s Kitende will take on Kakungulu SS at Emirates at the same time.

With goals flowing in the group phase, fans will hope that the scoring mood keeps alive as they keep rallying behind the young talents.

The four victors in the quarterfinal matchups will equally faceoff in the semifinals in the evening on the same day.

USSSA Wakiso Regional Qualifiers | Day Four Partial Results

  • Kajjansi Progressive 3-0 St James (Walkover)
  • Aidan College 1-1 Andy Mwesigwa
  • Kasangati H/S 3-0 Kajjansi Progressive (Walk Over)
  • Cityland College 0-2 Kawanda SS
  • Kakungulu 1-0 Madinah Islamic
  • STAHIZA 0-0 Madinah
  • SMASK 1-0 Greenlight
  • Central College 0-1 Boston H/S
  • God Cares 3-0 St Micheal
  • Kasule HS 1-2 Greenlight

post.Title: USSSA LANGO ZONE : Apac Secondary School receives Zakayo.
post.Content:
By Mukwaya Arnold

The USSSA Executive committee delegate Bithola Ocukune Francis accompanied by the USSSA staff Awor Teddy delivered zakayo balls and USSSA branded t-shirts to the USSSA Lango zone executive members on the 12th April at Apac SS during the USSSA Lango zone qualifiers


The Zakayo balls where received by the Lango zone chairman Ogwal Denis in presence of his vice chairperson Alot Geoffrey, Edeu John Justin host headteacher and USSSA district chairperson Akeba James.

Bithola Ocukune Francis comments while delivering the packages,

"Our main aim of bringing these balls is to market our own Uganda sporting equipments like the zakayo balls which are very affordable. We want to improve on the talents of the young ones through providing sporting equipment.''

Edeu John Justin headteacher Apac SS was very grateful and expressed his appreciation to USSSA for the initiative.

''This will improve our school sports and take them to a whole new level,'' he added.

The Lango zone qualifiers started on 9th and will end on the 14th of April in the process to identify the schools that will represent Lango at the National showpiece.

post.Title: USSSA QUALIFIERS: Kitovu own Masaka zone.
post.Content:
The Masaka zone qualifiers came to a curtain call on Saturday 13th serving plenty of eye-watering actions to the spectators in Kalangala.

National Boys football championship Fortportal 2023 finalist St. Henry's College Kitovu grabbed the headlines having truimphed over 2024 Nationals host Masaka SS.

Masaka SS who led the game for large got the opener in the first stanza through Opaka Lawrence.

All seemed to go their way and victory was on their cards but Kitovu's Jonathan Kyalema thought differently.

Jonathan brought the game back to level terms at the full hour mark to breed hopes back into their travelling fans.

Having failed to find a winner in normal time the spot kicks were inevitable. '' time of truth!''

Masaka SS crumbled in the spot kicks handing St. Henry's College the crown after their 4-2 penalty score.

Who will represent Masaka at the Nationals?

It is key to note that Masaka Zone will table four representatives to battle for the 2024 Boys Football crown on home soil as per slots allocation.

Well, Masaka SS already had their spot beneath their armpits as the hosts. Therefore they will be joined by Masaka champions St. Henry's College Kitovu, Blessed Sacrament SS Kimanyi and zone semi finalists Sseke Secondary School

Blessed Sacrament beat Sseke SS 3-2 in a five goal thriller earlier in the third place play off in the bid to book themselves a ticket to the National showpiece.

The Secondary Schools Boys Football Championship will take centre stage this month from 26th April to 5th May 2024 in Masaka.

post.Title: USSSA Greater Mukono Regional qualifiers 2024 reach final bend in Nyenga, Buikwe
post.Content:
Quarter-finals (Sunday, 14th April 2024):

Quality High School Buikwe Vs Namagabi (Nyenga) 9 am

Vision of Africa Vs St John's SS Kauga (Allied Teachers) 9 am

St Julian Vs Mehta SS (Nyenga) 10:30 am

Mukono Kings Vs St Mathias Kalemba SS (Allied Teachers) 10:30 am

It is the final bend of the 2024 USSSA Greater Mukono boys' football qualifiers. On Sunday, 14th Apirl 2024, the quarter-finals, semi-finals and grand final will be played to determine the three successful schools for the upcoming nationals in Masaka.

The grueling group stages were all played on Saturday, 13th April 2024 at the different grounds of Lugazi Homeland, Buikwe, Allied Teachers' School playground and Nyenga community.

"We had successful group stage duels. All apart from one school turned up and there was no any sort of distraction. We are now eyeing the knock-out stages on Sunday. May the best school win" Sewaya Miti, an official from USSSA disclosed.

Quality High School Buikwe topped group A with 4 points (better head-to-head record) whilst St Mathias Kalemba SS came second with 4 points.

Vision for Africa (5 points) and Mehta SS (5 points) were first and second respectively from group B.

In group C, Mukono Kings came top unscratched with 7 points ahead of Namagabi SS (5 points).

St Julian SS was outstanding in group D with 7 points (better goal difference) ahead of St John's SS Kauga.

Quarter final match ups:

Quality High School Buikwe takes on Namagabi SS in the quarter final at Nyenga playground (9 am). At the same time, Vision of Africa will play St John's SS Kauga at the Allied SS playground.

St Julian SS squares up with Mehta SS at Nyenga (10:30 AM) and at the same time, Mukono Kings will play St Mathias Kalemba at the Allied Teachers' SS playground.

The semi-finals, third-place match and final will come later on the same day.

Three successful schools from the Greater Mukono region will make the grade for the 2024 USSSA national football championship in Masaka city.

post.Title: USSSA Greater Mukono 2024 football qualifiers conclude, successful schools determined
post.Content:
USSSA Greater Mukono 2024 Football Qualifiers (Boys):

Final: St Julian Mukono 1-0 Quality High School, Buikwe

Third-Place: Mukono Kings 2-1 Vision For Africa

The 2024 USSSA Greater Mukono 2024 Football qualifiers successfully concluded in Nyenga, Buikwe district on Sunday, 14th April.

St Julian SS Mukono won the tournament that lured as many as 15 schools from the districts of Mukono, Buikwe and Kayunga.

The victors overcame Buikwe's Quality High School 1-0 courtesy of Jahid Mwondha in the final played at Allied Teacher's SS playground.

The third place was secured by Mukono Kings Secondary School, after winning 2-1 over Vision For Africa Secondary School.

In the semi-finals, St Julian overcame Mukono Kings 1-0 having also defeated Mehta SS by the same margin in the quarter finals.

"We prepared well for this championship. I salute the players and school management, my fellow coaches for the job well done" Felix Kawooya Ssekabuuza, head coach of St Julian Mukono stated.

The winners got gold medals and trophy with Quality High School taking silver Medals and Mukono Kings for bronze.

The three top schools; St Julian, Quality High School and Mukono Kings will represent Greater Mukono region at the nationals in Masaka.

Semi-finals:

St Julian Mukono 1-0 Mukono Kings

Quality SS 0 (6) - 0 (5) Vision For Africa

Quarter-finals:

Quality High School Buikwe 0 (6) - 0 (7) Namagabi (*Namagabi SS was disallowed for using a player above 20 years)

Vision For Africa 1-0 St John’s SS Kauga

St Julian Mukono 3-1 Mehta SS

Mukono Kings 3-0 St Mathias Kalemba SS

post.Title: USSSA QUALIFIERS: Ankole zone confirms its Nationals Bound teams.
post.Content:
Finals results

Welden School Mbarara 2-0 St Kaggwa Bushenyi High School

Welden School Mbarara are the 2024 USSSA Ankole zone boys football champions after beating St Kagwa Bushenyi High School 2-0 in the final played at Ibanda CORE PTC grounds in Ibanda today Sunday April 14.

The champions were crowned by PES commissioner Rev. Can. Dr. Duncans Mugumya who officiated at the finals.

The two finalists are joined by St Augustine Minor Seminary Ntungamo and Ryakasinga CHE Sheema as the four representatives of Ankole zone in the forthcoming USSSA boys national football championship due in Masaka starting end of this month.

post.Title: USSSA KARAMOJA ZONAL QUALIFIERS: Victory road to the National showpiece.
post.Content:
Kangole Girls Secondary School from Napak district and Kaboong SSS from Kaboong district emerged triumphant in the Karamoja Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association-(USSSA) zonal qualifiers 2024.


Kangole girls sailed past the 2023 defending champions Moroto high School thanks to Trinity Akech's lone goal that came in the 22nd minute of the game played at Kaboong
SSS play ground. Akech tapped home a minus laid by Joan Iko which gave Kangole an opportunity to win her 4th trophy in the last 5 finals consecutively.

Both Kangole girls and Moroto high school will represent Karamoja zone in the fresh diary National championship to be hosted by Ndejje SSS in Luwero district.

Meanwhile in the boys showdown, Kaboong SSS the hosts of the 2024 Zonal championship cruised past Lotukei Seed in penalty shoot outs.

The finalists played to a barren draw in normal time of the game before Lotukei missed 3 penalties to play victory into Kaboong SS' hands.


Kaboong SS will re-appear at the national level after 19 years after failing to represent the the zone even after winning in 2013.

Kaboong will represent the Karamoja zone at the national championship in Masaka district.

Currently Karamoja has 2 slots for girls football teams and one slot for boys football team that represent the zone at the national championships with hope to increase on their slots this year.

post.Title: USSSA Games 2024: Kitende edges Buddo in tight final duel
post.Content:
USSSA Games 2024 | Final

  • St Mary’s Kitende 1-0 Buddo SS

St Mary’s Kitende secured a 1-0 victory against Buddo Secondary School in the USSSA Wakiso Regional Football final at Kabaka Kyabaggu on Sunday.

Kitende finally ended Buddo’s regional dominance with a narrow victory infront of a huge crowd at Wakisha ground.

It was a tight game that gave the crowd a perfect feeling of two sides in a derby fighting for glory, prestige and bragging rights.

Hassan Mubiru fired Kitende ahead with a powerful strike from close range in the 15th minute.

Juma Sajjabi’s curling delivery beat Buddo’s backline to meet Mubiru on the far post who calmed the ball before slotting home.

Ten minutes later, Buddo nearly levelled matters through George Kato but Kitende’s right back Samuel Mubiru made a timely block.

From that point it was a see-saw effort, as either side got a fair share of possession but failed to capitalize on the chances created.

In the second stanza, Kitende got two glorious chances to seal the game but Isa Bugembe and Arafat Nkoola’s effort went narrowly wide of the target.

In the last minutes of the Kitende thought they had doubled their lead through Sajjabi’s freekick but Buddo’s custodian Edrisa Wayibi made a superb save.

With five minutes left on the clock Buddo’s defensive midfielder Ntambi made a nasty challenge on Claude Makenge and he was given a red card.

The third place play off was won by Standard High Zanna who beat Andy Mwesigwa 5-4 after a two-all draw in normal time.

Wakiso Region will be represented by six schools namely; St Mary’s Kitende, Buddo SS, Standard High, Andy Mwesigwa, Kakungulu High and Kyadondo SS in the forthcoming USSSA Nationals that will be hosted by Masaka SS later this month.

post.Title: Fresh Dairy Games: St Noa edges Rines to clinch Wakiso bragging rights
post.Content:
Fresh Dairy Games – Final

  • St Noa 2-1 Rines

St Noa Girls Secondary School Zanna lifted the Wakiso Region Girls football trophy after a 2-1 victory against Rines SS at Kabaka Kyabaggu Stadium on Sunday.

Sylvia Kabene scored a brace as St Noa earned the bragging rights infront of a huge crowd at Wakisha.

The pacy forward Kabene scored in either half as the Zzana based side lifted the sixth regional trophy.

Midway the second half, Rines found a consolation through Patricia Nakato who converted from a 12-yard mark with a powerful strike.

The central referee pointed at the spot after the ball bounced off Nancy Mandela’s hand in the dangerous area.

Kabene finished the tournament as top scorer with 14 goals before she was also named the Most Valuable Player due the outstanding journey throughout the games.

St Noa will be joined by Rines SS, Hope SS Watoto and Aiden will represent Wakiso Region in the Fresh Dairy National games that will be hosted by Ndejje SS later this month.

post.Title: Mentor "Kings" of USSSA Lango zone
post.Content:
By Arnold Mukwaya

Mentor high emerged as winners for this year’s Lango zone boys football qualifiers in Apac SS.

Mentor High School reached the finals unbeaten having won 4 times and drawn once in the group stages.

Mentor defeated Otwal SS 5-0 in the quarterfinals scored and 3:1 against Amolator SS in the semi final.

Mentor clinched victory over debutants King of Kings credit to Ebal Junior's strike.

King of kings was a debutant in this tournament and managed to qualify for National championship in Masaka.

King of Kings will feel very undone as they were brilliant throughout conceding only once in the entire tournament.

Chairman USSSA Lango zone, Denis Ogwal was very optimistic of Mentor's qualification,

"Unlike in the previous years,  this time round, the Lango zonal champion, Mentor high school shall go into the nationals with high belief to emerge victorious since the brain behind the team, Geoffrey Odur, happens to be the same brain that made Lango province win the FUFA drum."

"George Abdul RDC Apac district, also chief guest pledged to support all teams that have qualified for nationals.

Other significant figures during the closing ceremony include; the chairperson ASSHU Lango zone, Executice Committee delegate Bithola Ocukune Francis among others.

Schools that have qualified for Boys Football championship

Mentor H/S, King of Kings, Wisdom High school.

On the other hand, there was also some exciting action for the girls as they were battling for the two slots allocated to Lango zone for fresh diary games in the displine of football girls.

Acaba emerged the winner after defeating St Mary's Magdalen a sister school to Mentor SS by 1:0 in the finals in a highly anticipated match.

Acaba SS defeated Adwari SS in the quarters by 4 goals to nil and Aculbanya at the semi final 1-0.

St Mary's Magdalen had not conceded any goal until on the finals

Girls football teams qualified for the Fresh Dairy games

Acaba SS and St Mary's Magdalen.

The national championship is starting on the 26th April - 5th May. Boys football will be in Masaka whereas the girls will in luwero

post.Title: ISF: USSSA President To Conduct Football World Cup Draws
Kisozi SEED ss and Highway ss kasanda send two teams each to the nationals from Mpigi zone.
post.Content:
Kisozi Seed SS from Gomba district and Highway SS,Kiganda from Kasanda district had both their boys and girls teams qualify for the national games in April 2024.

The Mpigi zone National Boys' football championship and Fresh Dairy girls' qualifiers were successfully completed at Kabulasoke Core PTC in Gomba district on 6th April.

Mpigi zone is made up of several districts namely Gomba Mityana, Kasanda Butambala and Mpigi.

The various games were played at various venues such as Bukandula, Kanoni, Kabulasoke core PTC and Kasaka.

During the closing ceremony the chairperson Mpigi Mr. Ssebanenya Vincent zone thanked the teachers who followed the rules and regulations and selected the rightful players. He also appreciated USSSA Management for sending Teddy Awori a member of USSSA Secretariat staff to help in verifying the teams because there were so many ineligible players.

The teams expected to turn up were thirty two for the boys but only twenty eight turned up while for the girls they were fifteen but only eleven turned up.


Mumsa High School ,Mityana were the champions after overcoming Highway SS Kiganda 3-1 and Kisozi Seed came third after overcoming Bulo Parents SS from Butambala.

Highway SS girls were the girls' champion while Kisozi Seed SS were second.
MUMSA High School from Mityana produced the top scorer with 6 goals Nsereko Oscar while the best goalkeeper was also from MUMSA.

While for the girls, the top score was from Shamma High School in Mityana Namuddu Phiona and MVP was from Highway SS Kiganda also the captain of the team; Nabukeera Janat.

Fresh Dairy Secondary school games will take place at Ndejje SS while the National Boys' Football Boys' Championship will take place in at Masaka Secondary School in Masaka both starting on the 26th April to 5th May 2024 respectively.

post.Title: ISF: Ugandan Schools Learn Their Opponents For ISF Football Worldcup
post.Content:
In a draws event held in Dalian City China, Ugandan schools learned who they would face in this year's edition (28th) of the ISF Football Worldcup scheduled for 17th - 27th May 2024.

The draws were conducted by Justus Mugisha, President of the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) who also doubles as President Technical Commission - Football ISF live on ISF TV.

The draws began with the girls' category which saw Uganda teams (Amus College School - Uganda 2 and St Noa Girls - Uganda 1) placed in groups C&D respectively.

Group C

  • Brazil
  • Uganda 2 (Amus College School)
  • Czech Republic
  • Canada and
  • Nigeria

Group D

  • Germany
  • Uganda 1 (St Noa Girls)
  • England
  • Ghana and
  • Kenya

In the boys' category, Ugandan teams (Uganda 3 - SMACK, Uganda 2 - Bukedea Comprehensive, and Uganda 1 - Amus College School) were drawn into groups E, F, and G respectively

Group E (Boys)

  • Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
  • Uganda 3 - SMACK
  • England 1
  • Hungary
  • Newzland

Group F (Boys)

  • Brazil
  • Uganda 2 (Bukedea Comprehensive)
  • Germany
  • Mexico
  • Turkmenistan

Group G (Boys)

  • Benin
  • Uganda 1 (Amus College School)
  • Taipei
  • Kenya

After conducting the draws, USSSA President was full of praise for the host City and Country

"It was a great experience performing a draw for 56 teams from the top 33 football countries of the world in this great city of China, Dalian". Said Justus

"The facilities here, hotels and stadiums, are among the very best in the world. This promises to be the best ISF tournament ever organized. I am glad that Uganda will be heavily represented." he added

He also noted the preparedness of the Ugandan School teams

"The five teams that will represent the country and the strongest have shown that they are capable of carrying the flag high. All five teams have already started preparing and are playing in various school tournaments," said Mugisha.
"We are very confident that the schools that will represent Uganda will put up good performances and be able to finish among the best in their different categories," he added. - Source Xinhua Net

In Last year's ISF World Cup at the Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, Morocco ( 27th Edition), Uganda was represented by two boys and one girls' school teams - Amus College, Kibuli SS, and St Noa Girls where St Noa finished as Bronze Medalist, Amus 17th and Kibuli SS 22nd. China and France emerge victorious in the girls' and boys' categories respectively.

post.Title: Highway, Nkoma SS dominate USSSA Bugisu zone qualifiers
post.Content:
The battle for qualification to the National stage in Bugisu zone came to an end as the representatives for the Fresh Dairy Secondary School games and National Boys Football championship were confirmed.

Crowds were entertained to the brim with both boys and girls football champions determined via penalty shootouts.

In the girls final, Highway SS and Nkoma SS played out a one-all draw before Highway SS got the better of the latter winning 6-5 on penalties.

On their route to the final, Highway SS eased past Magale SS whereas Nkoma SS defeated Bugisu HS 3-2 on penalties after having played a goalless draw in regular time. Magale SS lost 3-0 to Bugisu HS in the third place play off.

Nkoma SS won the boys gold after defeating Mbale Progressive 8-7 on penalties in a game that also ended 0-0 in normal time.

Ssironko SS put three past Edward SS to seal their 3rd place in Bugisu zone.

Who represents Bugisu at the Nationals?

Bugisu zone has 3 slots for the boys and two for the girls to represent them in Masaka and Ndejje respectively.

Therefore, champion Nkoma SS will be joined by Ssironko and Mbale Progressive in Masaka while Highway SS and Nkoma will lift Bugisu flag in Ndejje.

post.Title: BUKEDI ZONAL QUALIFIERS 2024
post.Content:
By USSSA

The Bukedi Zonal Qualifiers convened in Pallisa, one of the pivotal districts among the seven constituting Bukedi. Tororo, Pallisa, Busia, Budaka, Kibuku, and Butebo showcased their premier teams in a bid for glory.

On the inaugural day, the Chairperson of Bukedi Zone USSSA Mr Enyanda Dominic Maloba emphasized the need for a fair competition, cautioning against result manipulation and migration from Teso Zone. Screenings concluded at 6 pm, with no nocturnal sessions permitted. Original documentation was mandated, fostering an atmosphere of equitable play amongst participants, setting the stage for the subsequent events, including a procession through Pallisa town to Busitema University, the official launch venue.

Day two witnessed a surge of excitement with 27 boys' teams and 24 girls' teams vying for the coveted prize. Former Powerhouses like St. Peters College Tororo and Manjasi surged into the tournament as wild cards, juxtaposing themselves against lesser-known schools in the region who actually gave them a run for their money. Drawings were held to determine match-ups for the teams advancing to the round of 16.

Day three unraveled with captivating clashes as teams battled fiercely for progression. Notable encounters included Apopong Seed Secondary School edging out Ezra Memorial and Alliance High School triumphing over Luma Eastern College. Turmoil ensued with a Tororo Progressive Academy's petition against St. Paul, ultimately leading to their qualification for the Quarterfinals.

Day four, the climax of the tournament, brimmed with anticipation. In the Quarterfinals, Apopong Seed eliminated Busia SS, Tororo Progressive Academy triumphed over St. Peters College Tororo in a derby, High Light outshined Buhobe SS, and Alliance High School overcame Hill View.

In the girls' category, St. Claire Girls of Budaka, Pallisa Progressive, St. Peters Amusala, and Asinge SS showcased their prowess, advancing to the semi-finals. Alliance and High Light secured their spots in the boys' final, while St. Peters Amusala faced Asinge SS in the girls' final.

The action-packed final day witnessed a spectacle as supporters flocked Kaucho Grounds in what could be perhaps the most watched Girls finals in the history of Bukedi USSSA.

St. Peters Amusala dominated emerged as the better side beating Asinge SS 4-0.

Meanwhile, almost a mile away at Busitema University grounds known to the locals as Kalaki, High Light SS emerged victorious in the boys' category, with Alliance High School settling for second place and TOPA sealing off the third spot with a win over Apopong.


Bukedi will be proudly represented by High Light SS, Alliance High School, and TOPA in the boys' category, alongside St. Peters Amusala and Asinge SS in the girls' category.


The closing ceremony was honored by the presence of Madam Alwenyi, the guest of honor and USSSA EXCOM representative. She extended her gratitude to the Organizers, Mr. Maloba, his dedicated team, the chairperson of ASSHU, referees, games teachers, and the community of Pallisa. Encouraging the Bukedi representative schools, she emphasized the importance of striving even harder at the Nationals in Masaka and Luwero.

post.Title: NDEJJE SSS READY TO WELCOME PARTICIPANTS FOR FRESH DAIRY SECONDARY GAMES
post.Content:
The USSSA team comprising of executive committee members was led by the first Vice President Hajji  Twahil Kiteezaala conducted the final inspection at Ndejje Senior Secondary School where the Fresh Dairy Secondary School Games will be hosted from the 26th of April to 5th May.

Students will participate in basketball, hockey, badminton, table tennis and girls football. These disciplines will have both boys and girls while boys football will be hosted by Masaka Senior Secondary School in Masaka City.

The final inspection of the venues to ascertain readiness of facilities was done at Ndejje University, the main grounds of Ndejje University and within the school.

Ndejje Universirty will host football, rugby 15s, badminton, table tennis and tennis while Hockey will be hosted at Ndejje SS. There will be more basketball games at Janan SS, Bombo.

“We visited all the competition venues and we are impressed with the preparations. The facilities are ready for us and teams are expected to arrive on 26th April and depart on 5th May.We expect over 4000 students at the games. We continue praying to God to guide us through the championship so that we end these games successfully”. Okot P’Bitek, National Organizing Chaiperson, USSSA.

The opening and closing ceremonies will be held at Ndejje University main ground.

This is the first time Ndejje SSS is hosting the tournament and they are more than ready to welcome all the participants.

“We are very grateful for this chance to host these games and we promise you that all participants and guests will feel at home”. Derrick Busulwa, games’ teacher Ndejje SSS.

“With the support of the Ndejje SSS Old Students Association we have partnered with Rubaga and Case Hospitals who will provide an ambulance each and medical personel for the entire duration of the championship. In addition, our medical partner Doma medical services in Gayaza will also join the medical team”. Mrs. Eyatoru Eunice Yum, Deputy Head Teacher Admiration

The previous edition was held at Ntare School in Mbarara 2023.

Draws for all the teams that have qualified will be held on 24th April 2024.

post.Title: Namugongo Vocational and Secondary School ( UGANDA 1)qualify to the round of 16 at the ongoing International School Federation World Schools Volleyball championship2024 Serbia after winning all the group stage games
post.Content:
. Uganda 1 ( Namugongo Vocational Secondary School)  dominated the opening game against Georgia with a phenomenal win of 2:0.

First set  Namugongo vocational secondary school won 25,10, and 25,9 in the second set. In the last game of the group, dominancy was supreme as it faced Bulgaria, The first set ended 27,25 in favor of  Namugongo Vocational Secondary School, and set two ended 26,24 still in the lead.

This confirmed a round of 16 slot to the wakiso based school.  

Uganda 1 ( Namugongo Vocational Secondary School) will battle Cyprus in the round of 16 of the International School Federation World Schools volley ball championship2024  Serbia

In other games

2023 National champions Standard High School Zzana(Uganda 3 ) from Wakiso district slimly lost 2-0 to Germany (25-15, 25-13).

Bukedea Comprehensive School (Uganda 2) was edged by Cyprus 2-0 in set scores of 19-25, 15-25,

Meanwhile, Bukedea Comprehensive School (Uganda 2) and Standard High School Zzana(Uganda 3 ) will play classification games.

post.Title: 2024 Fresh Dairy National Girls Football groups revealed
post.Content:
The 2024 Fresh Dairy National Girls’ football groups have been confirmed after the draws held at the Uganda Secondary Schools Sports Association (USSSA) head offices in Old Kampala.

The draws were conducted by USSSA communications manager Bosco Omario as well as Ayub Khalifa.

The draws witnessed 48 schools pitted in eight groups each having six schools.

Group A will have defending champions Amus College School as well as Kayindu Secondary School, Acaba Secondary, St Maliki, Nkomo Secondary School and Hope SS Biira.

Shuuku Vocational, Biyaya Secondary School, Bukedea Comprehensive School, Latifa Mixed and Amazing Grace are in Group B.

Masaka Secondary School, Benyinyi Secondary School, St. Kiligwanjo, Sacred Heart and Teryet High School are in Group C.

In Group D is Kawempe Muslim, Bishop Comboni, Moyo Star, St Mary’s Magdalen, Kyeizoba and Ndejje Secondary School.

Rines Secondary School, St Charles Lwanga, YY Okot, Jinja Secondary School, Kisozi Seed School and Dynamic are in Group E.

Bon Consil, Buhobe Secondary School, Lamine College, Moroto Secondary School, Highway Kiganda and Standard High Zzana are in Group F.

Sheema Girls are in Group G alongside Bunya Secondary School, Aidan College, Labira Girls, Kihihi and Highway Sirinko.

St Noa Girls Zzana, Mukono Kings, Kangole Girls, Omset School, Moon Vocational and Mary Hill are in Group H.

The Fresh Dairy games will be hosted by Ndejje Secondary School from Friday, April 26 to Sunday, May 5.
